loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Mr. Komi G. is 31 year old. He is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for his family, Komi operates a taxi-moto business. Komi picks up passengers along the road with his motorcycle, and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Komi hopes to use this loan, through Kiva, to buy a new motorcycle.  With the profits that he will earn from his business over the next year, Komi will be able send his children to school and provide for his wife and family

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua , madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad. Los planes para con su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa y levantar los muros del otro terreno, obteniendo un patrimonio con la seguridad que requiere, ya que es insegura su vivienda por que es de tabla y de zinc, ella ya tiene un comienzo con el muro y desea terminarlo también ya que para ella es importante estar mas segura por la delincuencia Doña Esperanza se desempeña como conserje en una institución desde hace tres años, sus metas en ámbito laboral es cambiar a un trabajo mejor donde pueda ganar mas dinero, lo cual seria de gran beneficio para su familia para cumplir sus objetivos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, zinc y alambre, obteniendo una casa protegida, segura y solidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in Managua. She is a single mother of two, and her sons are now financially independent. The family plans to finish construction on their house and to build walls around their plot of land. When the walls are built they'll have the security to obtain a patrimony. Their house is made of planks and zinc, and it's not very safe. Esperanza has started the wall and would like to finish it, because it is important to her family to be safe from crime. Esperanza has worked as a receptionist for the past three years, and her goal is to change jobs so that she can earn more money. This would benefit her family and enable her to achieve her objectives. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she'll be able to buy construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, zinc and barbed wire. With these she can have a secure, solid, and protected home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build her house out of concrete

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lina Y. is the leader of a group of four entrepreneurs who live in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. She sells vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  

Her husband, Mr. P. Laveng, is employed in a garment factory, and he also can make a little salary to support the family. Mrs. Lina Y. is 27 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school. Her other child is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Silvia Estela

texts.es: la Sra. Silvia M. U. nos comento que tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad generadora de ingresos, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante, pues a traves de esta actividad logro graduarse de licenciada en Pedagogia y ha podido conseguir trabajo en un instituto de secundaria y a su vez apoyar al padre de sus hijos en la formacion profesional de sus 4 hijos, uno de los sueños de silvia es poner su propia academia donde pueda instruir a sus alumnos en confecciones de tela.
texts.en:
Silvia M. U. has told us that she has worked for 20 years at this income generating activity, which has allowed her to get by. During this time she has also graduated with a teaching degree and has found work in a secondary school. This has allowed her to support the father of her children in providing vocational training for their 4 children. One of her dreams is to have her own school where she can teach students how to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials to make clothing

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia L. is engaged in several businesses. She sells cosmetics products and recently she markets shark's oil products that can treat pimples and other skin irritations. She is also a seamstress. When she is not busy in her cosmetics trade, she makes nice colorful dress for her customers. She is 50 years old and has only 1 child. She worked very hard to help her husband to support the needs of their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more shark's oil products to sell and repair her sewing machine. She is also interested to start a new business to augment more her income.

CEVI provides their client the credit assistance that they need to run their business. Aside from that, they give all their clients trainings and insurance coverage to make their business grow.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy shark's oil products for sale

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Sa Rorn K. lives in Sam Nor Kmao village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Nhang Chaem, is a construction worker.

Although they try to work hard they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to improve the living, Sa decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to become a taxi driver to earn more income.

She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a tailor while another is a waiter in a restaurant. One is a construction worker and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for her husband to become motor taxi driver to earn more income.

loans.name: Leiloa

texts.en: Leiloa M., 53, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Leiloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy more tools and chemicals for her business and also to help with kids school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: To buy tools, chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam S. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a policeman and makes 3 USD per day, while his wife, pictured here, has run a grocery store in the market for years and earns 11 USD every day. The couple has three children: one is a student, one is married, and one is a security guard. Tam S. would like to take out a loan to purchase grocery items for his wife's store, to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
“I will do my best to achieve my goals in life,” says Emelyn D., a food vendor in a small vending stall in their simple village of Pieza Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Arellano, who is a very supportive husband. They work hard to earn a living for the sake of their two children who are presently studying in the secondary level of education.

Emelyn patiently manages her food vending business while her husband maintains their farm. She is asking to borrow loan from lenders the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital in her livelihood project that is very saleable and generates a good income that supports their daily expenditures at home. She dreams that someday, she will able to improve her business through the financial assistance of lenders and through God’s grace.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El joven Roberto M. es estudiante está por terminar su carrera profesional en leyes pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la universidad. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así terminar su profesión. 
Roberto M. trabaja en como paramédico en la cruz roja de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, este es el ingreso que obtiene para pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Young Roberto M. is completing his law degree, but doesn't have the necessary funds to pay university. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to complete his profession. Roberto M. as a paramedic for the Red Cross of Nuevo Laredo city, which provides the income he uses to pay for his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his university tuition

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.

Helen owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.

Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Nguyên Thị Phạm was born in 1951. (no: 010107010084). She lives in Luc Canh, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her brother and grandson. She has a store at home selling beer, soft drinks, confectionery, tobacco, etc. Her two sons are working away from home. Sometimes they come back home and visit their mother. Ms N. has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND. She has taken part in financial microfinance for four years. She is a group leader. This cycle of capital, she needs 5.886.000 VND to buy goods for her store. There are six other Fund participants in her group:

Lan Thị Hoàng was born in 1969. (no: 010107010087) She has three children. She is a laborer. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND. She breeds pigs and poultry too. She needs to borrow 1.526.000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

Hợp Thị Đỗ was born in 1970. (no: 010107010088). She has two children. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy more clothes..

Loan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1973. (no: 0101070100105). She has two children. She has an electrical shop. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy electrical goods for her shop..

Hồng Thị Hoàng was born in 1976. (no: 0101070100103). She has three children. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy bamboo shoots to resell. .

Chung Thị Hoàng was born in 1974. (no: 010107010082). She has two children. She is a teacher. She raises chickens too. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for the chickens..

Mười thị Vũ was born in 1971. She has a son. (no: 0101070100106). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ( or 280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Funmilola

texts.en: Funmilola O. is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She sells medicine. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell.  She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia tiene 40 años, es madre de 4 hijas, quienes aun estudian en el colegio y junto a su esposo viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado de río de todas las variedades y tamaños en un puesto informal del mercado. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 11:00am y esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 9 años. En algunas oportunidades cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas, quien la ayuda en la atención de los clientes. Y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una buena atención a las personas, sobre todo a sus caseras (clientes regulares). Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable porque sus ingresos son diarios y compra el pescado directamente del puerto fluvial a un precio menor, por lo que obtiene mejores ganancias. A Elia le va muy bien, por lo que posteriormente quiere llegar a exportar este producto a otros lugares que desconocen lo sabroso de los pescados de agua dulce. Con este, Elia ya  tiene 8 préstamos con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son todos los integrantes son puntuales y se comprenden entre sí. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pescado, para ello usará 500 soles; con lo restante mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor tranquilad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Elia is 40 years old, married, and lives in her own home. She and her husband have 4 daughters who attend high school. Elia sells river fish of all varieties and sizes from her post in the informal market. Her work schedule runs from 6am to 11am and she has been doing this for the past 9 years. Occasionally one of her daughters will come with her to help tend to the customers. What she likes most about her job is that she gets to sell and take good care of people, especially her regular clients. In addition, her business is very profitable because she earns a daily income and gets better returns because she buys her fish directly from the river port at a lower price. Elia’s business is doing very well and sometime later she wants to export her product to other places that have not experienced the taste of freshwater fish.

Elia already has 8 previous loans with MFP. She loves working with her Communal Bank because all the members are punctual with their payments and understand one another. She will designate 500 soles to purchase more fish. With the rest of her loan, she plans to build a kiosk so that she can conduct business more peacefully and securely.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional inventory of fish & construction of a kiosk

loans.name: Sokpah Group

texts.en:
Sokpah is a group of five borrowers, led by Mamadee D., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mamadee is 48 years old and is married with seven children ages 10 to 22. All his children are in school, and Mamadee himself is a high school graduate. He lives in the remote town of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mamadee’s business is wholesale wood for construction, which he buys wholesale locally and saws into pieces for use in various projects around Lofa County in the reconstruction efforts after the war. He has run his business for three years and is successful because of the way he treats his employees and customers.

Mamadee is taking this loan to purchase gasoline and engine oil to run the saw. His dream is to expand his business and, with the profits, complete his house and send his children to university, which he was unable to attend.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and engine oil for his saw

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita can be described as a generous person because she always believes that it is better to give than to receive. She is 45 years old and has already been a widow for three years. She has two children who are presently studying. Cherry, her eldest, is now 17 years old and is currently in third year college. Maricris, 16, is now graduating from high school. She is a proud parent because she sees in them enthusiasm for studying. She hopes that she will be able to give them their dreams of finishing their studies even if she is the only one responsible. 

Rosita makes a living through her retailing business since her eldest started studying. She is managing a variety store located in front of their house. In the afternoon, she sells various snacks in their village to have additional income. She had managed a school canteen but now decided to operate a general store just in their house. Rosita is now asking for a business capital loan amounting to PHP 10,000 for her store improvement. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is a good father to his three children: Evanghelyo, Priscila, and his youngest, Sonia. The children are already married.

Catalino has been separated from his wife for almost thirteen years. He started all over again when he met a woman who completes his life: his second wife. They are living harmoniously and happily residing beside his son's house at San Francisco, Alicia.

Catalino has been a tricycle operator and driver for almost ten years, earning a daily net income of PHP 200. He plans to borrow PHP 5,000 from lenders for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. He wants to increase his income and reach a bountiful life with full blessings.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen G. is from the village of Zone 13 Puli, Silver Creek, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Gretchen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gretchen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products such as chips, beverages, shampoos, candies and others in the local community. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gretchen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Nov P. and her husband.

Nov P., 22, is a requirement worker who is also hired by village to keep the farm. Her husband is a furniture maker. This young couple has been married a year and has been blessed with a small child. Nov P. finds it hard to commute anywhere, because she has no vehicle. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan to purchase an old motorcycle for touring.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle for touring

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada,  tiene 04  hijos, 3 de ellos viven con su padre y 01 vive con ella. Estudió hasta quinto de secundaria.
Lidia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años; tiene un taller de repuestos con el que brinda servicios a los autos, también compra y vende animales menores.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró animales: ovejas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en la apertura de su tienda de abarrotes en Puerto Maldonado.
Su visión hacia el futuro es abrir un Internet, un locutorio y seguir con su negocio en su ferretería y la crianza de ganado.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los prestamos porque no les piden garantías y es muy rápido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in the district of Pilcuyo, El Callao province. She is 33 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. Three of them live with the father and one child lives with her. She attended school through the 5th year of secondary school. Lidia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years. She has a spare parts shop with which she offers services to cars. She also buys and sells small animals. She told us that with her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she bought animals: sheep. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, she will invest in the opening of her grocery store in Puerto Maldonado. Her vision for the future is to open an internet café and to continue with her hardware store business and rearing animals. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is that the loans do not require guarantees and it’s very quick.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries-sugar, rice, noodles, etc

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
Consesa C. is from the village of Baritao Manaog, Pangasinan. She is 45 years old. Consesa is married and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Consesa owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business primarily earns income from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Consesa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Consesa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. Consesa is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Consesa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: F. Catherine est née en 1979. Mariée à AÏKPE Hyppolite, Catherine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 5 ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Catherine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 20 ans, Catherine vend de l’huile d’arachide et des condiments à son domicile, et aussi de façon ambulante. Catherine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé. Catherine a bien remboursé les crédits qu'elle avait reçu de ALIDé. En ces périodes, Catherine manque de moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Catherine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Catherine F. was born in 1979. She is married to Hyppolite Aikpe and is the mother of 6 school-aged children. The family has lived for the past 5 years in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Together, the couple works to insure the needs of the family. Catherine has not attended school. For nearly 20 years, Catherine has sold peanut oil and food condiments from both her house and door to door. She buys her supplies in Dantikpa, the international market in Benin. As a former client of ALIDe, she has already made and duly repaid 3 loans. Catherine is missing the working capital to meet the present demands of her clientele. For this reason she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five  50 liter containers of peanut oil.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
A sus 63 años Francisco es agricultor de oficio, vive con 2 de sus 14 hijos, que son el motivo de su sacrificio, a pesar de su edad. Ellos son Olivia de 9 y Diógenes de 20 años, además lo acompaña su esposa Brígida de 57 años, juntos viven en su acogedora casa, que es propia, y está ubicada en una apacible zona de la sierra peruana. 

Aparte de sembrar oca, papa, olluco, habas, cebada y coliflor (productos comestibles naturales de la sierra), ahora desea sembrar alverja en esta época, como lo ha realizado en años anteriores con la ayuda de su amada Brígida y sus hijos, con quienes vive y le ayudan en sus ratos libres. 
Para Francisco lo más hermoso de cultivar la tierra es ver florecer sus productos y saber que serán de calidad, luego de interminables días de esfuerzo los podrá vender a buen precio con la experiencia que tiene en cosechas anteriores. Las ganancias obtenidas serán provechosas para seguir sosteniendo a su familia, además tiene en mente empezar a sembrar en otras chacras que dejó de lado por falta de dinero y así podrá aumentar su producción para las próximas cosechas.

Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, según refiere, lo mejor de esta oportunidad es que ha logrado conseguir sus objetivos y trabajar en su organizado banco comunal donde es muy querido por los demás integrantes por su puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja y fertilizantes para la tierra, asegurándose en obtener un buen producto para ofrecerlo al mercado.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, Francisco is a farmer by trade. He lives with 2 of his 14 children, who are the motivation for his sacrifice, in spite of his age. They are Olivia, 9 years old, and Diógenes, 20 years old. In addition, his wife Brigida, 57 years old, lives together with him in his cozy house, which is his own and is located in a pleasant area of the Peruvian highlands.

Besides planting oca and olluco (tuberous vegetables), potatoes, beans, barley, and cauliflower (food products native to the highlands), he would now like to plant peas this season, as he has done in past years with the help of his beloved wife Brigid and his children, who live with him and help him in their free time. For Francisdo, the most beautiful part of cultivating the land is seeing his products flourish and knowing that they will be of good quality. After endless days of effort, he will be able to sell them at a good price, based on his experience of previous harvests. The earnings obtained will useful to continue supporting his family. Furthermore, he has it in mind to begin to plant other fields that he left aside for lack of money, and thus he will be able to increase his production for the next harvests.

This is his ninth loan from MFP. As he relates, the best part of this opportunity to receive loans is succeeding in achieving his objectives and working with his organized community bank, where he is much loved by the other members for his punctuality and responsibility in making payments. The money that he is seeking will be invested in the purchase of pea seeds and fertilizers for his land, assuring that he will obtain a good product to offer to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: La señora Maria es madre de familia de 4 hermosos hijos, tiene 48 años de edad, junto a su esposo han formado sus propios negocio. Su negocio es la venta  de ropa, zapatos, carteras, cosméticos, gorras. También tiene una pulpería, vende fármacos y otros en su casa. Ella inicio este negocio con la venta de un terreno en Esteli, y comenzó a vender trucha, pero luego se vino  ala capital y puso la pulpería y con los créditos de Afodenic ha logrado poner la tienda de ropa. Pues al comienzo fue difícil para ella ya que se dedicaba a lavar y planchar para poder apoyar a su esposo fueron tiempos difíciles por que era agotador. Pero por gracias a Dios logro la venta y todo mejoro en su vida como la de su familia. Y con el apoyo de la institución ha venido  a desarrollarse. Con este dinero desea comprar ropa escolar como: falda, pantalones, camisa, calcetas, como útiles escolares. Ya que en pocos día cursaran el año nuevo los estudiantes y desea aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is a mother of four beautiful children. She is 48 years old. Together with her husband they have formed their own businesses. Her business is selling clothes, shoes, purses, cosmetics, and hats. She also has a local store; she sells pharmaceuticals and other things in her home. She started this business with the sale of some land in Esteli and she started to sell trout. Later she came to the capital and opened the store. With the loans from Afodenic she has been able to open the clothing store. At the beginning it was difficult for her since she was washing and ironing and everything to support her husband. They were hard times because it was exhausting. But thank God she was able to sell and everything improved in her life as well as her family's. With the support of the institution, she has been able to develop. With this money she wishes to buy school clothes such as: skirts, pants, socks, and school supplies. In just a few days students will start the new school year and she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school clothes such as: skirts, pants, socks, and school supplies. In just a few days students will start the new school year and she wants to increase her sales.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is always happy because she says happiness enables her to get more customers to her stall. She is 48 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. 

To earn a living, she sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She would like to own a world-class shopping mall in the future. 

Queen hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Martin

texts.es: CLIENTE H. M. JESÚS MARTÍN CASADO CON UN MENOR HIJO DE 01 AÑO CON NEGOCIO DE TRANSPORTE, POSEE UNA MOTOTAXI, LA UNIDAD DE TRANSPORTE LA MANEJA EL CLIENTE DESDE LAS 06 DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS 9 DE LA NOCHE , SOLICTA PRESTAMO YA QUE SU SUEGRA LE HA SEDIDO UN CUARTO EL CUAL TIENE TECHO DE CALAMINA Y NECESITA EL DINERO PARA TERMINAR LA CONSTRUCCION DEL TECHO DE MATERIAL NOBLE, SE PUDO EVIDENCIAR QUE ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA YA QUE TRABAJA PARA MEJORAR POCO A POCO LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA , CUENTA CON BUENAS REFENRECIAS PERSONALES
texts.en:
Jesús Martín is married with a 1-year-old son and has a transportation business. He owns a mototaxi, which he uses to transport customers from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. He is requesting the loan because his mother-in-law has given him a room with a shabby roof, and he needs the money to finish construction with better materials. Jesús, who has strong personal references, has shown himself to be an enterprising person who has worked hard to improve his family's quality of life little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a better roof

loans.name: Gonzalo Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo es un productor que se ha desarrollado poco a poco en la actividad de terneros de desarrollo el cual ha sabido sacar mucho provecho ya que gracias a los financiamiento que ceprodel le ha brindado ha podido comprar el ganado a precios bajos y los ha vendido a precios buenos y la ganancia la ha invertido en comprar vacas paridas con lo que él ha aumentado su hato ganadero de vacas de ordeño.

Este crédito es para el financiamiento de la compra de terneros de desarrollo de un peso aproximado de unos 200kg c/u
texts.en:
Señor Gonzalo is a producer who has expanded little by little in the activity of raising calves. He has known how to do well in this business, since, thanks to the financing that CEPRODEL has offered him, he has been able to buy livestock at low prices and he has sold them at good prices. He has investead the earnings in buying cows that have given birth, with which he has increased his herd of milking cows.

This loan is to finance the purchase of calves to raise to a weight of about 200 kilograms each.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves to raise

loans.name: Emeritiana

texts.en:
Emeritiana L. is 28 and married with 1 child (1 year-old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Emeritiana has 3 years of experience in this business.  Emeritiana needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Emeritiana joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Emeritiana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila B., 50, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to M. B., a government employee, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been into managing a variety store for quite some time now. She mainly buys and sells basic commodities like groceries, rice and the like to her neighbors.

Leila has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her current product inventory

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: D. Julienne est née en 1983 à Dogbo au Bénin. Mariée à AGBOGBONON Edouard, Julienne est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Julienne vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis près de trois ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Julienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis sept ans environs, Julienne vend des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, oignons, piments, etc.), mais aussi des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Julienne s'approvisionne. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Julienne désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et se faire plus de profits. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Julienne D. was born in 1983 in Dogbo, Benin. Married to Edouard AGBOGBONON, she is the mother of three children who are all attending (or have attended) school. For the past three years, Julienne has been living with her husband and children in the Djeffa borough of the Sèmè-Podji commune. The couple shares responsibility for family expenses. Julienne has not attended school. For the past seven years she has sold sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, etc.) from her home, as well as fresh produce (corn, beans, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Julienne is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all fully reimbursed. Faced with increasing customer requests, she wishes to increase the level of her activity and make more profit. This is why she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments, corn and beans

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a widow with two children who go to school. Teopista also takes care of additional family members. She is a market vendor in Kawempe market selling banana clusters, bunches and curry powder.  She buys bananas from the villages and uses public transport to and from the villages to her stall.  She has been in this business for 30 years. Teopista wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She works six days a week and sells at retail and at wholesale.  Teopista’s business challenges include high transport costs from the villages of Masaka to her stall in Kawempe and the rainy season, which makes roads impassable.  She aspires to earn enough profits.  Teopista joined MCDT because of the low interest rate. She owns and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gilda Asunta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Gilda;   ella tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio la socia cría animales como aves de corral y tiene un auto que lo da para servicio de taxi.  Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su auto y así poder seguir alquilándolo para que le genere ingresos económicos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gilda is a member of the “RENOVACIÓN” community bank. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. Gilda is 40 years old, and she is a single mother, raising one 10-year-old son. She balances household activities with business; she raises animals such as birds for poultry, and she has an automobile which she rents out for use as a taxi service. She is applying for a loan to buy tires for her vehicle so she can continue to rent it out as a source of income. Gilda is thankful for and values the support offered to her, and she promises to completely repay her debt by the established due date.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for taxi

loans.name: Khisayn

texts.ru: Хайруллоев Хисайн проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хисайн имеет высшее образование, учитель. По специальности работал 8 лет. У него большая семья и деньги, которые он получал в школе, ему не хватило. Сейчас Хисейн занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает вещи необходимые хозяйству. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Khisayn K., 45, lives in Kulyab. He is married and has 9 children. Khisayn's wife is a homemaker. Mr. K. is a college-educated teacher. He has been teaching for 8 years, but the money he makes at school is not enough to sustain Khisayn's large family. Therefore, Mr. K. earns an extra income by selling household goods at a market. He has been selling for 10 years. Mr. K. will use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny C. is 44 years old and has three children who all are traditional musicians. She was selected by the Pou Doh village bank’s twelve members to be its president. With the proposed loan, the members of this village I. Takeo province, Cambodia, plan to use their loans to support different projects.

Mrs. Vanny C. and her husband, Mr. SokH. Tieng are farmers who work very hard to support their family. They own 1.5 hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice. I. order to increase their income, Mrs. C. will use her loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Some of the members I. the picture are partially blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal Qabani is a 35-year-old mother. She has two sons and one daughter who are 15, 4 and 1 year old. Manal is married to Khamees Qabani, who works as a taxi driver in Deir Al-Balah, a city in the Gaza Strip. 

Manal's husband has been a taxi driver for 4 years. The old car he uses needs expensive maintenance work, so he decided to sell it and buy a new one.

Manal's husband needs $2000 dollar to be able to buy a new car, so Manal came to FATEN and took a loan to help her husband, because the taxi is the only source of income for the family. 

Kahmees appears in the picture with his youngest son, Ali, because Manal comes from a very conservative family.

loans.use: Buy a new taxi

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy N. is single and sells various types of rice both in small and larger quantities at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. Mercy uses her profit from her business to pay for her accommodations and bills.  Mercy will use the loan to purchase more rice and canned tomatoes which are going to serve as additional goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to buy a real shop.

loans.use: more rice and canned tomatoes for resale

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Doña Silvia tiene 52 años D. edad tiene una hija ya granD. y está estudiando Derecho en la Universidad. Ella tiene su negocio que consiste en una Farmacia donD. da consultas y venD. los medicamentos. Con la farmacia tiene 16 años D. estar funcionando, pero le falta capital para poder surtir y equipar la farmacia, y siendo una gran líder reúne a otras once señoras y forman el Banco Comunal llamado El Carmen el cual es nombrado así por su ubicación. Lo que ella espera y sueña es que su farmacia sea granD. y poder abrir una sucursal contando con la ayuda D. Dios y D. su hija quien le brinda tambien su apoyo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 52 years old and has a grown daughter who is studying law at the university. She has a pharmacy where she gives consultations and sells medicine. Silvia has been in business for 16 years, but she lacks capital to stock and equip the pharmacy. Silvia is a great leader who brought together 11 other ladies to form the communal bank, El Carmen, which is named for its location. With God's help and her daughter's support, Silvia hopes that one day her pharmacy will be large enough to open another branch.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for pharmacy

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex M. is 41 years old and is from the town of Surallah. He is married with three young school-aged boys. Farming is the source of income for his family.

He wants to give his kids a better future. That is the reason why he is working hard on his farming business and is requesting a loan to improve his yield. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. His profit will be used to finance his children’s schooling and as savings for the future.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio Y. is from the town of Banga. He is 46 years old and is married with six children, the eldest being aged 21 and the youngest 5.

Herminio owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He says he wants his family to be happy and healthy always.

Herminio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Herminio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Wara Wara De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “WARA WARA DE LOS ANDES” (estrella de los Andes) es una asociación que está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de los Andes.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, diez socias y un socio.  Se reunirán cada quince días, para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas, permitiéndoles  conocerse mejor.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Leonarda como presidenta, la señora Carmen como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Rosemary.

La señora  Carmen es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, como tesorera de su asociación tiene la delicada tarea de controlar el ingreso y egreso de las cuotas.   Con respecto a su negocio, ella tiene un taller de costura, su experiencia en el área ya suma más de 7 años.  La señora Carmen solicitó Bs.2000.-,  esperando comprar tela.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, son variados: taller de costura, venta de pan, carpintería, tienda surtida, venta de bolsas plásticas, venta de chuño por mayor, servicio de serigrafía, venta de comida venta de mantas tejidas, macramé y tejido de mantas, taller de costura.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Wara Wara de los Andes" (Star of the Andes) is a group that is requesting a loan for the first time from the Andean central office of Pro Mujer Bolivia.  This group has 11 members: 10 women and one man.  They will meet every 15 days, for training and to make their payments, which will allow them to get to know each other better.  The board is comprised of Leonarda, who is president, Carmen, who is the treasurer, and Rosemary, who is the recording secretary.

Carmen is a young woman who is 24 years old.  As treasurer, she has the delicate task of accounting for the inflows and outflows of funds.  With respect to her business, she has a sewing workshop and she has 7 years of experience in this line of work.  She requests 2,000 Bolivianos to buy fabric.

With respect to the businesses that support the rest of the members of the communal bank, they are varied, including: a sewing workshop, the sale of bread, carpentry, a general store, the sale of plastic bags, the sale of potato flour at wholesale, silk-screen printing, the sale of food, and the sale of woven blankets and macrame.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is married to M. B. who has a grocery store business in the market where he deals with many customers every day and sells them the groceries they need. She lives with her family in a city named Khanewal in a 2-room brick house. Khanewal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. 

Zubaida doesn’t have any children, so she spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. Her brother also lives with her and works in the fields. He grows seasonal crops in their fields and earns good income on it. He contributes financially to Zubaida’s family from his earnings. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk quantities and increase his sales. He started this business 2 years ago and Zubaida is hopeful that this investment will bring better profits for her husband’s business. 

She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is from the village of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Danilo is widowed with five adult-aged children. To make a living, Danilo raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat to sell

loans.name: Jessica Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Jessica, ella tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de  10 y 7años, los dos están en escuela, su marido es comerciante. Para ella este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la Fundación Espoir.

Se dedica además de su hogar al comercio, vende bisutería y dulces como: manjar, suspiros, galletas, rompope, ella prepara estos dulces bajo pedido, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12 pm ya que a esa hora llegan sus hijos de la escuela y tiene que atenderlos. La mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que le dejan a buen precio, para que a ella le quede ganancias.
 
Este crédito que solicito lo va a emplear en comprar bisutería e ingredientes necesarios para preparar los dulces. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Las Americas" meet every 15 days.

Here we find Jessica, who is 29 years old and in a common-law marriage which produced 2 children, who are 10 and 7 years old.  Her children are in school, and her husband is a merchant.  This is her 6th loan cycle with her communal bank, and she likes it because of the assistance provided by the 
Fundación Espoir.

She is devoted both to her home and her business, selling costume jewelry and sweets such as: dulce de leche, meringues, cookies, and eggnog.  She takes orders for these sweets, and she works every day from 9am until noon, because at this hour her children arrive home from school and she has to attend to them.  She buys her merchandise at a good price from the wholesalers so that she can have good earnings.  

This loan that she requests will be used to buy jewelry and the ingredients needed to make her sweets.  She dreams of having her own house, since the home she is living in is a rental.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, milk, sugar, butter and other ingredients to make sweets, and also to buy jewelry

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a steel bender.  Maame operates a grocery store at Takoradi market, which she has been doing for two years. Maame uses the income she makes from her sales to assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She requests  the loan to purchase more groceries to fill her shop for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to open another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Elsie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Lina L., 37, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. She has finished her high school education and is married to Primo, 47, a market vendor. They have four children who are currently attending elementary and high school.

Lina presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store which caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Lina also operates from home a burger stand which she has run for almost a year now, and has gained regular customers who keep her business alive. She employs no one, and earns at least Php10, 000 estimated net income per month.

To help Lina continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php23,000 loan. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make her their number one sari-sari store in the community.  She also plans to use part of this loan to purchase needed materials for her burger stand.

Lina learns the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate her own. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients for her burger stand and additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Dadoboy

texts.en:
E. Dadoboy is 58 years old and has one child. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Dadoboy started his business 20 years ago. He has a lot of experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from a young age. 

Dadoboy would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more calves to expand the business

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo 2 Group

texts.es:
Romelinda es miembro del grupo Mi fortaleza en cristo 2, ella junto a otros micro-empresarios de la ciudad de Santiago, han decidido tomar prestamos para realizar diferentes actividades de negocios, son 5 empresarios con diferentes negocios, algunos venden productos, prendas de plata, ropa, zapatos, tienda de alimentos. Romelinda es madre de 2 hijos, ambos menores que aun viven con ella y su esposo.

Este es el cuarto prestamo de Romelinda  esta recibiendo su primer prestamos con Esperanza internacional, con la motivación de darle forma e iniciar su proyecto de negocio poco usual, pero a la vez innovador y pone mucha Fe en que con el podrá lograr sus sueños, uno de ellos es poder tener su propia casa, y mejorar la situación económica por la que en la actualidad se encuentran, sus ganancias la utilizara para reinvertir y llevar ingresos extra a su familia, ayudando a su esposo con los gastos, tiene 2 hijos. Gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Romelinda is a member of the 'Mi Fortaleza en Cristo 2' (My Strength in Christ 2) group.  She decided to join together with other small business owners from the city of Santiago so that they could take out loans for their businesses.  The group has five members who each have different businesses.  They sell products, silver jewelry and clothes, and run a food store.  Romelinda has two grown-up children who still live with her and her husband.

This is Romelinda's fourth loan.  She is receiving her first loan with Esperanza Internacional with the intention of starting up a fairly unusual but, at the same time, innovative business project.  She is putting a lot of faith in being able to achieve her dreams through this project.  One of these dreams is to own her own home and another is to improve her current financial situation.  She will re-invest her profits and use the extra income for her family, helping her husband with their expenses.  She has two children.  Thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three businesses: a sari-sari store, food vending and fish vending. Her husband Edno, who is 46 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 6 and 26 years old. Helina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy stock for her sari-sari (general) store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Helina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. Gertrude has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. She also sells fruit and water and rents out houses as an additional source of income. Gertrude has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more fish to sell. She generates additional income through selling passion juice water from her refrigerator and from her rental rooms.

The main business challenge for Gertrude is seasonality. Her goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her children and to see more profits. Gertrude lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. P. is a village bank president, she was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. P. is a married woman who was born in 1986. Her husband, Mr. Eng, was born in 1983. This couple earns their living by farming. They are farmers who rent a 1-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. In order to support and improve the rice fields, Mrs. P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay hired farming laborers for growing rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Eng also earns some income by fishing. 

This couple is working hard to support their three children: one is attending a local school and the others two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay hired farming laborers for growing rice.

loans.name: Cruz Mercedes

texts.es:
Cruz de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó su negocio cuando se separado de su marido y se fue a vivir al bastión y desde entonces realiza las ventas de comida para sacar adelante a su familia que alquilo un local en la principal de donde vive.

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 5H00 pm hasta las 11H00 pm con la ayuda de unos de sus hijos. Le dificulta en su negocio la competencia ya que hay más comedores de comida alrededor de ella. Con el préstamo quiere comprar un asadero  para aumentar su productividad. En un futuro quiere tener un gran negocio pues hay negocio más grande que el de ella.
texts.en:
Cruz, 55, is a hardworking woman who began her business after separating from her husband. She went to live in the Bastión neighborhood and from that time has worked selling food to support her family, renting a commercial site on the main road in the area where she lives. 

Currently she works from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m. with the help of one of her children. Her business faces difficulties due to competition since there are other businesses serving food in her area. With the loan she hopes to purchase a griddle to increase her productivity. 

In the future she wants to have a large business as there are those that are larger than hers.

loans.use: to purchase a griddle.

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es: Eucalda tiene 35 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mucho tiempo que se dedica a la agricultura, en donde siembra papa, maíz, habas, cebada entre otros productos, asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales. Ella en compañía de su familia desarrolla estas actividades, que le generan los ingresos necesarios. Este trabajo debe alternarlos adecuadamente, en el tiempo que espera la cosecha de sus productos, se encarga del negocio de compra y venta de animales que se realiza en la feria ganadera de su zona; de este modo no pasa alguna necesidad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabaja con dedicación porque le aire libre del campo. Su deseo  es seguir labrando la tierra, explotando al máximo los beneficios que le brinda la naturaleza para el desarrollo de sus productos. Por ahora debe procurar implementarse de herramientas para que le ayuden a tener una mejor calidad en su cosecha, asimismo incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, considera que su trabajo dentro de su banco comunal fue muy provechosa por la que se siente agradecida y seguirá comprometiéndose en trabajar por la unidad de su grupo y siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar pastizales y papa.
texts.en:
Eucalda is 35 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own home.  She has been farming for a long time and grows potatoes, corn, beans, barley and other crops.  She also raises animals.  Eucalda carries out these activities together with her family and they make her the income she needs.

Eucalda must alternate her work well.  During the time that she is waiting to harvest her crops, she takes care of her business buying and selling animals which she does in the cattle market in her area.  This means that she doesn't suffer any hardships.  Eucalda is a very responsible woman who works hard in the fresh air of the countryside.  Her wish is to continue working her land, taking maximum advantage of the benefits that nature provides her with in order to develop her crops.  For now, she would like to equip herself with tools so that she can obtain a better quality harvest and increase the quantity of animals that she owns.

This is the third time that Eucalda has received a loan from MFP.  She believes that her work as part of her community bank has been very useful.   She feels grateful and will continue pledging to work for the unity of her group and being punctual in making her repayments.  Eucalda will use the loan she is requesting to buy sacks of manure to sow her pasture and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Ta-Yagbah Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta-yagba” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business women who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to ask for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each woman in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Nanah. Nanah was born in a town called Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone, about 35 years ago. She is married and has four children. Nanah sells pepper, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and similar products. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items in large quantities to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings in large quantities to sell in her business.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con un hijo, ella se dedica a vender productos cosméticos por revista, esta venta la realiza de forma ambulante, por los caseríos cercanos a su vivienda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos cosméticos y medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes, el crédito le ayudara para mejorar el inventario de los productos.
Su sueño es que a través del trabajo, logre algún día comprarse una casa donde vivir segura con su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her son.  Her business is selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door in the small villages near her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and medicines to sell to her customers.  The loan will help her to improve her stock of products.

Sandra's dream is to be able to some day buy a house, through her work, where she can live safely with her son.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (make-up, creams, lipsticks) and medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and has five children. Virginia is married and has one child who is presently in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feed.

Virginia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Epmcc Plus Group

texts.en:
Tyty is a chairwoman of a community bank named "EPMCC Plus," made up of 23 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Tyty sells fruits and other miscellaneous items. She sells them in a market located in the western part of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1997. She has borrowed four loans from MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion, and she fully repaid them. With the next loan, Tyty will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. She will buy two sacks of mangoes to resell for a profit. Her business makes 30 USD in profit each day. One of Tyty's strategies for keeping her clients is to tell them in advance about any change that can occur in business. Her ambition is to become a fruit provider. Tyty is 30 years old. She is married and has four children between ages 4 and 18 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying two sacks of mangoes and reselling them for a profit.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.ru:
Сусанна живет в городе Капане. Она замужем и имеет троих дочерей: две дочери уже замужем и живут отдельно. Свекор Сусанны пенсионер и проживает с ними. Средняя дочь живет вместе с Сусанной, занимается домашним хозяйством и ухаживает за дедушкой, пока мать и отец работают.
Сусанна занимается собственным бизнесом: продажей женской и детской одежды, белья, а также обуви в арендованном помещении. Она работает без выходных и гордится тем, что благодаря своему собственному бизнесу может покрывать часть расходов своей семьи. Муж Сусанны, который работает таксистом, помогает ей в бизнесе и раз в месяц отвозит ее в Ереван для приобретения очередной партии товара.  
Сусанне необходим кредит на сумму 600.000 драм для приобретения летней женской и детской одежды, а также для покупки купальников, которые пользуются большим спросом в июле и августе.
texts.en:
Susanna lives in Kapan. She is married and has three daughters: two of her daughters have married and live on their own. Susanna's father-in-law is retired and lives with them. The middle daughter lives with Susanna, and she does housework and cares for her grandfather while her mother and father work. 

Susanna has her own business selling women's and children's clothing, lingerie, and shoes in a rented shop. She works seven days a week and prides herself on the fact that her business can support her family. Susanna's husband, who works a taxi driver, helps her in her business once a month by driving her to Yerevan to buy more inventory. Susanna needs a loan of 600,000 drams to buy summer women's and children's clothing, as well as to buy swimsuits, which are in high demand in July and August.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes and swimsuits for resale

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin tiene 24 años,convive con kiara de 22 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de cacao, pues se considera como un negocio con mucho auge, pues éste fruto tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Franklin siempre ha sido consecuente con sus objetivos trazados, desde luego que tuvo infinidades de barreras, pero no se amilanó frente a los problemas que existía en su camino, pero gracias a esa experiencia que tuvo, aprendió buenas lecciones en la vida. Ahora lo que más desea es poder intensificarse en la producción de este grano. Este es su primer crédito MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, podrá contratar peones para que realicen la poda y extraer la maleza que crece entre las plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Franklin is 24 years old and married to Kiara, 22.  They have two children and live together in their own house in the Pichari district.  He works growing cacao, which he considers to be a business with a lot of growth, since there is a large demand for this product on a national and international level.  

Franklin has always been consistent with his objectives.  Of course, he had several barriers to overcome, but he was not daunted by the problems in his path.  Thanks to the experiences he had, he learned good lessons about life.  

Now he wants to increase his production of this crop.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments punctually.  With the 1500 soles that he is requesting, he will be able to hire laborers to prune and weed his cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris has been operating her tailoring business for the last year in Emali town. She is 49 years old and married. She and her husband John are blessed with two children.

Stellamaris was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of cloth materials for tailoring.

In the future, Stellamaris hopes to venture into practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: To add stock of cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Erkeaiym's Group

texts.en:
Erkeaiym is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old and is married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised four sons, the youngest son is still in school, the oldest son is married and lives separately with his family, and the other two sons work in construction. 

Erkaiym is engaged in livestock breeding.  She started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 soms. From reselling the livestock,  she earns about 3,000 soms per month. Erkaiym applied for this loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture for her home. With the money received from the loan she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
To further finance the family needs, Merlita generates an income from planting various vegetables in their backyard and farm. Merlita has been engaged in this type of business for 11 years. She is not getting tired of doing her business because she loves what she does. Merlita plants creeping vegetables in their backyard such as string beans, squash and seguidillas. Merlita wanted to plant more vegetables to increase her sales and at the same time increase her profits to further support her five children attending school.
