Kapinga M.  est vice présidente du groupe de crédit  Hodari,géante avec sourire aux levres, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 11e cycle, âgée de 36 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants et tous étudient dans des écoles  normales  dont 3 à l’école  secondaire et 4 à l’école primaire. 
Son mari est  décedé  le 25 janvier 2005 à Kigali/Rwanda suite à une longue maladie de poumons. Pendant ces 5 ans, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants orphelins . 
Cette charge pèse lourdement  sur croissance rapide de son business.  
Son business est liberal, sans adresse et ambilatoire, elle  fournit des draps,des habits pour enfants, pagnes, boubous, bijoux en or aux différents preneurs  . Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité appelée "lutte-lutte pita pita".
Elle vivait au Rwanga/Kigali, où le gros de sa belle famille réside, après la mort de son mari, elle se vit sans aucune économie, elle a commencé à tisser les tricots, les napes, etc. Les revenus de ce petit métier(art) lui a permis de deplacer ses enfants orpheilns du Rwanda vers la RDCongo et les quelques  dollars qui sont restés d’une valeur de 50$ lui a permis de prendre un guest house pour s’installer. Elle a commencé à marchander avec les tomates, pétrol, sels, lait, savon en poudre OMO. Ensuite,elle fut informé de l’IMF Hekima qui donne des crédits  sans garentie, elle a béneficié le premier crédit de renforcement.
Lorsqu’ elle venait de retrouver l’équilibre, elle a été en nouveau victime d’une incendie du 08 juillet 2009 qui a brillé plus de 900 maisons dans la ville de Goma, dans le quartier populaire bidonville de Birere.
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Kapinga M.   souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achétant  6 paires des draps, sizaine de chainettes d’or (localement appele Garentie manzanza), Sizaine de robes de qualité du Congo Brazza, 6 pagnes .
Kapinga M. est  également servante Evangeliste dans une eglise locale ‘’Chist est Roi” et parfois dans un ministrère chretien de réveil “Combat Spirituel”.
Kapinga  M. est confortable avec son business, dans l’avenir, elle planifie acheter une parcelle d’heritage pour ses enfants orphelins et finir avec le status de locataire de maison. En outre Kapinga M. revet voir tous ses enfants finir les études avec des diplômes qui leurs serviront dans le futur. 
Kapinga M. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces credits  lui permet  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Enfin, Kapinga M.  a aisement trouvé le soulagement et l’équilibre  économique grace aux crédit s de Hekima, après la mort de son mari.
Le groupe de crédit  Hodari  est  composé de 15 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Kapinga M. is vice-president of the Hodari credit loan group. A smiling giant of a woman (she is seen raising her hand on the picture), currently in her 11th loan cycle, she is a 36-year-old widow, the mother of seven children all attending school: four in the primary and three in the secondary school system. Her husband passed away 25 January 2005 in Kigali (Rwanda) following a prolonged lung-related illness. She has been the sole support of her children these past five years, which weighs heavily on the rapid expansion of her business. Her business is free-style in nature, itinerant without a fixed location. She provides bed sheets, children’s clothing, pagnes and boubous (colourful West-African clothing), and gold jewelry to all who are interested. It has now been five years since she began an activity known as “lutte-lutte pita pita”. She used to live in Kigali, where most of her in-laws reside, and following her husband’s death, without any savings, she began weaving clothes and tablecloths, etc. The earnings from this activity (craft) enabled her to move from Rwanda to the Democratic Republic of Congo with her children, where with her remaining $50 she was able to settle in a guesthouse. She started to trade in tomatoes, gasoline, salt, milk, powdered detergent (OMO). Then she learned that the Hekima MFI provided loans without collateral, and she was granted her first reinforcement loan. She had just re-established some financial balance when she became one of many victims of the 8 July 2009 fire that destroyed over 900 homes in Goma, inside the Birere shanty-town. With the Hekima MFI loan Kapinga M. wishes to increase her turnover by buying 6 pairs of bedsheets, a half-dozen gold chains (locally called “Garantie manzanza”), a half-dozen quality dresses from Congo Brazzaville, and six pagnes. She is also an Evangelist acolyte in a local church (Christ is King) and sometimes participates in “Spiritual Combat”, a Christian revivalist ministry. She is comfortable with how her business is going, and in the future envisions buying a plot of land as inheritance for her children and eventually renting out as a property owner. Additionally she hopes to see all of her children finish their studies with diplomas that will serve them in their future. Kapinga M. thanks the Hekima MFI for the loans she has received without any collateral because that is what enabled her to meet her children’s needs. She was finally able to enjoy relief and financial stability for the first time since her husband’s death, thanks to Hekima’s loans. The Hodari loan group is made up of 15 members, for the most part women.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 pairs of bedsheets, 6 guaranteed gold chains, 6 quality dresses from Congo Brazzaville, and 6 pagnes

loans.name: Leposo

texts.en:
Leposo has been in farming for the last 16 years.  He plants potatoes and wheat depending on the season throughout the year.  He is 36 years old, married to Alina Maletu, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy pesticides and also cultivate his other piece of land to plant wheat.

In the future, he plans to buy another piece of land and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and cultivate an adjacent piece of land to plant wheat

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: EL SR. PEDRO NACIO EN CHUQUISACA EL 20 DE ENERO DE 1970 ES CASADO Y TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, AHORA VIVE Y TRABAJA EN SU PARCELA QUE ADQUIRIO MEDIANTE EL SINDICATO DE QUEBRADA ALVARES HACE 25 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU PROPIA PARCELA , EL SIEMBRA MAIZ , PAPA, YUCA, MANI, Y MUCHOS PRODUCTOS QUE SE DEN EN LA COMUNIDAD  TAMBIEN TIENE SU GANADO TODO LO QUE SIEMBRA LO SACA A VENDER AL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES MUY TRABAJADOR TIENE SU FAMILIA Y SIEMPRE BUSCA QUE PLANTAR SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA,  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in Chuquisaca on January 20th, 1970. He is married and has two school age children. He now lives and works on his parcel of land that he got through the Quedbrada Alvares syndicate. He has had his own land for 25 years. He grows corn, potatoes, yucca, peanuts, and lots of products that are grown in the community. He also has livestock. He takes everything he grows to sell in the El Torno market. He is very hard-working. He has his family. He always looks to plant according to the season. The money from the loan is for increasing his working capital. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Futuro Para Un Bienestar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar esta formado por 9 mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras que se encuentran agrupadas para obtener un mejor futuro para sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca localidad que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus ríos, sus escritores, la arquitectura de sus templos y edificaciones,  su exquisista gastronomía así como su gente es cordial y  amable con el turista.

La señora  María Beatriz O. se encuentra en el banco comunal hace un año y medio invitada por una amiga que pertenece al bankito, los créditos le han beneficiado en su pequeño negocio.  Prepara comidas para entregar a sus clientes los mismos que ha conseguido con el paso de los años ya que trabaja en esta actividad hace 3 años, le va bien y poco a poco esta creciendo, labora de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 53 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 20 años,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 se encuentran casados y su último hijo tiene 22 años y se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, también trabaja para pagarse sus estudios y cuando puede ayuda para la economía del hogar, gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un quintal de azúcar, arroz y muchos más víveres que necesita para la preparación de sus platos, su meta es seguir  adelante e incrementar más su negocio.

La señora Tania Anabella es  oriunda de la provincia de El Oro, se encuentra en Cuenca hace 3 años y vino a esta ciudad en busca de trabajo, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja,  fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 18, 15, 10 y 2 años, su primera hija pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres, el  segundo y tercer hijo estudian en colegio y escuela respectivamente, también cuida de un hijo de su esposo de otro compromiso que tiene 10 años,  esta muy contenta ya que se encuentra de 5 meses de gestación, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando, su esposo es maestro albañil.

Nuestra socia ha empezado hace 2 meses la cría  de pollos para obtener ingresos para su hogar ya que antes se dedicaba  a la venta de especias, vendía recorriendo por todas las tiendas pero no obtenía muchas ganancias, ahora con su crédito pagará  una letra  por la compra de un terreno.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The community bank Futuro para un Bienestar is made up of 9 hard-working, enterprising women who have come together to obtain a better future for their families. They live in Cuenca, a location characterized by the beauty of its rivers, its writers, the architecture of its temples and buildings, its exquisite gastronomy and the friendliness and kindness shown to tourists. Maria Beatriz O. has been a member of this community bank for a year and a half. She was invited by a friend and the loans have helped her small business. She prepares food to deliver to her customers, whom she has obtained through her three years of work. Things are going well and bit by bit her business is growing. She works Monday to Friday from 8 am to 3 pm. She lives in Cuenca, is 53 years old and has been divorced for 20 years. She has 4 children: 3 are married and the youngest is 22 and studies at the university and also works to pay tuition and, where possible to help with household costs. Thanks to Maria's hard work, she has been able to build her own house. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a quintal of sugar, rice and many other supplies that she needs for the preparation of her dishes. Her goal is to get ahead and expand her business. Tania Anabella is a native of the El Oro province and has lived in Cuenca for 3 years; she came to this city searching for work. Tania Anabella is 38 and lives with her common-law partner with whom she has 4 children who are 18, 15, 10 and 2. Her oldest daughter stays at home helping with the housework; the second and third children study in high school and elementary school respectively. She also cares for her partner's 10 year old child from another union. She is very happy to be 5 months pregnant. They do not have their own home and rent their house. Her partner is a master mason. For two months she has raised chicken in order to obtain income for their home. Previously, she sold spices, traveling to all the stores, but she did not earn much. With this loan, she will pay a bill for the purchase of a plot of land. Her dream is that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, meat and land

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha has two children but neither of them is able to attend school due to their poor financial condition.
 
She lives with her husband and family in Raiwind where her husband works in a factory.  His income is not sufficient to bear the financial cost of the family, so Aisha has started to prepare embroidered clothes by taking a loan from Asasah.  This earned her a good income.

Now she has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah to further expand her business. With the loan amount, she will buy material such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk to bring in more orders from her clients and to fulfill the current orders on time. 

Aisha hopes that she will be able to increase her profit and soon her children will start to go to school.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sroeung C. is 56 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its sixteen members. The bank is located in Ou village, Takeo province. The members of this village bank will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mr. Sroeung C. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. With this farm they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm field. Thus, Mr. Sroeung C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, his wife is also a pig breeder at home and she is able to earn a small income to improve the family living. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ready-made clothes

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells pipe-borne water at Takoradi. Felicia lives in an area where people do not have access to good drinking water. She has therefore paid for a water pipe to be installed and also bought a tank where good water will be stored and then sold to the people of her community.

Felicia has received senior high education. She is married and lives with her four children. Her husband is a teacher. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Felicia’s loan will be used to buy more poly-tanks to store more water. This will enable her to supply water to more people and also have enough to sell when there is shortage of water in the locality. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy extra poly tanks.

loans.use: To buy more poly-tanks to store more water

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol, Ella tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y es comerciante, La socia vende monturas de lentes a las ópticas, ella es proveedora de monturas de lentes.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de monturas.        

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Marisol; she is 40 years old, has 3 children and is a merchant. The member sells eyeglass frames to optical stores; she is a supplier of frames. The member needs the loan to buy more eyeglass frames.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy more eyeglass frames.

loans.name: Rocsan

texts.en:
Rocsan M. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Rocsan is married and has two infant children. Rocsan owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Rocsan is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rocsan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Rocsan is requesting a new loan of 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rocsan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Ghokale Group-Jinja

texts.en: Monica W., 43, has an easy-going demeanor that has been of paramount importance in helping her strike a chord with clients. Monica, who belongs to Ghokale Group-Jinja principally sells goats and cattle in Lvunamba. This happily married mother of six has been doing this for the last six years. Before that, she was more involved in a grocery business. Though she still operates it, the grocery now plays second fiddle to her more lucrative goat and cattle sales businesses. In a week, she makes 100000 shillings. With this loan, she reckons she will be able to buy more goats and cattle for resale and increase her business profits.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and goats for resale

loans.name: Katebo Basooka Kwavula Group-Mpigi

texts.en: S. Lawrence, 57 years old and father of six, was inspired by his parents seven years ago to start his fish-selling business in Katebo-Mpigi. Farming has since become his major business occupation. Credit for his success he says, boils down to one factor — diligence. A cross section of clients has enabled him make ends meet although some financial, operational challenges have stifled his anticipated progress. Lawrence belongs to Katebo Basooka group-Mpigi. In a week, he makes Ksh 100,000. With this loan, he will buy more fishing nets to catch more fish to sell and make more income.

loans.use: to purchase  fishing nets

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 54 years old and widowed with four children. To make a living, Evelyn raises rice for sale. She also spends raises pigs and runs a small sari-sari (variety) store.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Camlus

texts.en: Camlus is a married man with four children and he does tailoring for a living.  He has been able to educate his children with the income from his business.  Despite his business being in a very competitive environment, he has managed to keep his business running for 15 years.  So far, he has managed to employ three people in his business.  He hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Miracle group in Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Betty is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat at her house. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional pigs. Betty is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs for the business and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for the business and use as working capital

loans.name: Ines Sabina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

La señora Inés  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución y por los beneficios adicionales que da la institución como por ejemplo el crédito emergente. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cinco  hijos, dos de ellos son menores y tienen 17 y 14 los mismos que estudian en colegio y viven con ella, el marido trabaja de operador de maquinaria para el cuerpo de ingenieros del ejército.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y Esika ( productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería,  y accesorios para damas) trabaja cinco  días a la semana  desde las 8 am hasta las 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra, y lo que más vende son los perfumes y bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería entre otros, e invertir mas en los que estén de oferta ya que estos le dejan mayores ganancias. Su sueño es algún día tener un gran restaurante ya que además de la venta le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Inés is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help the institution has provided as well as for additional benefits the institution gives like the emergency loans.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children.  Two of them are still minors; they are 17 and 14 years of age are in secondary school and still live with her.  Her husband is a Machine Operator for the Army’s Corps of Engineers.

She is a housewife who sells Yanbal and Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) to help with household expenses.  She works five days a week from 8am until 4pm.  She sells door to door. She tells us that she takes advantage of the promotional sales when the products are offered on sale and then she resells them at full price to earn a little extra.  What sells the most are perfumes and costume jewelry.

This loan is to buy products like: creams, perfumes and costume jewelry, among others, and to invest more in those items that are on sale and that produce the better profits.  Her dream is to someday have a great restaurant because besides sales she loves cooking.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 7, 8 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group Amigos Unidos (United friends) 7, 8 . Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This is an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Angela makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Angela is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has a food stand where she sells breakfast and lunch. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing meat, rice, beans, vegetables, oil, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Her long-term goal is to have an improved business. She wants to live in her old age in a safe house with her family, maybe by returning to Haiti or by living in the Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, meats, etc.

loans.name: Lopur Ekomol

texts.en:
Lopur has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 60 years old and married to Catherine Nabwaga. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy carrots, peas and tomatoes in bulk to sell.

In the future, Lopur hopes to open a big green grocer shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy carrots, peas and tomatoes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia; an area known for fertile farmland for growing rice crops. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of $2.5 per day. 

Soam S.'s farm is outside of a watering system, so she would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase some pipe, and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Joyce has a boutique, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell in the boutique. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in her boutique

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony, de 20 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es un Joven muy alegre y trabajador; convive con Sarita de 18 años de edad, quien es madre gestante, lleva 8 meses de embarazo; juntos viven en su casa propia donde reina la paz  y la avenencia. Jhony, es un joven muy responsable y conocedor de su trabajo es campesino, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde temprana edad, desde entonces ha trabajado en su propia chacra durante 04 años y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con los siguientes productos: cacao, café y plátano. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien que este aporte que obtiene es para producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, y sembrar plantas de café y cacao. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará víveres para iniciar su negocio de venta de productos alimenticios.
texts.en:
Jhony, 20, is from Anco district.  He is a cheerful, hard working young man.  He cohabits with Sarita, 18, who is 8 months pregnant.  They live together in their own house where peace and concord reign.

Jhony is a very responsible young man who is very knowledgeable in his work: he’s a farmer.  His parents taught his this occupation when he was quite young and since then he’s worked his own field for the last four years.  He has three hectares producing the following crops: cocoa beans, coffee and bananas.  During harvest time he hires day laborers to help.  He is quite aware that this contribution he’s getting is to produce good quality fruit.  He sells his cocoa beans and coffee in the city of San Francisco because that’s where the best prices for these grains are available.

What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting because that’s when the long months of hard work bear fruit in the good quality of his crops.  Transporting his products from the fields to the drying spaces is the most difficult part of the job.  For later on he’d like to purchase new fields and plant coffee and cocoa beans.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He feels the loan will help him a lot with the progress of his work and he’s willing to repay in a timely fashion.  He thanks Prisma for granting the loan.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy food items to start a new business selling groceries.

loans.use: To buy food items to start a new business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is aged 23 and a resident of Nyamira town in Western Kenya, where he has been doing mixed farming for four years. His farm produce of milk, beans and maize are sold to the local market. He has employed one farmhand. He gets additional income from his timber business.

Benard has requested a loan of 25,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is focusing on managing the income from this loan to help him start a family and buy more dairy cows. He reckons that heavy rains are the greatest challenge to farming, especially for beans, because they can be destroyed before harvesting.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Rehema has a business selling plantains. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works two days out of every week. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. The main business challenge for Rehema is transportation. Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Gantogoo

texts.en:
Gantogoo is married and lives with her husband in their own house in Tuv province in Mongolia. Gantogoo and her husband are both retired and now own their own business together. All her children are grown up and live by themselves. 

They used to have a big farm which included chickens, pigs, sheep and goats as well. However, they decided to pay more attention to chicken farming and sold all the other animals to meat trading merchants. They possess a total of 40 chickens and want to expand their business in the future. 

Gantogoo is a hardworking woman who says, "I want to expand our farm building and have heaters and a more advanced water supply system in it." She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to expand their farm building and to make some improvements in it.

loans.use: to improve their poultry farm building

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Tranca Fanupe del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría patos, pavos, gallinas y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside, conoce a la perfección este rubro por eso cuenta con clientela fidelizada. 

Jesús desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves y cerdos, además de animales para incrementar su negocio, ya que la demanda esta aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 37-year-old father who lives with his family in the sector of Tranca Fanupe in the District of Mórrope. This farming district is located in Lambayeque Province, which is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús has been raising and selling domesticated animals and poultry for ten years. He raises ducks, turkeys, chickens, and pigs and sells them from his home. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to merchants who frequently visit the area where he lives. Jesús is known for being a perfectionist in his trade and has a loyal customer base.

He wants to acquire balanced feed for his poultry and pigs, as well as additional animals so that he can expand his business since demand has increased. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: to purchase animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una mujer soltera de 48 años de edad, tiene casa propia con servicios de agua y en el pueblo jovén (conjunto de viviendas en expansión, pero en las afueras de una ciudad) de Nueva Arica,ubicado a unos minutos del distrito de Chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que su  principal actividad de sus pobladores es la actividad comercial, turística  y agricola.

Esperanza se dedica hace más de 10 años a las labores agricolas, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva maíz, que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores y comercializa en elmercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor,con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos.

Esperanza  a solicitado un préstamo  de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de insumos para cultivar sus terrenos (fertilizantes) para mejorar sus tierras y tenga una mejor cosecha de maíz (da comofruto el choclo), el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo de los pobladores.  La venta de su maíz mejorará su claidad de vida.

Esperanza es conocida por los personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por eso se sorprenden porque a pesar de ser un trabajo que lo desarrollan los hombres, ella lo realiza con esfuerzo y empeño, con la finalidad de mejorar en la vida y tener lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a single woman who is 48 years old. She owns her own home and it is equipped with water. It is located in the new village (a group of homes that is growing but in the outskirts of the city) of Nueva Arica. It is a few minutes from the district of Chiclayo. It is a district known for its principal business activities of commerce, tourism, and agriculture.

Esperanza has been carrying out agricultural activities for more than 10 years. She cultivates corn on her fields and it is a healthy and delicious food that is consumed daily by the population. She sells in the market of Moshoqueque in Chiclayo. She sells in wholesale and in retail with the only goal of increasing her income.

Esperanza requests a loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase materials used to cultivate her fields (fertilizers). She will improve her fields and she will have a better yield of corn (producing corn on the cob). It is later sold for the consumption of the population. The sale of corn wil improve her quality of life.

Esperanza is known by people who carry out the same business. But they are surprised because eventhough it is a business that is normally handled by men, she manages it with hard work and with dedication. Her goal is to advance in life and to have what she needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials (fertilizers) to improve her fields.

loans.name: Luganda Kulya Women's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Aisha has been plying her clothing sales business in Kampala for close to five years. The happily married mother of three bubbling kids says she began this business with persuasion from her sister. She had no previous business experience but she was undeterred in her desire to take root. The pep talk from her friends contributed a lot, too. This determined tenacity, coupled with her personal abilities, are calling cards which will count a lot as she continues on her business Journey. 

She says this business generates approximately $42 a month in profits.  Aisha says that with this loan she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell. Two female clients by the names of Sarah and Rehema had their faces partly obscured when the group photo was taken. I have marked them as not pictured. Aisha, the group leader, is the lady with the white blouse seated in the front row.

loans.use: to purchase of more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Blanca Yadira

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Yadira tiene 40 años. Blanca es casada. Tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con productos pequeños ropa para niños, sabanas y otros productos, por lo que decide incursionar comprando más mercadería como es a ropa de adultos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, sabanas, cosméticos y ropa en general. El sueño de Blanca es diversificar en sus productos y ofrecer un sin número de productos.
texts.en:
Blanca Yadira is 40 years old.  She’s married and has one child in her care.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s been in this business for over ten years.  She started out with small items, children’s clothes, sheets and other things and later decided to start buying other merchandise like clothes for adults.  

The loan she’s asking for is to use as working capital to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general.  Blanca’s dream is to diversify her products and offer countless products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 7  hijos, 4 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y tres de 17, 15 y 10 años, los cuatro mayores  estudian en Universidad y los tres menores en  colegio y escuela, cinco de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de salud.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas y hasta donde llegan sus clientes,  nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todos los fines de semana,  deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cada vez que  necesita. Tiene seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Colorado Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial heritage and its crafts, recognized nationally and internationally.  The place for the famous palmetto straw hats.

María is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because interests are lower than in other credit institutions.  She is 46 years old, has a partner, and from the relationship has 7 children, 4 of whom are grown, and three being 17, 15, and 10 years old.  The four older children are university students, and the three younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Five of her children still live with her.  Her spouse does not work, for health reasons.

She sells all types of clothing, door to door, and also sells from her home, where she has display windows and where customers come.  She tells us that she also accepts orders.  She works three days a week, and every weekend, leaving items on credit, and collecting every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for six years, and things are going well for her.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as:  pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  

Her wishes are to be healthy and to continue working.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora has been in the trade for three years. Her perseverance, confidence, experience and work consistency have guaranteed the growth of her business. She is constantly increasing the assortment of fruits and berries which helps her increase her income. She is hoping to generate enough income and increase her working capital. Besides this business, in autumn and winter in the off-season she sells clothes and coverlets. Nigora would like to get a loan of 4500 TJS for purchasing berries in order to increase her profit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy berries to sell

loans.name: Maríela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela Martina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (hot-dog, hamburguesas, sándwich)  desde hace tres años y tiene un salón de belleza con lo cual ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en ambos negocios con la compra de pan, carne, mayonesa, mostaza, y tientes, pinturas…etc
texts.en: Mrs. Mariela Martina is a hard working woman and entrepreneur.  She is 37 years old and has sold fast food (hot dogs, hamburgers, sandwiches) for a living for the past three years.  She also has a beauty salon which has helped her get her two children, 18 and 12 years old, ahead.  She will invest the loan in both businesses to buy bread, meat, mayonnaise, mustard, dyes, paints etc.

loans.use: Bread, mayonnaise, mustard, dyes, paints etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy repair parts and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ines tine la edad de 53 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera, ella tuvo cuatro hijos los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente tiene a su cargo a dos de sus nietas con las que vive actualmente.

ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña tubo que trabajar y fue muy dificil ya que fue madre soltera y tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos, pero hace un poco mas de 16 años inicio a vender cosmeticos y perfumeria con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos dice que primero muestra sus catalagos a sus clientes levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando llegan los productos los entrega y recibe su pago, ella nos dice que ademas de vender cosmeticos tambien vende trastes casa por casapara ganar un poco de dinero extra ya que cada dia el diniero menos alcanza y tiene que ver por sus nietas. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de perfumeria, cosmeticos y trastes para su posterior venta. 

doña ines se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el apoyo que le han brindado por medio de estos creditos y espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea tener mas clientes ya que solo asi sus ganancias aumentaran y podra dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus nietas
texts.en:
Maria Ines is 53 years old, only studied through primary school, and is a single mother.  She has four children who are all married, and currently cares for two of her granddaughters who live with her.  

She tells us that since she was very young, she had to work and it was very difficult since she was a single mother and had to help her children get ahead.  More than 16 years ago, she started to sell cosmetics and perfumes to her friends and neighbors in her community.  First, she shows her catalogs to her customers and they place an order.  She places the order with her suppliers and later, when the products arrive, she delivers them and receives the payment.  In addition to selling cosmetics, she also sells dishes door to door in order to make a little extra money since every day her money covers fewer things, and she needs to care for her granddaughters.  

She needs this loan to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and dishes to sell later.  

Maria Ines is very thankful to the foundation for the support they have given her through these loans, and hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper.  She hopes to have more customers so that her earnings will increase and she can give her granddaughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Jacqueline has a bake shop where she sells breads & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for baking breads.

Jacqueline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for baking breads.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is the leader of this group. She is 28 and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she brings up three sons. 

Zamira works as a teacher at a school.  In order to earn additional money for her family she runs her own business. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 500 soms she started a business retailing silver products.  At the moment, her business is running well and she earns about 5000 soms per month. 

Zamira applied for this loan because she needs funds to purchase more silver products in order to expand her business. In the future, Zamira wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase silver products

loans.name: Kerionka

texts.en: Kerionka is 48 years old married to Mututua and they are blessed with children. Her primary business is livestock trading. She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES.5,000 per month. She was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. She has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan. She plans to use KES.10,000 to buy livestock and the rest to pay school fees. She will use the extra profit to pay fees. She hopes to become a prominent business person. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and pay fees.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio, de 54 años es un hombre responsable. Él está casado desde hace 26 años con Juana, su esposa; ambos tienen 2 hermosos hijos: Frateli y Abdias. En unión familiar viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Punray. Sus días se centran en el trabajo arduo, ya que estar “ocupado”, le gusta mucho. Por ello desde hace 30 años, comenzó a sembrar papa, arveja y maíz en sus terrenos de cultivo. Donde todas las mañanas cuida con esmero, pues sabe que la maleza y la plaga de insectos pueden dañar su cosecha. Ya tiene 10 extensiones de terreno, donde puede continuar con su actividad y eso le gusta mucho. Su objetivo es comprar más terrenos, por eso comenzó hace poco a trabajar como albañil en la construcción de casas, donde le pagan un dinero extra. Con el tiempo espera ahorrar lo suficiente para lograr su meta. Además posee 2 terneras con los que piensa en el futuro, hacer queso e incursionar en ese negocio. Mientras se concentra en su próxima cosecha, donde tiene invertido dinero y espera recibir buenas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando”  y este es el noveno crédito con MFP; donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo para salir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Gregorio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
54-year-old Gregorio is a responsible man.  He has been married to his wife Juana for 26 years.  The couple have two beautiful children: Frateli and Abdias.  They live together in their own home which is located in the small village of Punray.

Gregorio's days are centred around hard work as he really enjoys keeping busy.  He has been growing potatoes, peas and corn on his farmland for 30 years.  Every morning he carefully tends to his crops as he knows that weeds and pests can damage his harvest.  He has ten tracts of land on which he works and he really enjoys it.  His goal is to buy more land and so, a short while ago, he started working as a builder, building houses.  This provides him with extra money.  Over time, he hopes to save up enough money to achieve his goal.  Gregorio also owns two calves.  In the future, he plans to make cheese from their milk and break into this business.  In the meantime, he is concentrating on his upcoming harvest.  He has invested money in this and hopes to make good profits.

Gregorio belongs to the "Punray Avanzando" and this is his ninth loan from MFP.  He feels happy as he receives the support he needs to get ahead in life.  He pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments.  With your support, Gregorio will invest the money he has requested in buying a bag of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old, married, and has one child.She is engaged in a retailing business selling goods for daily consumption. She says she opens her store at 5 o'clock in the morning due to many customers going to  their fields. She is grateful because she has a loving husband who has always supported her. Her husband has been a farmer and tricycle driver. The generated income of the couple has been used in buying a refrigerator, in payment for motorcycle transport, daily needs and the allowance of her child.

Teresa had added products such as frozen foods and raw meat to her store because their village is far from the market. She has been buying her products wholesale to minimize her expenses going to and from the market. Nowadays, she suffers from shortage of funds due to some who have shopped on credit in her neighborhood. For these reasons, she requests additional capital in the amount of P30,000 to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soups, canned goods, cooking ingredients and shampoo needed in her general store. She is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments on time. She is hoping that she can expand her store and give her child a better future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soups, canned goods, cooking ingredients and shampoo for her general store.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with seven children who are all adults. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food her family.

Luvuno has operated a tobacco selling business for the past thirty years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors. She aspires to operate a retail shop.

With the 40,000 KES, Luvuno wants to purchase more stocks of tobacco for resale purposes. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: buy tobacco

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 13 años. El sale todos los días con su bolso a ofrecer los diferentes productos como bolsos, calzado, cosméticos y ropa en general. Él siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Sueña con lograr comprar un terreno para  construir su vivienda y realizarle las mejoras necesarias, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo a pesar de no ser tan fácil ha logrado proporcionarle a sus hijos los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Manuel De Jesús has sold general merchandise for more than thirteen years. He goes out every day with his bag selling a variety of items such as bags, footwear, cosmetics, and clothing. He is always looking for a way to get ahead. Manuel’s dream is to buy a piece of land on which to build a house of his own with all the necessary services. He has three children to raise. In spite of all the difficulties, he has managed to provide for them.

loans.use: to buy bags, footwear, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Imelda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and vegetables. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and vegetables for resale.
Imelda has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné est une femme de 57 ans qui vit dans une des communautés sénégalaises. Elle est veuve et  dispose de chambres qui lui appartiennent et qu’elle a mises en location. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de cette localité depuis décembre 2005 et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le dallage de deux chambres à usage de location. Ses revenus de location lui permettent de prendre en charge tous  ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs. Ngoné is 57 years old and lives in a city of Senegal. She is a widow and owns rooms which she rents out. She has been a member of U-IMCEC at this location since December 2005. She has properly reimbursed three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs in order to renovate two rooms for rental. The rental profits help her to take care of all her personal needs.

loans.use: to finance the renovation of two rooms.

loans.name: Hermilo

texts.en:
Hermilo is a 55-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 2 children, ages 18 and 16.

Hermilo is able to provide for his family through fishing. Each month, Hermilo earns 7,000 PHP with his business. He plans to use his loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and gasoline for the boat. Hermilo hopes for this loan to help improve his business. He plans to make improvements to their house once his income improves.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yonny; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno, estofado de pollo, carne a la parrilla entre otros platos, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant y poder cocinar los diferentes platos típicos de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras.
                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Sayhua 3 communal bank, located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Yonny.  She is 35 years old and single, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes such as baked chicken and grilled meat, among others.  She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She has a stall in a market.  Her dream is to have a restaurant and be able to cook different typical dishes of the city of Cusco.

Yonny is requesting the loan to buy cooking products such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 32-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked in construction since 2009, and it is his only source of making a living. He is a builder, and he works in most construction fields, especially with tiles.

To improve his business, Rabih requested a loan from KIVA partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary iron pillars for his business. He is putting much effort to prove himself among competitors and to provide his family with the best living.

He hopes to improve his business in the future through opening a big construction company.

loans.use: To buy necessary iron pillars for his business.

loans.name: Los Positos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es madre soltera. De 25 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 4 hijos y 1 de ellos está estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Inició este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y luego decidio comprar cerdos, a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerdos y también concentrado para poder alimentarlos. Desea en el futuro contar con mayor capital, invertirlo y obtener más ganancia.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedeican a la crianza de animales domésticos y a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 25-year-old single mother who did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She makes a living raising pigs. Lidia began this business by raising laying hens and then decided to buy pigs. She has six years of experience to date. 

Lidia organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy pigs and animal feed for them. She hopes to have greater capital in the future to invest and receive greater earnings. The rest of the members of the group make a living raising domesticated animals and selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Faxri

texts.en: Faxri is 33 years old. Faxri is married and lives in the Füzuli region with his family. They have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city. His son is 4 years old and the daughter is 7 years old. The son goes to kindergarden and the daughter in the primary school. Faxri is a farmer. He has been in the animal breeding business for five years. He buys little calves, fattening them to sell in the local bazaar.Today he needs his first loan in the amount of  1750 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He wants to buy calves and develop his business. He is thankful to Kiva organization for the help.  In the future, Faxri wants to build a new stall for calves.

loans.use: to buy calves and develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a barber's chair, scissors, and other equipment

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married with two teenage daughters. She owns a kiosk selling tea, coffee, chocolates and sweets at one of the biggest markets in the city. Her daughters willingly help her with the business which enables them to gain some practical skills as well. Svitlana has been a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2002. She has proven to have the heart of an entrepreneur and is enthusiastic about her small business. Her integrity and good reputation make her a pleasant person to work with. She has received and repaid a total of 19 loans with “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Svitlana would like to get a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional products for her kiosk. She is planning to buy a variety of chocolate candy, and good quality teas and coffee from wholesalers who distribute these products to retail vendors. Svitlana recently lost her father and she incurred many expenses with the funeral. However, she is working hard to sustain her business and secure its expansion. This loan will enable Svitlana provide a wide range of food products for sale in her kiosk and will help guarantee consistent growth in her business which is key to her family’s well-being.

Світлана – одружена. В неї дві дочки підліткового віку. Вона – власниця кіоску, продає чай, каву, шоколадні цукерки та солодощі на одному з найбільших ринків міста. Її дочки допомагають Світлані з бізнесом, одночасно набуваючи практичні навички, які потім знадобляться їм в житті. Світлана працює з „Надією України” з 2002 року. Вона – чудовий підприємець, з великим ентузіазмом ставиться до своєї справи. Завдяки чесності та порядності Світлани з нею завжди дуже приємно працювати. Вона отримала та сплатила 19 позик в „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Світлана просить про позику в 1 000 доларів для того, щоб придбати більше продовольчих товарів для свого кіоску. Вона планує закупити різноманітні шоколадні цукерки, якісні чай та каву оптом, для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Світлана нещодавно втратила батька, багато грошей треба було витратити на похорон. Однак вона наполегливо працює для того, щоб забезпечити стабільний розвиток свого бізнесу. Ця позика допоможе Світлані урізноманітнити асортимент продовольчих товарів в своєму кіоску, а також гарантуватиме зростання її бізнесу, який є запорукою добробуту усієї родини.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of products in her kiosk

loans.name: Maria’S

texts.en: Mrs. Maria’s O. is a 42 years old woman. She is happily married with five (5) children. She is delightedly in engaging in sales of drugs. She is optimistic that she can expand her business if loaned the sum of $400.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sales

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida runs a soft drink business in a busy area near the Mbagala bus stand. She usually opens the shop at half past six in the morning to sell tea to people before they go to their working places. Saida also sells cold drinks like Coca-Cola, Fanta and Sprite. Cold drinks have higher turnover in her kiosk, mainly caused by the hot weather of Dar es Salaam.  Saida plans to add a stock of these items. She also want to add sitting chairs and a table in order to accommodate more people, especially during peak hours. She is in need of US $750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: To add stock of drinks and sitting chairs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: "I will buy more provisions and drinks with my loan," says Mrs. Rose I.. She is 43 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001. Rose sells provision, drinks and food items to her community. She is optimistic that with the loan, she will be able to improve the inventory of her business.

loans.use: To increase the provisions offered in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Tulipeuliuli

texts.en: Tulipe is a widow who was motivated to work on her farm and set up her own elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) printing business because she does not want to be a financial burden to her children. She works in her own small garden plot outside her house and sometimes on the farm if she is not busy with the elei printing. Tulipe’s earnings enable her to make her loan repayments in a timely manner and also are helpful for her own family needs and home improvements.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Hortência Alberto

texts.pt:
Hortênsia Alberto M., born in 1982, lives in Maputo, Mozambique with her partner and one-year-old child. She is in the business of selling quality clothing at the Xipamanine market. She just joined the credit program and is requesting a first loan of $275, which will allow her to increase her stock and therefore start to improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Hortência Alberto M., portadora do BI nº110431628A, residente no bairro de Hulene Tem o seu negocio no Xipamanine , vente roupas da calamidade, vive maritalmente nascida a 13/05/1982, tem 1 filho Esta a entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 6000 mt para pagar em 6 meses

loans.use: Hortênsia will use her loan to buy more clothes to sell at her clothing stand

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(D) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Jackies is 28 years old and married with two children. She has a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a steamer. Annet has a poultry business while Margret sells African crafts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
I. Abdurahim is 54 years old. He with his wife had raised three children. 

Abdurahim is a farmer. He grows rice. Today after having experience in this business for 28 years, Abdurahim knows almost everything connected with the process of producing rice. At the same time Abdurahim sells rice in one of the markets. He is selling rice which is not separated from its husks as such rice can be stored for a longer period of time. 

Abdurahim is planning to purchase mineral fertilizer required for growing rice. With this purpose he requests $600.00 US dollars for the term of 6 months. Being loaned for the first time, Abdurahim is sure he shall be able to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer required for producing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more sale stock

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma S. is married and has two children. She started her business when she realized that one salary was not enough to support her family, thus she decided to help her husband. They come from a small town so when they arrived at the city they did not have a job. Because of this she was forced to find a way to generate an income. She started by having her husband sell novelties, such as backpacks, caps, etc; door to door until they were able to get established at their home.

Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Irma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Irma S. es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su familia dado que un solo sueldo no era suficiente y decidió ayudarle a su esposo. Ellos venían de un pueblo por lo que al llegar a la ciudad no contaban con un trabajo lo que la obligo a buscar la manera de generar ingresos. Comenzó hace 4 años con su esposo vendiendo novedades casa por casa mochilas, gorras, etc. hasta establecerse en su casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancías. Con tu ayuda Irma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Gulkhar

texts.en:
Gulkhar H. is a 46-year-old woman who breeds and thereafter sells sheep to the local bazaar traders in the small village of Sabirabad in Azerbaijan. She is proud to say that she has more than 20 years of experience in this field.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase 10 sheep (for $60 each) and fodder with the remaining $200 in order to speed up her business' sheep-raising process.

loans.use: To expand business operations by purchasing 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Thul

texts.en: Thul S., 24, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in Kampong Cham province. She works in a garment factory, where she makes $3 a day, while her husband drives a motortaxi and makes around $4 a day. They have recently noticed that their motorbike is not holding up well, and they need to purchase a new one to maintain their income. Thul S. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $500 to do this. They see this as way to increase the amount of money they can use to meet family expenses because they will not need to spend so much on repairs.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin R. makes and sells Cambodian noodles and porridge in her village. By doing so, she is able to earn approximately $5 per day. She is a widow, and she lives with her one son in the Phnom Prasat Village of Banteay Meanchey province. Her son is a motorcycle taxi driver whose income can support the majority of the family’s expenses.

Nevertheless, Mrs. R. wants to commence a new business whereby she will sell fruit. Therefore, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase various fruits to sell to her customers. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds will be used to purchase a second-hand motorcycle in order to transport the fruit that she is hoping to sell. In this way, the loan would allow her to expand her business and to thereby pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To embark upon a new fruit-selling business by purchasing fruit and a second-hand motorcycle to transport such fruits to the market to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a widow with 3 children aged 14, 10, and 8 years old. She has been a juice, eggs and oil seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Safia now hopes for a loan to buy more more items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 42 años D. edad, estudió quinto D. secundaria, es casada y madre D. cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao.

Ella es una D. las socias  fundadoras del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva – Machacmarca, desD. los quince años D. edad empezó a vender casacas aumentando su capital, a la fecha aumentó su negocio vendiendo casacas, polleras, mandiles en las ciudades D. Juliaca, Arequipa. Paralelo  a su negocio junto a su esposo compra y venD. ganado vacuno en las ferias D. Pilcuyo,  Ilave.

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 una vaca con S/. 700.00 Nuevos Soles y S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles invertirá para comprar mercadería como polleras (vestimenta típica D. la región) y  mandiles.

Su sueño es que sus dos hijos menores sean profesionales como son los dos mayores D. los que se siente muy orgullosa.

“Gracias a los créditos que recibo del Banco Comunal he podido aumentar mis ganancias, además no nos piden muchos documentos y es fácil D. obtener el crédito” manifestó muy contenta doña Magdalena.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old, has a high-school education and is married with four children. She lives in the community of Machacmarca. She is one of the founders of the local community bank. She started selling jackets at the age of 15 to raise money and to date she has expanded her inventory to incluD. jackets, skirts and aprons, which she sells in the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa. Along with her business, she and her husband buy and sell livestock at the Pilcuyo fair markets. With the current loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase one cow and put the rest toward buying supplies like skirts and aprons typical to the region. Her dream is for her two youngest children to become professionals like her two oldest, of whom she's very proud.

A very content Magdalena said: "Thanks to the loans that I receive from the community bank, I have been able to increase my earnings. They also don't ask for many documents; it's easy to get the loan."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow and typical skirts and aprons of the region

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka B. was born in 1971 and comes from Gračnica. She is the mother of two children; one child is in primary and the other in secondary school. Her husband is employed and Jasminka is a housewife. Jasminka has been selling clothes for a long time, which helps her and her family to have money for their daily and school costs.

Jasminka has already been a user of WWI loans and now she takes a loan to prepare herself for the coming season. She sells clothes at home and at the local marketplace. She takes a loan of the amount of 1000 KM to buy some winter clothes for reselling, to provide her with earnings for the winter time.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for reselling

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr:
Née en 1973, Madame TCHANGAÏ Léa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Femme très dynamique et dévouée à son activité qui est la préparation d’une boisson fermentée appelée « Tchouk » faite à base de sorgho qui se fait de plus en plus rare sur le marché dû à une mauvaise saison agricole. Dans le souci de stocker le sorgho en vue de pouvoir préparer la boisson en période de pénurie, Madame TCHANGAÏ Léa sollicite un crédit pour arriver à ses fins. 
Ce crédit débloqué lui permettra de continuer son activité même en période de pénurie de sorgho et ainsi doubler son bénéfice pour mieux faire face à ses besoins et améliorer le revenu de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Mrs. Léa TCHANGAÏ is married and the mother of 2 children. She's a very energetic woman who is very much devoted to her business. The latter consists in the preparation of a fermented beverage called « Tchouk », made out of sorghum, which is becoming hard to find on the market due to a bad agricultural season. Anxious to stock sorghum in order to be able to make the beverage during the shortage, Mrs. Léa TCHANGAÏ is seeking a loan to achieve this goal. This loan will enable her to continue her activity even during the period of sorghum shortage, and therefore, to double her profits in order to better support herself and improve the revenues of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock sorghum to prepare a local beverage

loans.name: Horizontes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "HORIZONTES" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA EDITH. EN SU MAYORÍA  SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO PASTILLAS, COMIDA, ROPA CHOCOLATES Y ENTRE LOS VARONES SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA CHAPERÍA, PINTURA, SOLDADURA Y AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO. SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE POR LO QUE NO TEMEN A LAS BAJAS DEL MERCADO. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA ASÍ COMO PARA LA MEJORA D. SUS HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. EN GENERAL LOS SOCIOS (AS) NO TIENEN MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDAR. PERO SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y TODOS SON CONOCIDOS ENTRE SI POR LO QUE JUNTOS SABRÁN SALIR ADELANTE CON CAPACIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en:
The group horizons es represented by Mrs. Edith. The majority of the group sells products like pills, food, and chocolates. The men sell services such as metal work, painting, soldering/welding, and public transportation. They are hard working people and responsible, so they are not afraid of the drops in the economy. This loan will serve to purchase more products to sell and increase revenues and therefore improve the members' ability to do business.
