In general, the members do not have much experience working with groups like this, but they are responsible people and they all know each other well, so they know they will go forth with capability and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 23 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their one young daughter, who is almost two years old. Miriam works at a beauty salon owned by her in-laws on Asamblea Avenue, one of Ayacucho’s main pedestrian streets. She, her husband and her husband’s two siblings work at the spa, offering a range of services from haircuts to dye jobs and perms. The spa is very popular; even Miriam’s loan officer is a client. 

Miriam is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to open a snack stand in the spa. She will use the loan to buy sweets and drinks to sell. 

Miriam’s goal for the future is to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: Buy sweets and drinks

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife who lives at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband, Phorn Vannak, is a construction foreman and eventually he makes $6 a day. This couple has two school-aged children. Keo S. is asking for a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband, and the rest will be used to make repairs to their leaking roof.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and repair leaking roof.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Samaya

texts.en: Samaya A. is only 20, but she is already an independent young woman who struggles for a better future every moment of her life. After school she decided to enter to the university, but the sickness of her mother did not let her go. She decided to stay in her village and look after her mother. She decided to start her business and raise cattle for meat. Since 2002 Samaya has been buying, fattening and raising calves. She sells them to the local people and bazaar traders. Samaya now is ready to take a loan and continue expanding her business. For this purpose she applied for $1200 and is going to use it to purchase two baby calves and fodder. Samaya is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase two baby calves and fodder.

loans.name: Kasanda

texts.en: Kasanda M. is a Tanzanian small businessman. He is married with two children. He runs a modern barber shop at Kisiwan Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He also sells phone accessories there. He purchases phone accessories wholesale from Kariakoo and sells them to his customers. He would like a loan of  600,000 TZS to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en: Thouk C., 31, is married, has two children, and resides in the Takeo province. She weaves silk scarves and makes $8.00 every day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and typically earns $10.00 per day. Two of their children are in school. Thouk C. requests a loan to purchase land, so she and her husband can become farmers to supplement their income to support the family.

loans.use: Purchase land to farm

loans.name: Salud Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Salud (“Health”) Village Bank is a well-established group that has completed seven previous loan cycles with Asociacion Arariwa. The twenty group members all live in the city of Cusco and dedicate themselves to a variety of different businesses.

Fernando P. G. is 33 years old and single. He works independently as a systems engineer and works for the international NGO Worldvision, the SIS computing company, and the Hotel San Agustin. His three employers keep him pretty busy as he usually has jobs all through the week. He has been in this line of work for the past six or seven years. Fernando is requesting a loan of $150 to install ceramic tiles on the staircase of his house. He will hire someone to do the job, which will cost 1000 soles in total (US$300); he will pay for the rest of the job out of his salary. This is Fernando’s first loan cycle with the Salud Village Bank.

Four of the group members work at a local nursery school run by PRONOEI, a government institution that provides daycare/nursery schooling to children between the ages of 3 and 5 from low-income families. The women are paid very little (one of the women refers to her salary as “a tip”), so they all have side businesses to generate more income. They each earn 300 soles per month (US $95). Hermila V. V. and Maria Elena P. C. both sell stuffed animals at a Saturday market in the Santiago neighborhood of Cusco; each says that on a good day she earns as much as 250 soles in profits. Filomena C. M. works at the same market selling second hand clothing. She travels to Puno once a week to buy the clothing, and says she earns as much as 300 soles on a good weekend. These three women will invest their Kiva loans in purchasing more merchandise for their respective businesses at the Baratillo market.

Sonia P. H. is 47 years old and married. She has one son who is 15; she also lost a child to medical negligence. She runs a small business with her husband selling communications devices to municipal offices in small towns in the countryside around Cusco. These devices generate radio and television signals. She handles the administrative end of this while her husband is in charge of the technical part.

The couple has been in this business for the past 18 years, so they are well known in the area and use word of mouth to advertise their services. Most of the equipment has to be special ordered from Lima or Arequipa, says Sonia, though some of the smaller parts can be found and assembled in Cusco. The couple works alone most of the time, though they occasionally hire someone to work on transmission towers. Sonia will use her loan of $700 to buy part of a larger piece of equipment. $700 is enough to buy the cables and connectors, she says; the entire piece of equipment will cost about $1500. Sonia’s goal for the future is to expand her business from a micro-enterprise to a larger company.

The group is requesting a total of $4,400. The members have all pledged to repay their Kiva loans in full and on time.

loans.use: Install ceramic tiles, buy stuffed animals, used clothing, cables and connectors for satellite

loans.name: Goodnews

texts.en: Goodnews E. is twenty-seven years old and married with one child. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is now 45 years old. She is residing in the urban area of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Yollie J., 43 years old. Her husband is helping in their vending business. They are blessed with a son who is Yolmar, 12 years old, attending elementary school. Margie is engaged in selling seasoning products such as onions, garlic, vegetable, etc. She is requesting a loan to have her business grow. She is planning to purchase more products to sell to have sufficient supply of vending products to be able increase her income. 

Margie is dreaming that her son could also finish his studies and have a good future someday, and to able achieve this, she must therefore work patiently no matter how hard life is. Finally, Margie shared that “You see things and say, 'why?", but “I dream things and say, 'Why not?” Indeed, every dream that we have right now, could someday become real through our own ways and deeds, pursuing the right decisions we desire to do.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun V. was born in 1965 and blessed with nine children. She was married, but divorced her husband when her children were still young. She currently makes a daily income by cultivating rice, while one of her sons works in construction. Soeun V. is a fantastic manager who has provided everything for her children's needs. She will use this loan to buy a variety of fruits to sell for additional profit, and to purchase an old motor for her family's travel needs.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell for additional profit

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores L. is from the town of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Dolores is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Dolores owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies to the local community. Dolores has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dolores joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Dolores is requesting a loan, of 5,000 PHP, to be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dolores from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally S. owns a small business selling bro houk, salt and so on. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sok, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom sells bro houk in the local market while the others are enrolled in the local school. They are villagers in Bro Soung village in Takeo province.

Although they work hard, they still need more income to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Phally S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their life with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana tiene 48 años, es una mujer cuyos hijos, hace mucho tiempo, ya hacen su vida por si solos, ella vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. En las afueras de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el horno de ladrillos de Damiana, quien se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para amasar y moldear los ladrillos, los cuales luego de 10 días meterá en su horno. Esta actividad le ha generado los ingresos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, es por eso que ella todavía continua realizándola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus ladrillos y ver que su trabajo es bien recompensado, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con el barro, ya que en las temporadas de frió el barro se torna muy helado, haciendo que se enferme y no pueda trabajar normalmente. Para un futuro cercano desea contratar unos ayudantes para mejorar su producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Damiana con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer ladrillos, ya que los que actualmente usa, ya están deteriorados por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Damiana is 48 years old and is a woman whose children have been independent and living on their own for a long time now. She lives in her own home, and her greatest dream is to live peacefully in her old age. Damiana's brick oven is located in the outskirts of the city of Juliaca, and she wakes up very early each morning to mix and mold the bricks, which she fires in the oven 10 days later. This activity has provided her with enough income to help her three children get ahead in life, and this is why she continues to make bricks. Her favorite part of the job is selling bricks and seeing that her work is well compensated. She has had this business for the past 10 years, and says that the most difficult part is working with clay, since when the weather get colds the clay becomes very cold and sometimes makes her sick, preventing her from working normally. In the near future, she hopes to hire several workers to help her increase production and earn more. This is Damiana's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she hopes to make all of her payments on time so as not to cause problems for the other members of her village bank, who really respect and care for her. With the requested loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy new molds to make bricks, since her current molds are in bad shape because she has been using them for so long.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy molds to make bricks

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende locerias como ollas, platos, frazadas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante, mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Maria travels to the markets in the region where she sells cookware such as pots and pans, dishes and tablecloths, products she acquires in the city of Lima. Maria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase dishes, pots and pans. Her dreams are for her children to continue with their studies, to improve her business and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, pots and pans

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their two children. Khaled has been working in construction since 2000. Khaled requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.
Khaled is speciA. in his work because he does a good work. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a 23 year old married mother of one child. She lives with her family in Nyalenda Kisumu, Kenya. She currently sells secondhand clothes, which she started to do in 2003. She buys her stock in bulk at one of the local markets and sells to her clients. She requires Kshs 20,000 to improve her stock level.

loans.use: Improve her stock level

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 26 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She owns a food stand in front of local market. On average, she is able to make a profit of US$1.80 each day. Her husband, Kong Veng, 41, pictured here with his daughter, is a motor-taxi driver. He typically makes US$4 every day. Sok S. is asking for a loan of US$250 her husband needs to repair the moto.

loans.use: repair the moto.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 53 años, su gran sentido del humor y sus deseos de superación le ayudaron a mejorar sus condiciones de vida dentro de su hogar, el cual está conformado por su madre anciana y su hijo de 30 años, quien la ayuda con las labores de su casa.

La venta de ropa es una de las actividades que le gusta desde muy joven, pues siempre le agradó vestir bien y con el paso del tiempo su madre la motivó a vender prendas de vestir. Desde entonces, hace 6 años se dedica a repartir los pedidos que sus clientes realizan cada fin de mes, atendiendo su negocio desde su domicilio, siendo sus amigos y vecinos sus principales clientes.
Eliana considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las promociones que realizan los diversos supermercados, donde adquiere prendas de calidad con la finalidad de revenderlas a precios más altos. 
Sus planes a futuro son de mejorar la atención a sus clientes, instalando un pequeño stand en su vivienda, además de ofrecer variedad en prendas y de buena calidad.

Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que la responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizarán su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar su mercadería en ropa y aprovechará las liquidaciones por temporada.
texts.en:
Eliana is 53 years old and has a great sense of humor. Her desire to overcome enabled her to improve the living conditions for her family, which consists of her elderly mother and her 30 year old son who helps with the work around the house.

Selling clothes was one of the jobs she enjoyed as a young woman. Eliana always liked to dress well and over time her mother encouraged her to sell clothes. For six years, she has been distributing orders that her customers place at the end of each month. She manages her business from home, with her friends and neighbors being her main customers.

Eliana believes her business can be profitable by taking advantage of sales at various retail stores that acquire quality garments with the intention of selling them at higher prices. In the future, she plans to improve the service to her customers, open a small stand in her home, and offer a variety of high-quality articles of clothing.

This is Eliana’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is committed to being responsible and making her payments. With the money she is requesting, she plans to increase her inventory of clothing by taking advantage of seasonal clearance sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Seuga

texts.en:
Seuga L. is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Seuga owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Seuga has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Seuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Seuga is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Seuga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy alegre y amable que a sus 40 años sabe lo que es trabajar sin descanso, ella vive con su esposo (Florentino), de 54 años; y también con sus jóvenes hijos: Wilder de 16, Milena de 13 y Susana de 12 años.

Cada día se levanta muy temprano y con el cántico de las aves empieza su labor de siembra de papa acompañada de toda su familia, en la pequeña chacra que tiene cerca de su casa. Además, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino y como ella es muy laboriosa ayuda a su esposo en el tejido de multicolores telares. Gloria es una gran comerciante y según sus propias palabras” trato de vender lo que cae en mis manos” y es muy cierto, porque confiesa que comercializa la rica papa que cosecha en su productiva tierra; además de sus bien alimentados animales y los telares que día a día teje con su esposo. 
A su vez, como toda mujer emprendedora, ya tiene planes para el futuro y quisiera comprar más animales de mejor raza y venderlos a mayor precio, así obtener más ganancias económicas y con ello mandar a sus hijos a estudiar a la ciudad, que es su máximo anhelo.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Gloria tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable con sus pagos, porque sabe que como actúa cada persona en la vida se le devuelven las acciones buenas o malas; esta es su convicción es por ello que se dedica con esmero a su trabajo. Ya tiene planeado el destino del préstamo, pues será invertido en la compra de mejor de raza de ganado ovino y porcino.
texts.en:
Gloria is a happy and kind 40 year old woman who knows how to work without resting. She lives with her 54 year old husband, Florentino, and their three children. Wilder is 16, Milena is 13, and Susana is 12. She gets up early every morning. As the birds sing she starts her work of planting potatoes. She is accompanied by the whole family on the small farm, which is close to her house. She also raises sheep and pigs. As she is a hard-worker, she also helps her husband make multicolored weavings. Gloria is a great businesswoman, and in her own words, “I try to sell what falls in my hands”. It is very true, because she says that she sells the delicious potatoes that she harvests from her productive earth. It is also true of her well fed animals and the weavings that she makes day to day with her husband. Like all enterprising women, in the future she would like to buy more animals of a better breed and sell them at a greater price. That way she would get greater earnings. She would use that to send her children to school in the city, which is her greatest desire. This is Gloria’s third loan with MFP. She promises to be responsible with her payments. She knows that a person’s actions in life, good or bad, are returned to them. With this conviction she puts great effort into her work. She will use to loan to buy a better breed of sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals of a better breed

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung T., 49, is married with three children living at home in Takeo province. Two of the children are students and one is a construction worker.

Since 2000, Soeung T. has been working as a scarf weaver earning approximately US$5 of profit per day. Her husband is a mechanic, fixing motorbikes and bicycles in the village. On average, he is able to make US$4 of profit each day. 

Soeung T. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase mechanic’s tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools for her husband

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy, age 34, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. In her store, Christy sells baby supplies at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she hopes someday to own a larger store. She is married and has two children.

Christy is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more baby supplies to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora FELICITAS, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia trabaja en el mercado de Túpac Amaru, ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, 4 de ellos son mayores y cada uno es independiente y tiene su propia familia, nuestra socia vive con 2 de sus hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, ella trabaja en el mercado vendiendo frutas, nuestra socia es natural de la provincia de Sicuani, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia alterna el cuidado de sus hijos y otras responsabilidades del hogar con el comercio de frutas al por menor, ella solicita el préstamo debido a que deberá incrementar su negocio y comprar al por mayor frutas de los proveedores. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicitas is a member of the “United Women” Community Bank. She works in the Tupac Amaru market located in the San Sabastîan District, in Cusco. Our member is forty years old, has a partner and five children. Three of the children are adults and each one of them is independent and has their own family. Our member lives with two of her children, ages 5 and 3 years. She works in the market selling fruit. Our member is from the province of Sicuani, located three hours from the city of Cusco. Our member divides her time between caring for her children and her business of selling fruit as a retailer. She is asking for a loan in order to grow her business and buy fruit wholesale from the suppliers. Our member appreciates and is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing her own business. She promises to pay all of the payments on her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is asking for a loan to buy fruit on a wholesale level and in this way support her business..

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene M. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Marlene is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Marlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 60000 PHP every four months or harvest season.

In 2008, Marlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Marlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32000 PHP from ASKI. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a widow who has eight children. She is a gifted lady who is very skilled at making items out of beads. She sells these items in her home town of Sapele, in Nigeria's Delta state. She uses local materials to make these items. Beads in Nigeria are worn on many occasions, including weddings, burials and naming ceremonies. They are also worn by Nigeria's titled chiefs, because beads are given much respect in this country. Comfort also sells her wares at retail prices to her customers, and hopes to own a world-class bead shop in the future. She has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more of the materials she needs to make beaded items. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more materials from which to make beaded items.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger M. is from the village of Bug-ong Timogsay, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old and married.  To make a living, Roger owns & operates a motorcycle transport service for local community members.  Roger has been in business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service.  This loan will be his 1st from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family income. 
---------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily, 50, spends a lot of time managing her rice farming business. She enjoys working on the farm because it provides food, shelter, and clothing for her family. Lily is married to Ruben and they have four children.

Lily would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family but is limited as to financing the business. That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to obtain a loan intended for her business. She requested a loan of 14,000 Php, enough to buy materials and supplies she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a 62-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He catches fish to lift up his family towards success. He is married to Erlinda and has four children. He has 50 years experience in fishing. He wants to live a simple life, to have food for his family to eat and to pay his debts.

He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2003 and finds it helpful for his business. He is currently asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to provide more fishing supplies.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Genevive S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Trust. She is 39 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 7 to 20 years old. She could not continue her education through the 7th grade.
For 15 years, Genevive has been selling engine oil, kerosene, soaps and toothpaste at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia.
She sells goods that are high in demand and talks to her customers in a nice manner, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.
Genevive started selling with a little amount of cash. She now has an improved size of business at the Redlight market.
She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 39,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more engine oil, kerosene and soap. Her goal is to grow her business to a better size and to improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Genevive is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil, kerosene and soap.

loans.name: God Fearing People Group

texts.en:
Delvina K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Fearing People. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children who range in age from 3 to 10 years old. She was only able to attend school through the 11th grade but has decided to continue to the adult education program soon.

For 5 years, Delvina has been involved in hairdressing and sales of ladies handbags at the Jacob’s Town Market, Chicken Farm community in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells goods that customers demand, which keep them returning.

Delvina started by working in a beauty salon. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more handbags and hairdressing products. Her goal is to grow her business and to import hairdressing products to Liberia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Delvina is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' handbags and hairdressing products.

loans.name: Ayeh Mawuli

texts.fr:
Cette femme a 41 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants. Elle est maitresse couturière. Elle exerce son activité dans un atelier « COUTURE VIRGINIA » situé à Adidogomé. Elle associe à cette activité, la vente des articles de mercerie.
Elle achète ses articles sur place et les revend au détail dans son atelier. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra acheter de nouveaux articles pour les besoins de la clientèle.
Comptant sur l’accroissement de son activité, elle espère mieux répondre aux besoins de scolarisation de ses 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is 41 years old, married and has two children. She is a highly qualified seamistress. She carries out her activity in a workshop "COUTURE VIRGINIA", which is in Adidogomé. She combines this activity with the sale of haberdashery products. She buys her products locally and resells them on a retail basis in her workshop. With this loan she will be able to buy new products in order to provide for the needs of her customers. Since she is counting on the growth of her business, she hopes to be able to respond better to the schooling needs of her two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of haberdashery products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Sandra;  ella tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 1 hijo pequeñito; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales, entre otros productos en el mercado de Bella Vista Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor y venderlos en su stand en el mercado de Bella Vista - Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the "PEROLNIYOC" group. She lives in the province of Urubamba, which is in the Cusco region. She is Sra. Sandra. She is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and has a small son. She alternates her household activities with retail sales. She sells dried grains such as dried beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, and grains, among other products, in the Bella Vista - Urubamba market. She is applying for a loan to buy dried products at wholesale and sell them at her stand in the Bella Vista - Urubamba market. She is thankful for and values the support offered through loans and promises to make her payments in the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried products

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four people shown in the photograph are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. One of these people, Mr. Kav C., age 41, has been selected to be leader by the other group members. Kav C. and his wife currently have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. This couple has been fishing in the river for more than ten years and they earn an average of $6 per day. This allows them to support their three school-aged children, including school fees. Due to the coming rising water and fishing season, the river is full of fish. Kav C., however, is lacking equipment to fish and that is why he requested a loan. With the funds, he will purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing activities.

There are three other borrowers in this group who have requested a loan as follows:
Mr. L. will be using his first loan to better support his fishing business.
Mr. S. makes a living by fishing and is asking for a loan to buy more nets and traps fish better.
Mrs. S. is a grocery seller, asking for a loan to sustain her business growth.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing activities.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Hadjah changed her business enterprise from selling second-hand clothing to selling charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for a few months.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Hadjah decided to change her enterprise to charcoal because  many people were engaged in clothing .  Besides this charcoal business, she sells piped water to earn additional income .  Her customers are fellow market vendors and works six days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Hadjah decided to work with MCDT because it was helping low-income women to work hard by giving them capital.  She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, market dues and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Faizali

texts.en:
B. Faizali is 49 years old. He is married with three children. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to the livestock business. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Faizali decided to construct a place to keep his animals and for this he requires certain construction materials to accomplish the task at hand. Trustingly, he has sought IMON believing that his loan request will be granted and with this he will be able to move forward in his work. With the loan, Faizali will purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with two daughters. She lives in Zaporozhye. Svetlana sells women’s outer clothing in one of the biggest marketplaces of her home town. She owns a vending location and also rents two more and has hired employees to work there. Svetlana has been in business for over 12 years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her monthly income amounts to 18,000 Grivnyas. 

Svetlana is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear for the up-coming fall season. She is a typical workaholic, ready to spend long hours at work to achieve success. Svetlana is hoping to see her business grow and develop. One of her long-term goals is to purchase a nice facility and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth;  La socia tiene 2 hijos y es conviviente,  La socia se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado central, ella tiene un stand propio y cada día de lunes a sábados, la socia elabora comidas caseras para la venta.   La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de alimentos (comprar ingredientes.   
     
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Elizabeth; she has 2 children and lives with her partner. She sells food in the central market she has her own stand and works everyday from Monday to Saturday. Mrs. Elizabeth makes homemade food to sell and she needs the loan to invest in her food business. The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in food business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley O. lives the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 46 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living by selling snacks and delicacies popular in her community. She has been in this business for more than two years, and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients she needs to make the items she sells. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make items to sell to her customers

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Paz Y Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “PAZ Y DEZARROLLO”, está conformada por 14 socios quienes se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 12 meses.
Ruth emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo D. secretaria, tiene 30 años,  es casada y tiene 4 hijos.
DesD. hace 23 años se dedica a la venta D. helados, además apoya en el chifa D. su mama llamado “TOÑITO”, se inicio en este negocio porque anteriormente vivía en la casa D. su suegra vendiendo abarrotes, luego se mudo a la casa D. sus padres , cuando llego el verano logro ahorrar y con ese dinero puso el negocio D. los helados. Con el ingreso D. su negocio y el apoyo D. su esposo ha logrado comprar una herramienta para su esposo que necesita para su negocio como (martillo eléctrico, taladro).
Con el reciente préstamo, Ruth lo destinara en la compra D. helados para su negocio. Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The Paz y Desarrollo (Peace and Development) communal bank is comprised of 14 members who work in informal and retail sales.  They have been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for the past 12 months.

Ruth is an enterprising and enthusiastic woman.  She currently works as a secretary and is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  For the past 23 years she has worked selling ice cream and also helps at her mother’s Chinese restaurant called Toñito.  She started in the business because she used to live in her mother-in-law’s house selling groceries.  She then moved to her parent’s house and when summer arrived, she was able to save and she used this money to establish the ice cream business.  With the income from her business and her husband’s support, she was able to buy a tool that her husband needs for his work (an electric hammer, a drill).  With the current loan, Ruth will invest in the purchase of ice creams for her business.  

They are grateful for the funding for their businesses and will continue to make their loan payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase ice creams

loans.name: Katerera Farmers, Bushenyi Group

texts.en: M. Vasita, aged 52, is hard working and determined. She has worked tirelessly in her five-year-old produce business that trades in beans, millet, maize, coffee and other food crops in Nyamirima trading centre, Bushenyi. Her strong work ethic has gotten her far, as her business currently generates 320,000 Ugandan shillings per month. The married mother of three M. began her business with her own savings and has trouble meeting the demand in the area. With this loan, she looks forward to buying more produce which will increase her sales revenue and enable her to meet her family expenses.

loans.use: purchase of more stock for resale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with four children, one of whom still attends school while others have graduated. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, Miriam has operated her restaurant business, her customers being town dwellers and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators and so hopes to expand and have a bigger restaurant in the future.

Miriam first joined Yehu to get a loan to start her business, and with the Kshs 70,000 loan she is now requesting, she will purchase a freezer, 10 bundles of maize flour, 5 sacks of beans and 10 sacks of sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, 10 bundles of maize flour, 5 sacks of beans and 10 sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070032) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be her 5th loan taken out from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070032) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Newmee

texts.en:
Newmee M. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 31 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. Newmee has been engaged in rice farming for almost twenty years already. She learned farming from her parents. When she got married, she and her husband invested in land that they are now cultivating for rice crops. She also raises hogs to have an extra source of income. She hopes to acquire more piglets to grow.

Newmee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Newmee is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Pimentel que se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares y mantenerse activa.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victorina is a 35 year old mother living with her family in a marginal urban zone in Pimentel district located fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a store installed in her house.  She stocks daily use items and groceries.  Her customers prefer her store because she always stocks quality items and because of her kind treatment.  The business helps her husband meet household expenses and helps her to stay active.

She wants to expand the business buying more stock items in order to meet customer demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen C. de 63 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, donde vive junto a una nieta mayor de edad, la cual es su única compañía. Ella es una persona muy responsable quien trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su hogar. Desde hace 7 años que Yolanda invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa de tener una mejor estabilidad económica, y así mismo brindarle todo lo mejor a su nieta, la cual en la actualidad le ayuda a atender el negocio. Yolanda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr  por medio de dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría de las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar, por lo que dicho préstamo será de mucho beneficio para ella, ya que le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Carmen C. is 63 years old and lives in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her eldest granddaughter who is her only companion.  She is a very responsible person and has always worked hard to provide an income.  

For seven years Yolanda has been investing her savings in a fresh produce store which she began as a way of having a steady income in order to provide the best for her granddaughter who helps her out in the business.

Yolanda wants to use the loan to buy products such as cold meats and sausage, detergent, bread and other products.  Even though she has had the store for several years, the earnings she has obtained have always gone toward household expenses.  Therefore the loan will be beneficial for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Rahab Wairimu

texts.en:
Rahab Wairimu W. is 29 years old, married to Patrick Karanja, and they have three children. She has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last twelve years.

Rahab was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to buy two dairy cows with the loan amount.

In the future, Rahab hopes to employ modern farming methods to get the maximum yield from her farm.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem N., 62, is a local farmer who has been growing rice for many years. She is married to Rik Phan, 74, who works with her on the farm. In addition, Nhem N. sells a few fruits to her fellow villagers for a profit. 

This older couple has been married for many years and is blessed with seven children, all of whom are employed at different jobs. 

Nhem N. now needs a loan as capital to buy fertilizers and gasoline to stock up for putting into her existing pumping machine, which she uses to pump water for her crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for putting into her pumping machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling maize grain and sorghum. She is 40 years old, married, with two children and one goes to school. Betty took out a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. With extra profits from the business, Betty hopes to buy land and pay school fees for her children in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de repuestos de motos ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo llevan buen tiempo en este negocio a la vez la socia teje a mano y maquina chompas para damas, caballeros y niños ella trabaja a pedido desde su casa, la socia se siente feliz ya que mediante estas actividades la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas repuestos de motos y para comprar más lana para sus chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Ricchary Anteña Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Anta District within the Anta Province and the Department of Cusco.

Elaine is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling spare auto parts. She works with her husband and they have been in this business for quite some time. Elaine also knits women’s, men’s, and children’s sweaters by hand and using a machine. She works by request from her house and is happy because she gets her family ahead in life with these businesses.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more spare auto parts and more wool for her sweaters.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To purchase more spare auto parts and more wool for her sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty items for beauty salon business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and lives with his spouse who is a business woman and one other dependent. He lives in a rented home and his family goal is to work hard and become self sustained. Peter has a textile business, which he has operated for four years. He started it from his salary savings and faces a challenge of seasonal demand fluctuations. He hopes  to have a wholesale business. Peter is requesting a loan to purchase textiles.

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana T. is a widow living in Areg village with her two children, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Svetlana works as a housekeeper in the local Culture House. The main income to the family comes from agriculture. Svetlana's older son has left home to work abroad, to make his contribution to his family from there. Svetlana and her younger son work hard to ensure the household's financial stability. They keep livestock and cultivate land. Svetlana is a diligent borrower who has been able to improve her business with the help of a loan from Kiva partner, SEF, in the past. This time Svetlana wants to increase her number of livestock, buy seed to cultivate the land, renovate machinery and buy fuel.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, seeds and fuel and renovate machinery

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella tiene una tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en forma independiente, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas y lo vende en el mercado de Andahuaylillas, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LAS TRIUNFADORAS", which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Luisa is 40 years old and lives with her partner and seven children.  She alternates her daily activity with her business of selling corn.  She owns cropland where she grows the corn that she later sells on an independent basis in the district of Andahuaylillas.  She also raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens which she sells in the Andahuaylillas market.  

She wants to improve and expand her business and plans to use the loan to buy animal feed.

She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Viviana Azucena

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. El marido es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, vende ropa, zapatos y sandalias, además de  productos de Yanbal, Esika y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa y calzado compra en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que las sandalias son muy solicitadas por sus clientes ya que son bonitas y a precios razonables.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y sandalias. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras le han demostrado mucho cariño y ayuda.

Sus sueños son estudiar una carrera universitaria y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union y Solidaridad" meets twice a month in the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

In this place we meet Viviana, 23, who is in a common-law marriage that has produced two children aged 4 and 2.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Viviana is a housewife who, in order to generate her own income, has a business selling products through catalogs.  She sells clothing, shoes, sandals and also products from the Yanbal, Esika and Lebel lines (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.)  She works 3 days a week and she goes door-to-door taking orders.  She sells her products on credit and collects every week.  She receives the beauty products in her home, and buys the clothing and shoes in a distribution center.  She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well.  She tells us that the sandals are in great demand by her customers, since they are nice looking and are reasonably priced.  

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and sandals.  This is her 2nd loan cycle in this communal bank, and she likes it because her fellow group members have shown her a lot of support and kindness. 

Her dreams are to get a university education and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen de 56 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que están casados. Ella tiene su negocio de confecciones.

Comenzó esta actividad porque desde muy joven le enseñaron y luego una persona muy amable le provee materia prima y es así como ella empezó su actividad. Ella no tiene un horario determinado ya que ella tiene que cumplir con su contrato, existen días donde solo se dedica a su casa y otros a su actividad comercial. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para su vivienda y memas mercadería para su negocio. En un futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 56, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio in Guayaquil.  She’s separated and has five adult, married children.  She has a Dressmaking business.

She started this occupation because she learned it very young and a very kind person provides her with raw materials and that’s how she got into this activity.  She does not have a set work schedule because she has to fulfill her contract.  There are days when she only does her housework and others when she does her commercial activities.

With help from the loan she wants to buy materials for her house and more merchandise for her business.  In the future she’d like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread and to do home improvements buying building materials like cement, bricks and lumber.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 3 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and bananas, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his bodaboda (bicycle) transport business. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 5 months and 6 years. 

Caleb has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase chickens and chicken feed. He believes that, by venturing into poultry farming, his income will increase and this will enable him to afford a quality life for his family. His main fear is the common poultry disease in the area, which results in huge losses when it strikes. However, he is optimistic that his poultry farm will expand in future and he will be able increase his production of eggs.

He comments that Juhudi does a good job for the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Merlyn is a farmer in the Philippines. She grows vegetables to help her family. She plants vegetables like eggplant, string beans, tomatoes and bell peppers. Merlyn follows the excellent method of vegetable cultivation by planting vegetables in beds.

She earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every month in this cultivation. She has been doing this for two years. Merlyn requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay for the labor cost of soil preparation. 

Merlyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Merlyn hopes that she can distribute vegetables in the market nationwide.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of soil preparation.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

She operates a business of buying and selling chickens which she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because her place of operation is insecure. Saumu dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 50 chicks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 chicks for sale.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es: Franco es un joven entusiasta y emprendedor, tiene 28 años, está casado con Reina de 27 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos Sherlin, Mayte y Briana. Esta familia vive en un domicilio alquilado, ubicado en la localidad de Palca. Como joven padre de familia, su principal fortaleza es la vitalidad con la que hace cada cosa. Desde hace 7 años, se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, zanahoria y maíz, en terrenos arrendados y algunos heredados a su esposa, Lo que más le llama la atención en sus tareas es proteger sus sembríos para evitar que sean invadidos por la plaga de insectos, así como también le disgusta caminar largas horas para llegar a sus chacras porque no existe una carretera. Mientras labraba sus cultivos paralelamente aprendía los oficios de un panadero el cuál ejerció este último año; en su pueblo de nombre Santo Domingo de Palca (Tarma- Perú), al ver las buenas utilidades que recibe de ambas actividades planea en el futuro instalar una panadería donde podrá elaborar desde panes hasta pasteles y tortas, pero sin tener que dejar de sembrar debido a que gracias a la agricultura su familia tiene estabilidad económica. Además comenta, “es lo que más me gusta”. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Además se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Franco de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, una bolsa de semilla de arveja y papa. Con esto espera comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Franco is an enthusiastic and enterprising young man. He is 28 years old and is married to Reina, who is 27. They have 3 children together, Sherlin, Mayte, and Briana. This family lives in a rented house, located in the town of Palca. As a young father, his main strength is the vitality with which he does everything. For 7 years he has been planting potatoes, peas, broad beans, carrots, and corn in rented fields, and some fields that his wife inherited. What he pays the most attention to in his work protecting his crops so they won’t be invaded by a plague of insects. He also dislikes having to walk long hours to get to his fields because there is no road. 

While working with his crops, he also learned the trade of baking, which he has been doing for the last year. He lives in a town by the name of Santo Domingo de Palca (Tarma, Perú). Because of the good income he receives from both businesses, he plans, for the future, to open a bakery where he can make everything from bread to cakes and pies. But without quitting farming because it is thanks to the agriculture that his family has economic stability. Also, he says, “it’s what I like most.” 

He belongs to the “Santo Domingo” communal bank and this is his eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, where he hopes for the support of every one of you so that he can continue with his plans. Additionally, he promises to make his repayments punctually. Upon receiving your support, he will use the money he is requesting to buy several bags of natural fertilizers, and one bag each of pea seeds and seed potatoes. With this he hopes to be successful in his next planting season.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers, pea seeds, and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Suhailah

texts.en: Suhaila is a 46-year-old woman who has started a small retail business at home buying and selling different types of cover sheets such as blankets. It has been four years now since she started. During these four years, she was able to help her husband who is a bus driver support the family of seven members including them. Suhaila has applied for this loan to buy other types of blankets that her customers requested, so she can continue to keep them as loyA. customers.

loans.use: To buy other types of blankets and cover sheets to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 59 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Santa Cruz que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Juana se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y de aves de corral, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Juana es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
Juana, 59, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Santa Cruz District that belongs to Cajamarca Department.  This zone is noted for farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Juana has been selling basic need items (milk, rice, oil, sugar, noodles, etc.) and beverages for several years.  Her business is located in her house for her comfort and safety.  Profits obtained from the sale of her products she tries to use to cover her expenses and improve her family’s standard of living.

To expand the business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy more merchandise and barnyard fowl.  Her only ideal is that the business grows and that she has a wider selection of stock merchandise to offer her customers.  Juana is a hardworking, dedicated person who strives to provide more comforts for her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been operating her carpentry and welding business for the last 12 years in Kasieku, Emali town. She is 32 years old married to Robert, and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan, which she intends to use to purchase timber and iron sheets for the business. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business and open a hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase timber and iron sheets  for the business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old enterprising businessman who is married to Catherine. He has been running a barber shop as the primary business and farming as the secondary business for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. James will use the loan to buy a shaving machine and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will expand the barber shop.

His hopes are to open a big barber shop and a salon, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine for the barber shop and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jonalyn has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergents, breads, and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bread, and other miscellaneous items to sell

loans.name: Umoja Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja OAF Group in Western Kenya!  Saul is the facilitator of the Umoja OAF group. Saul and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  This group resides in Chwele district.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Saul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Saul takes care of 2 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to increase farm profits and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Saul had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1.5 acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Saul was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Saul will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja OAF group will each plant between ½ and 1 acres of maize.  

In the photograph above, Saul is pictured with his group members, with their Field Officer at the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Julieta has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин женат имеет семерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. В бизнесе 21 год. Он занимается торговлей мужских сорочек. В бизнесе ему помогает старший сын. Он по оптовым ценам закупает на рынке «Атуш» товар и продает в рассрочку. Полученные доходы идут на расширение  бизнеса и часть на содержание семьи. С приближением зимы он хочет увеличить объем зимних сорочек и пополнить оборот товаров. Для этого ему нужны средства. Он хочет получить займ и закупить по оптовым ценам товар. Он надеется на получение займа. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdulmumin is married and has seven children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been in business for 21 years and is involved in sales of men's shirts.  His oldest son helps him with the business.  Abdulmumin buys merchandise at wholesale prices at the "Atush" market and sells it based on installment plans.  He uses the resulting income to expand his business and support his family.  With the onset of winter, Abdulmumin wants to increase the volume of winter shirts and refill merchandise inventories.  He needs funds to do this.  Abdulmumin wants to obtain this loan and purchase merchandise at wholesale prices.  He hopes to get this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to refill merchandise inventory

loans.name: Abelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora Abelina del Carmen, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 15 años, es Soltera con 4 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
