Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Abelina atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, bloques, arena, cemento y mano de obra para realizar las mejora en la casa en lo que es cuarto, para mayor seguridad de su vivienda. Por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Abelina del Carmen works hard as an elementary school teacher in a small municipal school in the town of Telica, León Department; she’s had this job for 15 years.  She’s single and has four children that she has to provide proper conditions for their development.

One of the needs Abelina is going through these days is to do some home improvements because it’s been in poor condition.  She has therefore made the decision to call upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, sand and cement and to pay labor costs to do this home improvement which will be a room for better home security.  Through this project she will provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Veverian

texts.en:
Veverian is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Veverian has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Veverian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anita Yolanda

texts.es:
Anita es una persona alegre, responsable, luchadora y trabajadora que le gusta sacar adelante a sus hijos que tienen 12, 9 y 6 años de edad, viven en San Gabriel que está en la Sierra Norte de Ecuador. 

Trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos blancos, esta actividad empezó a practicarla cuando tenía un solo chanchito hace un año. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de cerdos blancos y la construcción de un corral ya que al momento no tiene donde criarlos adecuadamente. Esta inversión permitirá que sus ingresos económicos sean buenos para mantener a sus hijos ya que el único ingreso que ella tiene para con su familia.

Su sueño es ahorrar y con las ganancias llegar a tener mi casa propia, a sus hijos darles lo mejor que sigan estudiando y sobre todo estar bien económicamente y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Anita is a cheerful, responsible, tenacious person who likes to move her children who are 12, 9 and 6 years old forward; they live in San Gabriel which is located in Ecuador’s Northern Sierra.

She works alone raising white pigs.  She started this activity when she only had a little piglet a year ago.  This is the second Fodemi loan request that she will use to buy white pigs and to build a corral because she currently doesn’t have a space to raise them in adequately.  This investment will cause her income to be good so that she can support her children since this is her only source of family income.  


Her dream is to save up and use profits to own a house, to give her children the best so that they can continue going to school and, above all, to be in a good economic condition and that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy white pigs and to build a corral for them.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgillo is 42 years old and blessed with six children. To provide for their needs, he is engaged in a farming business as a source of income. He suffers difficulty supporting his family because of their large household.  Nevertheless, he works hard to earn enough to pay the expenses for his family.  

Virgilio is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, used to develop his business. Through these inputs, hopefully he can yield bigger crops to save for his family. Though sometimes tiredness makes him weak to continue life, he still hopes to achieve a bright future. He knows that with the help of Almighty God, he can provide his families with the convenience of life.

loans.use: buy farming inputs

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.es: La señora Maria Patricia es madre de un hijo de 15 años de edad, hace varios años se separó de su esposo; con el fin de generar los ingresos para su familia, la señora Maria Patricia inició hace tres años su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de empanadas en colegios y restaurantes, la empanada es un producto a base de masa de maíz y relleno con carne, pollo, papa y arroz. Con el tiempo, la señora Maria Patricia inicia con un nuevo negocio de vender sus empanadas precosidas y su producto terminado ofrecerlo en un local de su propiedad junto con alguna bebida liquida como gaseosa o café. Actualmente, la señora Maria Patricia trabaja en su local con dos hermanas quienes le colaboran desde las 8.30 a.m hasta las 7:30 p.m. La señora Maria Patricia requiere de la compra de materia prima que le permita elaborar sus productos, mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos y con esto la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Maria Patricia es tener otro local y en este emplear por lo menos a 10 personas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Patricia is a single mother with one child: a 15 year-old son. She separated from her husband a few years ago.  With the goal of generating income for her family she started her own business 3 years ago.  She makes and sells empanadas - a corn based tort filled with chicken, potatoes and rice - to schools and restaurants.  

Having had success with her initial business, the Señora Maria Patricia started a new business selling pre-made empanadas and offering them in a store along beverages such as sodas and coffee.  She works with her two sisters each day from 8:30am until 7:30 pm. La señora  Maria Patricia is in need of a loan in order to purchase raw materials that will allow her to make more products, improve her sales and increase her income, thus improving the quality of life of her family.  Maria Patricia's dream is to open an additional location where she can employ at least 10 people.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as corn, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Sumayiyah's Group

texts.en:
Sumayiyah's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sumayiyah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sumayiyah has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Sumayiyah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Sumayiyah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Sumayiyah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a Wholesale shop. 

Sumayiyah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sumayiyah's future prospects by helping her to learnt how to handle her customers.

07/19/12	8504	896
07/26/12	8601	799

08/09/12	8797	603
08/16/12	8897	503
08/23/12	8998	402
08/30/12	9101	299
09/06/12	9204	196
09/13/12	8050	350

loans.use: to buy more food for resale,

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business buying poultry to sell for over ten years. She has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. Her husband has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years. He is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle to use as well as to sell for a profitable price. Additionally, he runs a motor taxi when he is free from his farming work. 

In order to improve her family's standard of living, Sokha has requested a loan of USD 600 to purchase chickens and ducks to run a poultry farm. By doing this she aims to generate more income to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to rent a store at the market to sell chickens and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks to run a poultry farm.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar es de la ciudad de Pilar, todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo luchadoras. Las miembros trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Severiana quien se dedica a la venta comidas y remedios yuyos. Ella  nos comenta que mediante este negocio su economía pudo mejorar ya que  ella mantiene su  casa.  Según la Sra. Severiana (Ña Tana) como la llaman de cariño las compañeras ,  mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo y autoestima.
Ella soliciata el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos con los cuales prepara sus comidas.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar committee is located in the city of Pilar.  All of the women are very hardworking and fighters.  The members work together in solidarity in this program.

A very moving story is that of Severiana who sells meals and natural remedies.  She tells us that through this business she has improved her finances so she can maintain her household.   According to Severiana, Ña Tana, as her friends call her, her activities with Fundación Paraguaya  are very important because she can develop her business skills and self-esteem. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is a 37-year-old mother of 4 children in Tanzania. Her husband works as a daily worker on the field which doesn't give him much money - by far not enough to take care of his children's school education. Therefore, Roda and her husband decided to open a local pub in which local food and drinks are served. This increased the family's income, yet the pub had to close early in the evening because there was no electricity supply like in her entire village. With the help of African Solar Rise, Roda could test a solar system so that she could open her pub longer. Moreover, she got a solar radio which attracts customers' attention and so her turnover increased. Roda also offers the service of charging phones on her solar battery. She and her husband hope to be able to save up enough money for their future and their children's education. They are asking for help to be able to fully buy the solar system that has proven to have a huge impact on their monthly income.

loans.use: to use solar power in her pub

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen has lived in Guayaquil for over twenty years where she owns a small grocery store. She is a widow with three children that she cares for by herself. She lives in a remote area of Guayaquil but she knows her business well as she has over 13 years of experience. With the loan she will be able to purchase products in bulk and lower costs.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi K. is married and the father of two. He is a great sculptor in his community. His wife has gone back to being a stay-at-home mom and therefore brings in no income. To address the needs of his family, Mr. K. puts all of his energy into sculpting. Noteworthy and valued for his fine work, he is disciplined and honest as well. All these qualities make him a trustworthy man, and more and more clients come to his shop. His initial loan of $400 was repaid without a problem.

Mr. K. is requesting a new loan of $800 to acquire more modern equipment and ebony wood for producing better artwork. He will also open a more effective workshop. With all these improvements, he is going to become a true artist and to be able to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, Monsieur K. Komi est un grand sculpteur dans sa localité. Sa femme réduite à la fonction de ménagère n’apporte aucune contribution aux charges du ménage. Pour faire face à tous les besoins de la famille, Monsieur K. investit toutes ses énergies dans la fabrication de ses articles. Remarquable et apprécié de par la finesse dans ses travaux, il est aussi rigoureux et honnête. Toutes ces qualités font de lui un homme de confiance et reçoit dans son atelier une clientèle de plus en plus abondante. Son premier crédit de $400 qu’il a obtenu est remboursé sans aucun incident.

Monsieur K. sollicite un nouveau crédit de $800 pour acquérir un équipement plus moderne, du bois d’ébène pour une meilleure prestation de service et ouvrir un atelier plus performant. A travers cette activité, il va devenir un véritable artiste et prendre bien soin de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy art supplies and materials

loans.name: Ortikboi

texts.en:
M. Ortikboi is a coordinator of the group “Farz”. He created this group when he decided to apply for loans. The group was founded on 18 August, 2005. Since then, Mr. M. has been an active participant of MicroInvest microcredit program.

Mr. M. is engaged in the trade of food products in the Zafarabad district. At the beginning, his sales turnover made $150. At the present time, it is about $800. Due to the organizational skills of Mr. M., the group paid off the loan on time. Mr. M. purchases the goods at wholesale from Zafarabad market and re-sells them in the shop by retail. He wants to take a loan and bring goods from Khujand, Istaravshan and other countries. In the future, Mr. M. wants to expand his business and open a trade outlet / grocery store.

loans.use: Trip to wholesale market

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has been a saleswoman for five years. She used to sell food from her home but had to stop due to health problems. Her husband therefore helped her to start her own business selling various products. He gave her $70 to start off and with it she bought various products which sell well. She works weekdays from 6am to 10pm.

She will use the loan to buy more products for her shop, such as: paper, notebooks and workbooks, pens, presents and household objects. Clients have asked Olga for these products and she hopes that the investment will help to improve her earnings.

Olga is married. She is 52 and has five grown-up children, two of whom help her with her business. Her house is being finished bit by bit. Her husband delivers construction materials for a living. All of her children live with her although 3 of them now have their own families. Her goal is to have a bigger shop so that she can serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Olga tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad de comerciante. Ella vendía comida en el portal de su domicilio y por problemas de salud tuvo que dejar la comida. Viendo esto su esposo le ayuda para que ella se inicie con un negocio propio. Decide ponerse un local de venta de artículos varios. Ayudándole el con un valor de $ 70 dólares para capital de trabajo. Con los que compro mercadería variada y le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para su bazar. Como lo son: papelería, cuadernos, plumas, regalos, y además desea comprar artículos para el hogar. Olga tiene pedidos de estos artículos y espera con la inversión que realizara mejorar sus ingresos.

Olga es casada. Tiene 52 años. Cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Dos de ellos le ayudan con la atención del negocio. Su casita poco a poco la esta terminado de construir. Su esposo trabaja realizando fletes de materiales de construcción. Todos sus hijos viven con ella pero ya tienen su familia formada tres de ellos. Su deseo es poder tener un local más grande. De esta manera poder darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy paper, notebooks, workbooks, pens, presents and household objects/Invertir en papelería, cuadernos, plumas, regalos, y además desea comprar artículos para el hogar.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay K. is running a small kiosk in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She is thirty-years old and a single parent of two children.  As a single parent, she is responsible for the welfare of her children. Although Admsay started with small capital, her business improved with her previous loan from SMT.  Recently, she began producing tye and dye and successfully selling it from her kiosk. Adamsay is requesting another loan of $200 to help her increase production of her tye and dye activity.

loans.use: Increase inputs for Tye and Dye business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Señora Elsa is 51 years old and has 5 children. At the moment only one of her kids is in school. He is in Junior High School, and another one of her children helps with the business. She lives in Pisocoyacu, in the Hualla province, and in the community of San Martin, and she is a member of the community bank ”Piscoyacu”.

She is a baker, who has her own bakery and there she sells sweets, sandwiches and she makes decorations to sell. She decided to start her business with her husband. Her husband was the one who initiated the business; they started the business because they realized it was a profitable business that they could work at everyday and it would help improve the economic situation for her and her family.

The loan that she just received from Manuela Ramos for 3,000 Soles (approximately $ 1,000) with a payment plan consisting of six payments. She will invest the loan in the purchase of large sacks of flour, oil by the gallon and yeast by the kilogram, salt and more ingredients for the making of bread and sweets. She needs to invest more money in her business to be able to satisfy the needs of her large clientele in the population Piscoyacu and Saposoa.

Her recent goal is to grow her business, and to buy an electric mixer so that she can hire more people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa tiene 51 años y tiene 5 hijos, actualmente solo uno D. ellos es estudiante D. educación secundaria, y otro D. ellos colabora en el negocio. Vive en la localidad D. Piscoyacu, provincia del Huallaga, departamento D. San Martín, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Piscoyacu”. Se dedica a la producción D. panes, tiene una panadería donD. también venD. dulces, tortas y hace decoraciones. Decidió iniciar su negocio junto a su esposo, ya que al principio fue iniciativa D. él y lo hicieron porque vieron que era un negocio rentable, D. todos los días y que así también mejorarían su situación económica y la D. su familia. El crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00 aprox.) pagadero en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra D. harina en sacos, aceite en galones, levadura por kilogramos, sal y otros insumos más para la producción D. panes y dulces, para poder satisfacer la necesidad D. su amplia clientela D. la población D. Piscoyacu y Saposoa. Su meta más cercana es agrandar el negocio, comprándose una máquina mezcladora y así dar trabajo a más personas.

loans.use: Buy flour, oil, and yeast.

loans.name: Martha Gilma

texts.es:
Martha and her husband are in the food business, and besides food they sell sodas and pastries. Another part of their it is to provide phone services. Martha started this business 10 years ago, with US$ 800 that she and her husband had saved. They have a son. He has been the inspiration that help them keep going. They didn't want him to lack anything, specially their love and the possibility to go to school. And it was because of their support that Martha's son grew up and became self-sufficient. Now they have a grandson.

Before Martha had her own business, she used to sell clothes made in Panama. Then she started the food business from scratch, and little by little it has grown in size and clientele. They are making profits. Martha says that CEPRODEL has been a great help, because it has always being there for them. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years and she has repaid 7 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva volunteer.

Este negocio se caracteriza por la venta de comida, gaseosas, repostería, además consta de alquiler de telefonía. Martha comenzó con este negocio desde hace 10 años con un capital de US$800.00 que eran ahorros de ella y su esposo. Tienen un hijo el cual era la razón del sacrificio de esta pareja, ya que no deseaban que le faltara nada a su hijo, principalmente educación y amor. Gracias a este sacrificio ya el hijo es mayor e independiente y les ha brindado un nieto

Antes de tener su propio negocio, ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa nueva panameña. Su negocio comenzó con pocas condiciones, sin embargo poco a poco ha logrado ir creciendo tanto en clientela como en ganancias. Ella comenta que CEPRODEL ha tenido un fuerte impacto en su negocio ya que siempre ha estado a su disposición a la hora que lo ha necesitado.

Lleva más de 2 años trabajando con CEPRODEL con un récord de 7 créditos.

loans.use: Buying goods to sell

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en: Ramez is a 29-year-old married man. He lives in the Bekaa with his wife and child. Ramez is a car mechanic. This will the Ramez's third loan from A. Majmoua. He is requesting $1000 to buy equipment and materials to upgrade his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and materials to upgrade car mechanic business

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai C. L., 49, is married with seven children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works hulling rice and selling clothes to the people in her area, making around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband is both a construction foreman and a blacksmith, earning around $10 each day in revenue. Five of their children attend school and the other two are married and live separately.

Mrs. Thai C. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rice from the growers for her grinding mill and buy more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase more rice from the growers for her mill and buy more construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Yuberki

texts.en: Yuberki is a twenty-two year old single woman and she sells women’s clothing and beauty products in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Yuberki has already finished secondary school and wants to attend a university. She explains that public university is located at Santo Domingo, the capital, and that she’ll need money to travel outside her community daily to attend classes. Yuberki says she will keep working very hard to achieve her goal. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more goods in order to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her income.

loans.use: Yuberki would like to purchase clothing and beauty products to restock her small business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Sophia H.. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children (a 3-year-old and a 9-year-old). In 2007, Sophia established her tailoring and clothing business. She works very hard to earn about $30 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband. Sophia seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing. In the future, Sophia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana belongs to the community Bank Mujeres Creatives 2, located at Jr. Maya de Britto and Alfonso Ugarte, in the district Calleria in the city of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and she has 1 child, and she is divorced. Juana with the first loan she received in the amount of S/.300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest the funds in the buying and selling of fish.

Today she sells her fish in teh Bellavista market, for which she starts her day at 4a.m. to get her stand ready for sales she carries on until 11a.m.. Afterward she goes back home to care for her little boy and her home.

With this loan amounting S/.700, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase: different kinds of fish.

Juana is very happy because thanks to this loan she will receive through the community bank she has progressed in her business and her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto con Alfonso Ugarte, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 1 hijo, es divorciada,. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad ella vende sus pescados en el mercado de Bellavista, se levanta a las 4 am. de la mañana para ir a su puesto de venta y ofrecer sus pescados hasta las 11 am., luego se dirige a su hogar para atender a su pequeño hijo y su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: pescados de diferentes especies, como paco, gamitada, boquichico, palometa, sardinas, carachama, etc. Juana esta feliz, por que gracias a este préstamo recibido a través de su banco comunal esta progresando en su negocio y en su vida familiar.

loans.use: With the loan she will be able to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., 35 years old, is a member of TYM Fund for the second year. She has 10 years experience of selling animals. This is an activity that requires a huge starting fund but it also yields very high profit. Besides selling cattles, Mrs. H. also sells their meat for locally people. Her family current average income is 300 USD. She spends this money on sending 2 children to school and furnishing her house. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more cattles to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Hương năm nay 35 tuổi, đang là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ TYM. Chị đã có 10 năm làm nghề buôn bán gia súc. Đây là một nghề cần phải có vốn lớn nhưng lại thu được lợi nhuận cao. Bên cạnh việc mua bán trâu bò, chị Hương cùng chồng còn mổ thịt để cung cấp thực phẩm tươi sống cho nhân dân trong thôn xã. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình là 300USD. Số tiền này, chị dành một phần nuôi 2 con ăn học, một phần để sắm sửa đồ đạc trong nhà. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua trâu, bò.

loans.use: Buy cattles

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn P. is a firewood seller in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Pheap Chuon, is currently in the palm sugar selling business. They have 2 children, one of whom is attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or attend school. Even though Mrs. Savoeurn P. and her husband have different business activities, they still do not have enough money to pay for finishing to build their house. Thus, Mrs. Savoeurn P. now asked for a loan to pay for a house construction worker. Mrs. Savoeurn P. and her husband are pictured under their new house.

loans.use: To pay for finishing to build the house

loans.name: Suzane

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Suzane M., who is married and has two children aged three and seven. In 2007, Suzane established her charcoal business. Working six days a week, eight hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $30 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. In the future, Suzane plans to increase both the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra began her business after working at various jobs. She found that the salaries were very low, and Alejandra wanted to earn more so that she could get ahead. She decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband cover the family's expenses and pay for their children's education. Alejandra wants her children to get ahead so that they can have a better future and better professional opportunities. She began in January of 2003, first selling ceramics. That didn't go well, so Alejandra finished off the merchandise. This year she began to sell clothing in the nearby markets and her business has taken off. She was able to buy a small car to transport her merchandise more easily to other neighborhoods and now she also sells toys and some haberdashery. This is going very well and Alejandra is now giving classes in embroidery.

Alejandra needs a loan of $400, which she'll repay in 4 months. She'll use the loan to buy more toys and used clothing for the new season, and to have a better variety of products to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandra inició el negocio porque trabajó en varias lugares como empleada pero los sueldos eran muy bajos y quería ganar mas, mejorar y superarse para salir adelante, fue por eso que decidío mejor poner su propio negocioya que necesitaba un ingreso aparte del de su esposo para ayudar con la educación de sus hijos y sacarlos adelante para que tengan un mejor futuro y mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Comenzó en enero de 2003, primero comenzó vendiendo cerámica pero no le fue bien y tuvó que rematar la mercancía; ese mismo año comenzó a vender ropa en los mercados rodantes y le empezó a ir muy bien de tal manera que puede comprar un carrito usado para mover su mercancía mas fácilmente a otras colonias y ahora también ya vendo juguetes y algunas artículos de mercería y le esta yendo muy bien ya que además esta dando clases de bordado.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas juguetes y ropa usada de temporada y tener un mejor surtido y variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Canaverales Group

texts.en:
It was 10 a.m. this morning while I was going about Kiva Fellow business, when I got a call from the Friendship Bridge office - there was a group meeting in an hour and a half and two bus journeys away, if I was available T. go and meet with them? Sometimes travelling T. these remote villages can be a tedious part of the job of a Fellow, but Santa Clara is one of my favourite villages that I have visited, and I don't hesitate T. agree T. go.

After the long but easy journey there, I meet with the Cañaverales group on the patio next T. the kitchen of a senior member just off one of the main streets of Santa Clara. The bright floral-patterned blouses and skirts of the women nearly blind one with their brilliance and the space is abuzz with their happy conversation and laughter. Children of all ages dart back and forth between the women, being so affectionate with each that it's difficult T. tell which woman is a particular child's mother. Despite the commotion, it takes only a few moments before I can quiet everyone so I can ask them a few questions.

Despite the fact that Santa Clara is most famous for basket-making (as proudly displayed on the sign that welcomed me inT. the town), the common thread of the group is that all 17 women tend small farms, raising either chickens or pigs or both. Fourteen of them also supplement their income with embroidery while three others put their sewing skills T. work. One of the women also buys and sells clothing. The group's president, Carmen Rosa, who has a farm of 50 chickens and embroiders as well, tells me that none of the women has T. leave the town T. sell their products as Santa Clara is the commercial hub for the surrounding area.

These women are no strangers T. micro-credit. They already know the life-changing potential of this money; for some of them, this will be their eighth loan. Friendship Bridge is implementing a new repayment scheme for experienced groups such as this one. The Cañaverales will pay back this loan in 9 months instead of the normal 13, and they're quite confident of their ability T. meet this more demanding schedule.

T. my question about the benefits this loan may bring, one of the older women, Catalina, tells me that she just recently had all her chickens and her pig slaughtered. With the credit that she's applying for now, she hopes T. replenish her stocks and this time she'll try T. raise two pigs. Another younger woman, Florinda, stands up and says that with the profit she makes with her embroidery design, her ever-growing young children will finally be able T. have clothes that fit them for school.

My last question of the session: what are your dreams? The answer is never very different from group T. group, or even person T. person, anywhere across the world. All the women want their children T. have a better life with more opportunities than they have had. Resoundingly and almost in one voice, they hope that their children can achieve a level of education that was unavailable T. them. The extra money from micro-credit loans like the ones provided by Kiva and Friendship Bridge will help ensure that this will happen.

loans.use: invest in buying more animals to raise

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. is married and has one child. She has received no formal education. Hannah sells groundnut, beans and alata soap in large quantities at Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of the Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1990. 

Her husband is a farmer. Hannah uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more food, such as beans and groundnut, for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to expand her capital base to increase her profit.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to purchase more food like beans, groundnut and others for resale.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Née le 24 avril 1982 à Baguida et nantie d’un certificat d’aide accoucheuse, Mlle Y. Améyo est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour faire face à sa période de chômage elle décida alors d’ouvrir un point de vente de produits générique pour sa communauté puisqu’elle maîtrise un peu ce domaine. Ceci fait et avec le nombre des années qui passent la demande devient de plus en plus forte puisqu’elle est reconnu dans sa zone comme point de vente en produit générique. Mais ne pouvant pas faire face toute seule à cette demande croissante elle sollicite un appui financier pour lui permettre de s’approvisionner.
Ce crédit débloqué serait d’une grande utilité puisqu’il permettra d’augmenter ses revenus d’une part et mettre à la disposition de la population les produits génériques de premières nécessités.
texts.en:
Ameyo Y. is married and the mother of one child. She was born on April 24th, 1982, in Baguida, and holds a certificate as Midwife Assistant. To weather through a period of unemployment, she decided to become the source of sale for generic products (medicines) in her community, which has since become her specialty. This was accomplished over the past few years, and an ever increasing demand has made her the main source for these generic products in her area. She has been unable to meet all her customers needs and is therefore requesting a financial loan to allow her to purchase inventory.

This loan will be put to great use, allowing, on one hand, an increase in revenues and on the other hand, providing access for the local population to generic products of basic necessity.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of generic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a new machine for his construction.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been a member of the Legion Village Bank for more than three years. She is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She and her husband run two Chinese restaurants in the city of Ayacucho. Both are centrally located; one is on Manco Capac Avenue, while the other is near the Nery Market. She and her husband work as cooks and employ two people to help serve the customers. Norma has been in the restaurant business for seven years. 

Norma is requesting a loan of 2100 soles to buy more ingredients like rice, eggs, oil and condiments. She will travel to Lima’s Chinatown to buy the condiments. 

Norma’s dream for the future is to build her own house (she currently lives in a rental property).

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, eggs and Chinese condiments

loans.name: Ejike James

texts.en: James Ejike O. is 41 years old and married with two children. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. He sells tires. He is currently a Lapo microfinance client. He needs a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase addtional tires to sell. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en:
There are four people who form this small loan group, residents of Battambang Province, Cambodia. N. has been selected to be group leader by the members. N., 48, currently lives with her four children, all of them students. She is a vegetable seller, selling apples, grapes, melons, and peaches etc., earning approximately US$ 5 per day.

N. is married to Mr. Samout, 49, who is a Khmer traditional music player for wedding parties in the village. N. runs her fruit stand, selling early morning and finishing in the evening to help earn their living. Currently, she sold all her fruit from her store and she needed to buy more fruit to sell, that’s why she requested the loan.

The other three borrowers are:

M., a local tailor, who is requesting a loan for her husband's farming business activities;

N., a grocer and a widow, asking for a loan to enlarge her business; and

C. E. who sells sugar cane juice and needs a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Yao

texts.en: Yao K. lives in Thkouv village in Cambodia's Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Puth Teng, pictured on the left, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from the house, he spends a lot of money on motor taxis. Yao K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce expenses and provide a better life for her family. She is 61 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa sells clothes and she is also a tailor. She sews lovely clothes for her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She is 39 years old and married with a child. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.en:
Lâm Mai is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Lâm raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lâm has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lâm joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lâm has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Lâm is requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Lâm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: Buy livestock.

loans.name: Kayivi

texts.fr: Madame A. Kayivi vit à Agomé-Glozou dans la préfecture des lacs, localité dans laquelle elle est née en 1951. Mariée et mère de neuf (09) enfants, elle s’était investie très tôt dans sa jeunesse dans le fumage et la vente de poissons dans sa localité, une activité qui très lucrative qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Pour répondre aux sollicitations de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un financement en vue de d’accroître sa capacité production et ses revenus. Ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Kayivi lives in Agomé-Glozou, in Lacs prefecture, where she was born in 1951. She is married and the mother of nine. Very soon in her youth, she had invested herself in the smoking and selling of fish in her town. It’s a very lucrative business enabling her to address family needs. To respond to the requests of her evermore numerous customers, she’s requesting financing with the goal of growing her production capacity and her revenues. This will enable her to improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
La señora Ida P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz de Motupe II, vive en el CPM de Marcac, Distrito y Prtovincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, tiene 25 años, madre de 02 hijos que dependen de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 05 sacos de limón, en una temporada en que eran caros.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre vendiendo en el mercado de la parada a pesar de que han sido reubicados por el Municipio de Huaraz.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 comprará 15 sacos de limón ya que es temporada alta, y se encargará de repartir a todos sus clientes del mercado “la parada”.
En la actualidad se siente una mujer feliz y segura, porque puede tomar sus propias decisiones en los ingresos que genera.
Ida, manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Ida P. M. is a member of the Cruz de Motupe II Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Huaraz province. She is a 25-year-old mother of two who still depend on her.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased 5 sacks of lemons during the season in which they were expensive.

She currently has this same business. She always sells her produce at the La Parada Market even though they have been relocated by the Municipality of Huaraz.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase 15 sacks of lemons because they are in season, and she will make sure to distribute them to all of her customers in the La Parada Market.

She feels very happy and self-confident because she can make her own decisions regarding her earnings.

Ida expresses her gratitude to the Manuela Ramos movement for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale lemons

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumberdani

texts.en: Ni Luh Sumberdani - (DNR.M-0688) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. Ni Luh Sumberdani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Luh Sumberdani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs. Ni Luh Sumberdani is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Luh Sumberdani - (DNR.M-0688) merupakan 41 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Sumberdani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Sumberdani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Sumberdani menghasilkan sekitar 1,500,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2009, Ni Luh Sumberdani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Sumberdani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 6,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Sumberdani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Her husband runs a provision store. Comfort trades in food items such as salted fish, vegetables, smoked fish, etc. on a table-top stall at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi city. Comfort also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Comfort aspires to expand her business and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto R. tiene  43 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es mayor y los demás son menores de edad. El señor R. se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte. Don Carlos R. dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual por ayuda de una hermana logró comprar su primer microbús con el cual empezó a ahorrar y comprar lo necesario para acondicionarlo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su microbus, el cual le comprará llantas y batería para un mejor funcionamiento del mismo. Su meta principal es seguir creciendo en la empresa de transporte, mediante la compra de más unidades de servicio, que provea un futuro para su familia en general.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Alberto R. is 43 years old, is married, and has three children, of whom one is an adult and the others are young. Mr. R. offers transportation services. Carlos R. started his business 6 years ago, during which time he, with the help of his sister, was able to buy his first minibus. He started to save and then bought the necessary items to upgrade it. The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for his minibus. He will buy wheels and a battery to have his vehicle function better. His main goal is to continue growing his transportation business by purchasing more service units, which will provide a future for his family in general.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos que son su mayor inspiración de salir adelante y vive con su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo maderera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que realiza en su casa. Adicionalmente, se asoció con su esposo en el negocio de la compra y venta de madera. Por otro lado, lo que le gusta de su trabajo de costura es que sus clientes tienen confianza de su buena labor y la recomiendan mucho. Además le es rentable porque cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes desde el momento en que inició su negocio, sin embargo, con lo que obtiene mayores ganancias es con el negocio de la venta de madera. Para un futuro cercano, Nilda quiere alquilar un local para instalar una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y  lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrante se entienden, son amigos y hay mucha comunicación. Del dinero que viene solicitando; 1000 soles usará para la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales y lo restante lo invertirá en su negocio de venta de madera.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

loans.name: Abed Allah

texts.en:
Abed Allah is a 47 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abed Allah has owned bakery for over ten years. He does “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where you do the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Abed Allah requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery and repair his oven. This is the first time that Abed Allah has requested a loan.
Abed Allah is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does good mankoucheh. His clients are people from her region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery and repair his oven.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 50 years old and blessed with three children. She is already ten years managing a simple furniture business with her husband. Their incomes from the business enable them to pay for the tuition fees of children during their studies from elementary till college. She also uses her loan in improving her business and supports the immediate members of the family. For their business to grow and become competent, Marilyn is requesting to avail the amount of PHP10, 000 from lenders as added capital in purchasing woods and other materials they needed in manufacturing furniture.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Peou

texts.en: S. is a 50-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang province. S. is a widowed mother blessed with six children: three are married and have ready started new homes, two are students, one works on the farm. S. currently owns a cultivating machine that she uses for her farming. In addition, she uses her machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. Unfortunately, the machine has often broken down during the plowing process. Because of this problem, S. would like a loan to purchase spare parts in order to replace a part of the cultivating machine. Note: S. was not available for photographing, so her son is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to replace a part of the cultivating machine

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane A. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Maryjane is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maryjane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is from the village of Dela Paz. She is 48 years old. Alma is married and has adult children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a snack vending business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn L. is from the village of Salawagan in Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Rizalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizalyn owns and operates a retail store where she sells everything from dry goods, sandals, t-shirts to other ready-to-wear items and kitchenware. Rizalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rizalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Rizalyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Rizalyn's 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy S., 49, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. To earn a living, she raises pigs and makes rice wine together with her husband and earns approximately US$5 of profit every day.

This couple has five children, four of whom are students and one is a local garment factory worker. Navy S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Tomasa Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Tomasa tiene 61 años de edad, procreo cinco hijos, ella trabaja como conserje en una casa campaña desde hace más seis años para poder sastifacer sus necesidades, sus hijos la apoyan ya que sus ingresos son bajos, poco a poco a logrado ir mejorando su casa con el préstamo anterior compro materiales de construcción para hacer un muro, el cual se ha beneficiado ya que tiene mayor seguridad, con este financiamiento comprara materiales para construir el portón principal del porche a si como reparar el que tiene, y pintar las verjas. Para esto comprara: tubos, soldadura, cener, pintura y comenzar hacerlo. Sus planes a corto tiempo es poder poner ropa de venta en su casa ya que entre poco será mas difícil poder trabajar por sus enfermedades el cual espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 61 years old and has five children. She has worked as a caretaker at a vacation house for more than six years to meet her expenses. Her children help support her, as she earns very little.

Slowly, she has managed to improve her home. With a previous loan, she bought materials to build a wall, which has brought her greater security. With this loan, she will buy materials to build an entrance gate to the porch and paint the railings. She will need iron, welding supplies, paint, and thinner.

Tomasa plans to have a clothing sales business in her house because it will soon be difficult for her to work because of her health. She expects that she will be able to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron, welding supplies, paint and thinner to build a gate and paint the railings.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 73 años y es madre D. 08  hijos, 01 que  aun depenD. D. ella y esta estudiando.

Esmeralda, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo algunos D. sus  metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta D. ropas usadas y le esta yendo muy bien, en este tipo D. actividad, ya que tiene clientes fijos que la conocen y saben D. su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar muy bien acondicionado. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará mercaderías D. ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  D.  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Esmeralda belongs to “Las Orquídeas II” Community Bank, located in Tarapoto District, San Martin Provence, San Martín Department. She is a 73 year old widow, and mother of 8 children, one of which is a student and still dependent upon her. Esmeralda is a happy woman who is persistent and capable. She tells us that little by little she has been achieving her dreams and goals. She currently sells used clothing, and is doing very well at this job now that she has regular clients that know her and her business. The business is located in her house which is well-equipped. The fortituD. and perseverance that characterizes Esmeralda has helped her to become an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has accomplished. With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, she will by clothing such as: pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses of all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and girls dresses. She expresses with enthusiasm and optimism how proud of herself she is for what she has achieved. She says: I am grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered me, to be able to count on the loans that help me to become a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is a native of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and striving hard to help meet her family’s needs. At her age, she is seen as a strong and jolly person and firm in her desire to improve her standard of living.

In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She has utilized her loans for her primary business of selling jewelry and fashion accessories and her secondary business, a manicure and pedicure service. Since she became a member of ASHI, she has been able to maintain very good performance. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos to use as additional capital for both businesses.

She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and to save for her children’s future. Her greatest aspiration is that her children will be able to finish their schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: Additional working capital for selling jewelry and fashion accessories and for manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is 24 years old and she is still young in marriage. She takes care of one dependent who is 16 years old. Giselle lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Giselle has been in the business of selling raw cloth to her customers so that they can sew trousers, shirts and some other styles. This is her sixth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Giselle needs to expand her business through purchasing cloth of good quality and colors. With this business expansion, she hopes to attract more customers who will come in her shop to purchase her cloth. Once they come, she hopes that her sales will increase as well as her profits.

Giselle has a target of keeping her business financially stable and through her access to this loan, she hopes that her target will be achieved.

loans.use: To purchase cloth of good quality and colors

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma R. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies, and this time, Gemma's husband managed their motorcycle used to transport passengers in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI; that previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gene

texts.en: Gene S. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Gene is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gene operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Gene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Gene from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kafuki

texts.en: Kafuki P. is currently in the business of selling beer and charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more beer and charcoal to sell. Kafuki is 40 years old and is widowed. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beer and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jayawathi

texts.en:
Jayawathi  is 47 years old and married, living with her husband and one 24-year-old daughter.  Her husband has a timber business, in which he uses a chainsaw to cut and sell timber.  Jayawathi assists him with this as well as with her own venture involving coir-making.  Jayawathi and her husband make a good team and work together in their businesses.  Both of them have a lot of experience, as she has managed her business for 12 years and her husband has managed his for 10 years.  Jayawathi is an honest and hard-working lady.

Jayawathi has asked for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to assist her husband's timber business.  Pictured above are Jayawathi and her husband.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop the timber business

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells sarongs and laces at retail prices. She hopes to own an African boutique in the future. She is 45 years old, married with 3 children.  Her husband sells electronics spare parts to support their home. She loves the business because of the profits that she makes from her business. She is requesting for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" to sew

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La señora Vicenta Rodríguez se dedica a la venta de ropa usada por más de 12 años donde ella tiene zapatos, monos de peluche y ropa. Este negocio ya es conocido por sus clientes pues ella tiene amabilidad con ellos al ofrecer sus artículos con el apoyo de su esposo que también es comerciante ambulante para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vicenta necesita el apoyo de esta institución para seguir ofreciendo calidad de lo que ella vende.
texts.en:
Vicenta Rodríguez has been selling used clothes for over 12 years. She sells shoes, stuffed animals, and clothes. Her business is well known by her customers. She is friendly to them when she shows them her products. Her husband helps her. He, too, is a street vendor in order to cover the family expenses. Vicenta needs help from this institution to keep offering quality goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Chup

texts.en: Mrs. Chup P., 22, is a young woman and the mother of a young child who is not enrolled in school. To earn a living, she owns a small store inside a market, which is a good location to raise income. In her shop, she sells different kinds of items such as soft drinks, sweets, plastic goods, and cooking ingredients. To help be responsible for their family, her husband is an internal staff member of an entertainment club. Chup P. currently is selling well because she is skilled at communicating with the public. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan to use as capital to accumulate a bigger quantity of various inventory items to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a bigger quantity of various inventory items to sell

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Raimundo M. nasceu no Distrito de Namarroi, província de Zambézia, Norte de Moçambique, é divorciado e pai de 9 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 5 aos 27 anos, todos vão a escola. Fez a 10ªclasse não concluiu devido a problemas de saúde. Vive na casa própria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.


Sai de Zambézia a procura de emprego, junta se com sua esposa que o abandona quando ele fica doente. Hoje é auxiliar da migração ha mais de 22 anos, aufere um salario de 2.120.00mt mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu negócio consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.



Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o segundo empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com pretende comprar produtos (cigarros, colgate, sabão, massas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt foi usado para compra de material de construção. Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo, para construção de um estabelecimento e deixar de ser vendedor ambulante.
texts.en:
Raimundo was born in the Namarroi District, Zambezia Province, North of Mozambique. He is divorced and the father of 9 children between 5 and 27 years old. All children go to school. He completed 10th grade but didn't finish school due to health issues. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone other than his family. He left Zambezia looking for a job and moved in with his wife. She left him when he got sick. He has been a migration assistant for more then 22 years. He earns a salary of 2,120 meticais a month, which goes toward household expenses. With the help of his own business he manages to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He became familiar with Hluvuku throught friends who are also clients of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticais, is his second. He intends to buy products (cigarettes, toothpaste, soap, pasta and others) in order to increase his inventory. His previous loan, in the amount of 7,000 meticais, was used to purchase construction material. He is confident he will not have issues paying back the loan and will request another to build his own shop and no longer be a street vendor.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (cigarettes, toothpaste, soap, pasta and others)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is an excellent blacksmith who lives and works in Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. Mahmoud is 54 years old and the father of one daughter. Mahmoud retired from the Palestinian National Authority and receives a salary from them.

Mahmoud took a $1000 dollar from FATEN to buy a few tools that he needs to improve his business. Because the situation in Gaza is not very stable, he couldn't save from his current income to buy the tools he needs.

In the photograph, Mahmoud appears in his workshop in Gaza.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: El Buen Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Buen Progreso es un grupo solidario de larga trascendencia, pero a su vez de muchos cambios a través de su historia. Actualmente se encuentra conformado por Blanca López E., Miriam del Carmen D. T. y Olga de la Cruz Arroyo C..

Blanca, quien es su coordinadora desde hace 2 años es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada de 34 años que se dedica a la compra/venta de cosechas de distintas frutas desde hace 7 años. Ella es soltera y se dedica a comercializar las compras de Tamarindo y Nancite preferiblemente en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Miriam y Olga son mujeres maduras de 51 y 57 años respectivamente, la primera es comerciantes de cosméticos de forma ambulante en su comunidad y el mercado de Masaya; en cambio Olga vende nacatamales en su casa pero su principal actividad es destace de cerdos y la venta de leña.

Estas tres mujeres tienen una gran fortaleza y deseos de superación a pesar de las adversidades que han tenido. Ellas invertirán el crédito otorgado para la compra de nuevos insumos para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Buen Progreso” (Good Progress) communal bank has prevailed for a long time. There have been many changes through the years. The group is currently comprised of Blanca López E., Miriam del Carmen D. T., and Olga de la Cruz Arroyo C.. Blanca has been the coordinator for two years. She is a hard-working and dedicated 34 year old woman. She has been buying and selling different fruit crops for seven years. She is single. She devotes herself to selling tamarind and “nancite” (a Nicaraguan berry). She prefers to sell in the market in the Mayasa municipality. Miriam and Olga are mature women, 51 and 57 years old respectively. The first one sells cosmetics in an iterant manner in her community and the Masaya market. On the other hand, Olga sells “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale) in her house. However, her main activities are butchering pigs and selling firewood. These three women have great strength and the desire to excel in spite of the adversities they have faced. They will use the loan to buy new supplies in order to increase their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Brisas De California Group

texts.es: Rocio es la presidenta D. Grupo “Brisas D. California” el cual lleva 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo y es conformado por 7 personas las cuales son amigas. Rocio tiene 39 años y vive en la zona D. AH las Brisas D. california, D. ahí el nombre D. grupo ya que los demás miembros también son vecinos suyos, ella trabajo vendiendo queques al comienzo y ya desD. hace 5 años que venD. sus dulces en su casa, con lo cual junto a su pareja sostienen los estudios y gastos D. hogar, además tiene la meta D. poner un restaurant.
texts.en:
Rocio is the president of the Group, “California Breezes” which has worked with Edaprospo (Kiva’s field partner) for a year and it is comprised of 7 people who are all friends.
