Rocio is 39 years old and lives in the AH area Brisas D. California which is where they got the name of the group since the other members are also her neighbors. Rocio worked selling cakes and 5 years ago she has sold candy from her home and with her partner they are able to pay for household expenses, her future goal is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prodcuts and merchandize.

loans.name: Delger

texts.en:
Delger L. is 30 years old, a married man living with his wife and three grown-up children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in their current home for the past 17 years. His older son, 23, and daughter, 19, are both university students while his middle son, 21, currently serves in the Mongolian military. 

Delger operates a vegetable trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He provides a large selection of vegetables to his customers. He started his grocery business in 2006, and since then he has been able to increase his working capital. During several years of successful business activity, he has used his earnings to provide for his family and was able to cover his children's educational expenditures. 

For the future, he is planning to build a new cellar for preserving vegetables out of his earnings. Moreover, he hopes for continued success and to purchase more vegetables and says, " I continue to provide for my children's education. From my future expected earnings, I will build a new cellar in my yard." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of vegetables and preserve them for the coming autumn months when prices for those products traditionally decrease.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of vegetables

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 48 years old. Marivic is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marivic has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Kihihi Development Association, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking and cordial B. Abdu is married with 6 children to take care of and knows that he has his responsibility cut out for him. This reality has been evident for the past 5 years as he has managed his business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, from the town of Kihihi. 
With his monthly earnings amounting to 240,000 UGX, he has faced long odds in providing for all his family’s needs and principally catering for his children’s welfare. Abdu wants to raise his family's living standards with this loan by improving his business. By restocking and expanding his shop, he plans to make it a wholesale business, allowing him to earn more sales revenue and pay his children's education bills.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and expand the business

loans.name: Ahmadchon

texts.ru: Эркаев Ахмадчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке "Дехкон". Занимается продажей овощей и приправ. В этой области более 4 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Ahmadchon E. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 34 years old, married and has 3 children.  He has a secondary education and works at the "Dehkon" market.  Ahmadchon is involved in sales of vegetables and spices.  He has been in this business for over 4 years.  He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a house wife and stays at home doing her household responsibilities.  She has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions.  

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he is a scrap dealer. He operates his shop in the market from where he sells scrap to different factories and other scrap dealers on order.
 
Jameela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap such as plastic bottles, used papers, etc. in bulk quantity to sell through his shop. 

Jameela is hopeful that with the growth of her husband’s business, her family’s living standard will be improved and they will be able to enjoy the better facilities of life.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.  They are residents of a city called Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Their house is located in a colony named Mujahid colony and contains 2 rooms.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Renita is married and has 3 children. Renita has a piggery business. She also helps her husband at their rice farm. She helps keep it free of weeds and pests and keep the rice crops healthy. Renita does her best to keep a balance between business and family. She makes sure to spend time taking care of her children. 

Renita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Renita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en:
Avelyn C. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Avelyn is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Avelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Avelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Avelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Avelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Avelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for repairs to her stove & purchase corn

loans.name: Mary Wakini

texts.en: Mary Wakini W. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  Mary has been a water vendor and a bodaboda operator in Shanzu for the 26 years and the businesses are doing well. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to service her motor bike and renovate her business premise. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Mary’s dream for the future is to own rental equipment.

loans.use: To service her motor bike and renovate her business premise

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She and her husband also tend a small rice farm. They also own a carabao that helps in tilling the land. Norberta works hard to help provide for her family and improve their living.

Norberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norberta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Esther Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Esther tiene como actividad la elaboración D. cotillones como ser gorritos, canastitas, tarjetas, recuerdos y otros todos ellos trabajados en goma Eva, esta actividad se constituye en un apoyo para el ingreso D. su familia  que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus pequeños hijos, la Sra. es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora en esta ocasión solicita crédito para la compra D. materiales y materia prima para así poder ampliar su actividad y también para la compra D. una maquina D. costura para mejorar su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Esther’s activity is manufacturing party supplies like little hats, little baskets, greeting cards, keepsakes and others out of Eva foam.  This activity helps support contribute to family income.  The family is maD. up of her husband and small children.  

She is a dynamic, hard working person who is asking for a loan on this occasion to buy raw materials to expand her activity and also to buy a sewing machine to improve her work thus having an improved quality of life.  She is a hard working, responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maggi

texts.es: Maggi  Baoque con su nuevo credikiva, que es el cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  y el segundo con KIVA,   continuará invirtiéndole al mejoramiento de su local, porque cada día su clientela crece y ella está dispuesta a lograr   un sitio muy confortable para ellos, así es que ella  está posicionadose en su mercado,  pues además agrega valor a su trabajo porque estudia pedagogía y eso mismo aplica a sus clientes, que la reconocen por su gran vocación de servicio y de enseñanza ala comunidad. Su  sueño  y gran desafío es construír su segunda planta para separar totalmente su negocio de su espacio familiar. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Maggi ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/173221
texts.en:
Maggi Baoque will use her new Kiva loan, which is her fourth with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and second with Kiva, to continue investing in improving her locale because her customer base is growing daily and she wants to accomplish having a very comfortable place for them.  She is positioning herself in the marketplace adding value to her work because she’s studying Teaching and she applies her knowledge to her customers who recognize her vocation for service and for teaching the community.

Her great dream and challenge is to build a second story to totally separate the business from her living quarters.  

If you’d like to know Maggi’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/173221

loans.use: For physical improvements in her Internet access business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman who lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: selling RTW - ready to wear clothes, a sari-sari store and pig fattening. Her husband Edgar, who is 42 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 5 mos. and 19 years old. Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of Ready-to-Wear Clothes  so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Jocelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: purchase Ready-to-Wear Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three sons in Hovd province of Mongolia.  They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own.  Her husband helps her with the business and her two older sons attend college while her youngest son goes to a secondary school. 

Uranchimeg began operating her business in 2002.  In the beginning she used to sell ice-cream and drinks and now she sells many kind of food stuffs. She has been operating her business for nine years and has gained a lot of experience from her business.  She bought furniture for her home with her business revenue. 

She is a hardworking person who says, "I support my family through the profit from my business and pay my children's school fees.  I want to expand my business".  She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase more food stuffs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 30 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Flordeluna works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeluna runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soaps, sugar, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Flordeluna has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, sardines etc.. 

In the future, Flordeluna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ruperto Lirio

texts.es:
Ruperto de 59 años, es un hombre trabajador  que inicio su negocio con poca mercadería el escogió es actividad por que le gustaba estar en la tienda.

En la actualidad trabaja todos los días de 7H00am a 10H00pm. Está casado y ella es  ama de casa tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad uno de ellos le ayuda en la tienda. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, confites, bebidas gaseosas. Lo que anhela es seguir en el negocio para tener prosperidad para su familia
texts.en:
Ruperto is 59 years old. He is a hardworking man who started his business with a little merchandise. He chose this business because he liked being in the store.   

At present, he works every day from 7:00 am to 10:00 p.m. He is married and she is a housewife. They have three grown children and one of them helps at the store. With the loan, he is going to buy rice, candies and soft drinks. What he longs for is for his business to prosper for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, candies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica a la venta de quesillos. Tiene más de veinte años en este negocio, con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha salido adelante. Alba sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto, por lo que se siente contenta de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de crema, queso, tortillas entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Alba Luz sells quesillo (a type of cheese).  She’s been in the business for over twenty years.  With much effort and sacrifice she’s gotten ahead.  Alba goes out every morning to sell her product and feels happy to have a means of earning family income.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy cream, cheese and tortillas among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy cream, cheese and tortillas.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry, vive con su esposa, él es comerciante tiene 3 años y medio de vender distinta mercadería como bocinas, carteras, controles para televisores y más. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar más de estos productos: audifonos, lamparas, controles y mejorar su inventario, de esta manera siempre tener la disponibilidad para los clientes.
Él pretende mantenerse en el negocio e ir creciendo poco a poco, para ofrecer un mejor futuro y una vida más confortable con su esposa.
texts.en:
Henry lives with his wife.  He’s been a merchant for three years selling miscellaneous merchandise like speakers, wallets, television remote controls and others.  For the moment, he’s asking for a loan to buy more of these products: earphones, lamps, remote controls, to improve his inventory and always have availability for his customers.

He expects to stay in business and gradually grow to offer a better future and more comfortable life to his wife.

loans.use: to buy music CDs, DVDs, speakers, loudspeakers and other accessories.

loans.name: Benkelema  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA  4 sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konona, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de dah, de pois sucré, de gombo etc.
ROKIA, la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10  members of the Benkelema 4 group are married women averaging 34 years of age, with five children, living in traditional extended families in Konona, a settlement about 30 km from the town of Niena, the Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

These customers are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of having the necessary tools and agricultural inputs. The previous loans have been repaid in satisfactory manner.

This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts (ground nuts), bissap, sweet peas, okra etc. Rokia, the group’s leader plans to use her loan to  pay for one bag of urea [fertilizer] and other necessities, such as the costs of manual labor and weeding. [S]he envisages achieving an average monthly income of 10,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and manual labor

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She and her family live in Calamba, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Luzviminda is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living.  She has been doing this work for two years. She plants a good variety of vegetables both for family consumption and for business. She earns PHP 4,000 every month from her vegetable produce.  But the income from her vegetable production is insufficient for their daily consumption, so she must double her production to meet their need.  Luzviminda decided to request a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting season. 

Luzviminda is a new member of GDMPC.  She hopes that someday she will have a hectare of vegetable plantation.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with five children, three attend school while two have graduated. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati (flatbread), beans and rice. She also sells detergent and clothes, which contributes another source of income. Pamela faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergent. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and washing detergent.

loans.name: Andrea Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es casada, vive en la ciudad D. Pilar, ella no tiene hijos y vive con la compañía D. la madre D. su esposo.
La Sra. posee un negocio donD. comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, tiene casa propia y su marido trabaja como vendedor. La despensa D. la señora es muy conocida en el barrio por lo que ya ha formado una gran cantidad D. clientes. Ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora, ella lucha por generar mas ingresos, para que D. esa forma pueda solventar los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. bebidas, comestibles, lácteos para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en: Andrea is a married woman living in the city of Pilar. She doesn't have any children and lives with her mother-in-law's. She owns a business where she sells day-to-day necessities. She owns her own house and her husband works as a vendor. Her store is very well known in the neighborhood, and so has already gained a large number of customers. She considers herself a very hard-working person and is struggling to bring in more income so that she can take care of her household expenses that way. She's requesting the loan to purchase drinks, food products, and dairy products to stock her store. She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they offer her.

loans.use: to purchase food products, dairy products and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 28 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 13 years old.

Married at a young age, Ana Marie did her best to help her husband in providing for their household needs. Now, she helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She also runs a small sari-sari store business where she sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, eggs and others.

Ana Marie is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help improve their harvest. She also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa de 47 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia que pudo comprar gracias al arduo trabajo y esfuerzo que siempre mostró ante las adversidades y dificultades que la vida le puso en frente.La actividad de Felipa consiste en levantarse temprano para ir a realizar las compras necesarias para vender en la bodega que tiene en su casa. Además de esta actividad, Felipa posee dos mototaxis los cuales alquila a algunos conductores. En la bodega que tiene ella recibe el apoyo de sus hijos cuando están libres ya que ellos estudian gracias a lo que  su madre les puede brindar.
Según Felipa, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo libre y puede usarlo para otras cosas a parte de estar en la tienda. Lo que no le gusta es que a veces algunas personas afanosas quieren comprar a crédito algunas cosas pero la experiencia le enseñó que esta forma de trabajar no es buena. Espera poder agrandar su tienda ya que hasta ahora le esta yendo bien y a pesar de los pocos meses que lleva en este negocio.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Felipa y MFP, siempre se llevó bien con los integrantes de su grupo y espera poder seguir así ya que quiere seguir trabajando con ellos por que le demostraron que son muy responsables.Con el préstamo solicitado 1000 soles, ella comprará abarrotes y algunas bebidas para implementar su bodega.
texts.en:
Felipa, age 47, is the single mother of two children.  They live in her own house, which she was able to buy thanks to her arduous work and the effort she always shows facing life’s adversities and difficulties.

Felipa’s business activity consists of getting up early in order to go make the purchases she needs to sell at the general store she has in her house.  In addition to this activity, Felipa has two “mototaxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles) that she rents to some drivers.  Her children help her in the general store when they are free.  They go to school thanks to what their mother is able to provide for them.

According to Felipa, the thing she likes the most about her work is having free time and being able to use it for other things besides being in the store.  What she does not like is that at times some difficult people want to buy some things on credit.  However, experience has taught her that working this way is no good.  She hopes to be able to expand her store.  It has been going well for her so far, in spite of the few months that she has had this business.

This is Felipa’s third loan with MFP.  She has always gotten along well with the members of her group, and she hopes to be able to continue to do so.  She wants to keep working with them because they have shown her that they are very responsible.

She will use the 1,000 soles that she has requested to buy groceries and some drinks for her general store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and some drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has six children. Three of her children have already married and live separately and two other children are working as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh where they can earn a low salary per month. The last one is enrolled in school. 

As for her husband, he works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good weather for her crop. However, Thou doesn’t have enough capital yet to use on her farm. So Thou is seeking a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Thou is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Mohamedi

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso ville et âgé de 23 ans, Monsieur Mohamedi est un célibataire sans enfant résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kaboïla II- Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas la chance d’avancer dans les études, il s’est initié il y a dix ans à cette activité d’achat-vente de fruits et légumes et de tubercules : pomme de terre, orange, citron, patate, melon, bananes, ignames mangues, etc. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau de Bamako, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce premier prêt il achètera dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso, 10 sacs de pomme de terre, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de citron et 20 sacs de patates douces. Ses ventes sont faites en gros et en détail, au comptant et crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales mais surtout aux  restaurateurs.  
Avec ce premier crédit, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in Sikasso and 23 years of age, Mr. Mohamedi is single without children. He lives in a large extended family in Kaboïla II- Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali). Not having had a chance to go on with his studies, ten years ago he launched a business buying and reselling fruits, vegetables and tubers: potatoes, oranges, lemons, sweet potatoes, melons, bananas, yams, mangoes etc. With his long experience, he enjoys a good business reputation in Bamako and receives many orders, but lacks the necessary resources to meet demand. And so he joined Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan, which will allow him to increase his working capital in order to meet the customers’ expectations. This first loan will allow him to buy  10 bags of oranges, 15 bags of lemons and 20 bags of sweet potatoes  from villages around Sikasso. He sells wholesale and retail, for cash and on credit, to customers coming from all social segments but mostly to restaurant owners. With this first loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover the essential expenses for himself and his relatives and to pay off the interest on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and tubers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 56 years old and married with 7 children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying & selling dried fish.

Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito natural de la ciudad de San Miguel, tiene 42 años, esta casado Fortunata de 40 años y tienen 05 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa en el distrito de Samugari perteneciente a la selva Ayacuchana.
Los verdes campos de su comunidad, han sido en la vida de Benito un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, pues él proviene de una familia que por tradición siempre se han dedicado a la agricultura, y actualmente cuenta con su propia parcela de 3 hectáreas y en ella siembra cacao, café y plantas de maní. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, pues de esa manera ve su recompensa luego de mucho dedicación y esfuerzo. Tiene 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que el transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de Santa Rosa, le resulta muy difícil. Por otro lado comprará calaminas para renovar el tejado de si vivienda. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras para luego heredarlos a sus queridos hijos. Este será su 17avo crédito con MFP, sus anteriores créditos le fueron muy beneficiosos para invertir en su parcela y en esta oportunidad espera contar con el mismo apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará materiales de construcción para poder refaccionar el tejado de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Benito is from the city of San Miguel.  He’s 42 years old and married to Fortunata, 40.  They have five children.  They live together in their own house in Samugari District belonging to the Ayacucho jungle region.

The green fields in his community have been Benito’s life.  It is a very pleasant place to work because he comes from a family that’s been traditionally involved in farming.  He currently has three hectares of land where he grows cocoa beans, coffee and peanuts.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting because that’s the reward for his hard work and dedication.  He’s been in this line of work for 15 years and considers transporting his crops from his community to the gathering centers located in the city of Santa Rosa to be the most difficult part.

On another note, he plans to buy sheets of plywood to reroof his house.  In time, he hopes to gather enough money together to buy new fields to then pass down to his beloved children.  This will be his 17th MFP loan.  His previous loans were very beneficial for him to invest in his field and on this occasion he hopes to have the same support from you so that he can continue making progress.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy construction materials and supplies to reroof his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж тракторист. Сама она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется не большой продуктовый магазин. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения продуктов питания.
texts.en: Nilufar lives in the town of Tursun-Zoda. She is 32 years old. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is a tractor driver.  As to Nilufar, she works as a vendor. She has a small grocery store. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to stock up on food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a 30-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and only child. She has been selling beauty products for the past ten years. She works on a freelance basis, targeting a wide range of clientele. Today, she’s requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of new beauty products. She intends to increase her business sales in order to earn a higher income. Her future plan is to open her own beauty centre soon.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es: Candida Azucena, Ramona, Dominga, Armando, María, Ramona, Zoyla, Iris, Cleto y Silvia. La señora Silvia se dedica a elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que llegan a comprar sus productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, entre otros productos ella se encuentra muy contenta con este medio de vida. Todas las personas que conforman el banco se encuentran contentos por esta oportunidad.
texts.en: Cándida Azucena, Ramona, Dominga, Armando, María, Ramona, Zoyla, Iris, Cleto and Silvia makes and sells tortillas.  The business has been in operation four years.  She has quite a number of customers that come by to buy her products.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and bags, among other products.  She feels very happy with this way of life.  All the members of the bank are happy for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and bags, among other products.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 24-year-old divorced lady, who started 2 years ago selling used clothes.

Wisam buys used clothes from those who want to sell and fix them if needed then re-sells them. She has applied for a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes at a lower price so as to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Cruz se dedica a la venta de loteria menor y mayor de Honduras, tiene veinte años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la compra una vez por semana y la vende de Jueves a Domingo en el parque central de Tegucigalpa, gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de variedad de Lotería y así poder obtener mayores ingresos, ya se aproxima la navidad y en esta epoca es cuando mas vende, desea estar preparada para las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria de la Cruz sells lottery tickets for the grand and small Honduran lottery.  She’s been doing this for 20 years.  She buys once a week and sells from Thursday to Sunday in the central park in Tegucigalpa.  Thanks to the income she receives. She’s managed to move her children ahead.  She depends on her husband to cover the household expenses.

She will use the money from this loan to buy lottery tickets and be able to increase her income.  Christmas is approaching and it’s during this season when her sales increase.  She wants to be prepared to meet her cousin’s demands.

loans.use: compra de loteria menor y mayo en pliegos.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Michael.  He is married and the father of a seven-year-old child. In 2009, when he dropped out of school, Michael established a business selling spare parts for bicycles. He is applying for a new loan, his fourth, for Le 5,000,000 to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers. He hopes this loan will allow him to increase his profits by Le 202,000. His goals for the future are to expand his business and educate his child through the university level. His business is popular because it has a good location. In the future, he plans to build his own shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por la parroquia de Paccha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
  
La Señora. María tiene 60 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Con su esfuerzo ha construido su casa propia.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende toda clase de frutas, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 40 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo ambulantemente sin un horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar su casita.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes ["New Horizons"] communal bank. She lives in the Paccha parish in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the four rivers which surround it. It has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since 1999. The people of Cuenca maintain their culture and traditions.
María is 60. She is a single mother of two; both of her children are grown, married, and independent. Through her own hard work, she has been able to build her own home.
Maria is a merchant. For more than 40 years, she has sold all types of fruits. She works every day of the week, selling in street markets without a fixed schedule.
She has been a member of her communal bank for thirteen years and she will invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials to add the finishing touches to her home.
Her goal is to complete her little home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel Concepcion; el tiene 82 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, el socio vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, el socio junto con su esposa trabajan en el restaurant, ellos preparan diferentes platos como pollo al horno, estofado de pollo y sopas, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant, el sueño del socio es mejorar el restaurant. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “TINKA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
This is Mr. Manuel Concepcion. He is 82, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his restaurant business. He sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. He and his wife work in the restaurant, preparing different dishes such as baked chicken, braised chicken, and soup. He would like to expand his restaurant; his dream is to improve his restaurant. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for cooking, such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables wholesale.
He is happy to have this loan and promises to pay his quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a food shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Christian Ivan

texts.es:
Christian Ivan tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Cristian se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y cacao, además cría animales como  cerdos y pollos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para utilizarlo en la agricultura y comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá mejorar el trabajo, Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas de langosta, las inundaciones y la variedad del clima. El sueño es crecer con el negocio y comprar tierras.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el  deporte.
texts.en:
Christian Ivan, 20, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of the Nuevo Horizonte communal bank located in the Cachely Grande precinct of Ventanas Canton.  This bank focuses on short-cycle agricultural work such as growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Christian works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and cacao.  He also raises animals such as pigs and chickens.  He buys and sells his agricultural products in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to use in farming buying seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and supplies.  With the help of the loan he will be able to improve his work.  He faces challenges such as plagues of locusts, floods, and temperature change.  His dream is to grow with the business and buy land.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and supplies.

loans.name: Jaycebelle

texts.en:
In the Philippines, if you want to start your own business at home, Direct Selling is one possible option. It’s where you’ll become a reseller of a certain company and you’ll be provided a brochure to show to your customers the products like ready-to-wear clothes for men & women, foot wears for all ages, make ups, appliances and items for personal use. 

In every business, you should be patient and persevere to succeed. Like Jaycebelle, one of the partners of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is engaged on a direct selling business. It is a business that doesn’t need to have high capital to start but having the passion and dedication to be successful. However, late payments can’t be avoided since most of her customers are just her neighbors and friends. She wants to continually sustain the needs of her family and support for her children’s educational expenses. She’s thankful for knowing CCT as they nurture every entrepreneur members. 

This year, Jaycebelle wants to apply for another loan of Php 10, 000 to have additional product on display since availability of the products is one thing that should be considered on this type of business. Jaycebelle is anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a big help for the business.

Jaycebelle regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To have additional products to display for her Direct Selling business.

loans.name: Nighty

texts.en:
Nighty A. is one of the most active Life in Africa member from the displaced Acholi quarter in the ouskirts of Kampala. In addition to working in a stone quarry, she also now earns a part time income making solidarity bracelets to increase awareness of the war in her home of Northern Uganda.

Nighty's husband has deserted her but she has struggled for the welfare of her family. She has managed singlehandedly to send all her children back to school and has also managed to save a little bit for further development.

With this savings she has acquired a small piece of land at the acholi quarters , where she now plans to build a two roomed house that will create more space for the children.

Below is her budget in full:
Bricks 5,000/= @ 60/= 300,000/=
Cement 10 bags @18,000/= 180,000/=
Iron sheets 20 pcs @10,000/= 200,000/=
Timbers 20 pcs @ 5,000/= 100,000/=
Transport 20,000/=v Total 800,000/=

Based on her current income, Nighty will be able to repy this loan in 12 months. She has desig-nated a 1/4 of the interest she pays on this loan to support educational opportunities for Life in Af-rica member children.

loans.use: purchase building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO STOCK HER CLOTHING SHOP

loans.name: Edebor

texts.en: "LAPO has brought joy and peace to my family," says Mrs. Edebor A.. She hails from the ancient city of Benin in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells artwork to the public and requests a loan of USD250 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more artwork to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Business Description: Mónica has a Soda bar inside the school where she works as a teacher. She and her daughter run the business during school recesses by selling to the children of this school. The school parents asked for a place like this for their children, which motivated to begin her business.

Use of Loan: Mónica needs credit to make an extension to the stand to meet the increase of children in school.

Personal Information: She is 36 years old and has three children that study. Her house is made of concrete and she has a stable family situation. She hopes that the growth of her business increases her profits to better her quality of life and assure her children a better education.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: Mónica tiene un Soda bar en el interio de una escuela donde ella labora con maestra y con la ayuda de su hija atiende en hora de recreo a los niños de la misma. Ella empezo su negocio por motivacion de los padres de familia que pedian un lugar como este para atender a sus hijos.

Uso del Préstamo: Monica necesita el credito para hacer una ampliacion de su local pues con el aumento de niños de la escuela se ve en la necesidad de adecuarlo para las circunstancia presentes.

Información Personal: Ella tiene 36 años y tres hijos que estudian y su casa es de cemento tiene estabilidad familiar.Ella aspira que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podra aumentar su ganancias y asi tener mejor calidad de vida y sus hijos tendran una mejor educación.

loans.use: Expand her stand

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha is married and has a 29 year old daughter and a 20 year old son. They are from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Because her husband's salary could not cover the costs of her childrens' schooling, Martha began a business selling cosmetics. Thanks to the high quality of her products, her number of customers and number of sales have both increased over time.

In order to cover the increased demand, Martha is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more merchandise. This will allow her to offer her customers better service. She is committed to repaying this loan within 3 months. Please deciD. to support Martha so that her children will be able to finish their studies!

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es casada y tiene una hija D. 29 años D. edad y un hijo D. 20 años, ellos son originarios D. L. ciudad D. Monterrey, Nuevo León. Ante L. necesidad D. un ingreso extra Martha inició su negocio con L. venta D. cosméticos, porque sus hijos necesitaban cubrir los gastos D. sus estudios y con el salario que obtenía su esposo era imposible, poco a poco gracias a L. buena calidad D. los productos que comercializa y a su gusto por las ventas ha incrementado su número D. clientes así como sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir L. creciente demanda que tiene ahora Martha está solicitando un crédito D. $ 200 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía, lo que le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Martha y contribuye a que estos jóvenes logren culminar sus estudios, todo esto esta en tus manos, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Doña Marizta is 33 years old, has 2 children and her husband works as a janitor in a building in the town of San Cristóbal. She sells tacos (tipical food from the region) from a borrowed stand near her home. She belongs to the group Niño de Atocha 3 together with doña Blanca Torres Ruiz, and doña Olga Parroquia García, who sell shoes from a catalogue, doña María Moreno Guillen, who prepares and sells tamales as a street vendor, and doña Susana López Hernández, who sells fruits, vegetables, and flowers. The loan will be used to buy products so each of their businesses may increase the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

MARITZA, se dedica a la venta de tacos (alimento típico de la zona) en un local que le prestan cerca de su domicilio , ella tiene 33 años , 2 hijos su esposo trabaja como conserje en un edificio en la ciudad de San Cristóbal Ella pertenece al grupo Niño de Atocha 3 junto con doña Blanca Torres Ruiz (venta de zapatos por catálogo) y doña Olga Parroquia García (venta zapatos por catálogo) y doña María Moreno Guillen (hace y vende tamales como vendedor ambulante ) y finalmente Susana López Hernández (vende frutas, verduras y flores) Cada una de ellas espera incrementar las compras de sus productos para vender mas con la ayuda del préstamo obtenido

loans.use: INCREASE PRODUCTION AND SALE OF TIPICAL FOOD

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S., age 48, raises and sells domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks, earning less than $1 per day. Her husband works as a chef at a restaurant, earning on average about $5.80 per day. They have seven children. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase more utensils and kitchen equipment for her husbands work. If he can cook a wider variety of food, she anticipates business will increase and their family’s income will rise. She is pictured with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools to expand their business.

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz is a mother of 4 children. She was born in 1962. This woman lives in the Khachmaz region. She buys hazelnuts from the villages and prepares the kernel of the nuts at her home to sell. Firangiz has run this business for 5 years, to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy hazelnuts to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hazelnuts

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift Agharomi is a 32-year old happily married woman. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State Nigeria.

She sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy a deep freezer so she could sell iced water and blocks of ice. She has been a client of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to sell iced  Water.

loans.name: Bwase East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Elizabeth I.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of clothes. Elizabeth is 28 years old and is divorced. She has 1 child aged 10, who goes to school. Each week, Elizabeth makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to create a better business premise. Elizabeth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Elizabeth is joined in her small group by Juliet Samaeyida and Rose B.. Juliet Samaeyida has a business running a restaurant and wants to boost the business. Rose B. is currently operating a business in new clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To add to clothing business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Señora Epifanía is a member of the Divine Boy Jesus Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of grain (wheat, corn, beans, and vetches) wholesale in the city of Lima. She buys these products in the districts of Caraz, Yunay and Carhuaz.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy 5 bags of corn, 5 bags of beans, 6 bags of wheat and 2 bags of Kiwicha (a native grain of Peru).

She is 70 years old, a widow with 8 children. Her 20 year old son supports her in this business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Epifanía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de cereales (trigo, maíz, haba, arvejas) al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima. Ella compra estos productos en los distritos de Caraz, Yunay y Carhuaz.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, 5 sacos de maíz, 5 sacos de haba, 6 sacos de trigo, 2 sacos de Kiwicha.

Ella tiene 70 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 8 hijos, su hijo de 20 años la apoya en este negocio.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, wheat and Kiwicha ( a native grain of Peru) for resale in her wholesale grain business.

loans.name: Lili Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lili is requesting your financing in order to invest in buying construction materials that will be used to remodel a room in her mother's house located in Zone #6 of Nueva Guinea.

Lili works as a teacher of elementary school. She has been working 6 years for Nerpe Salomón Ibarra Mayorga in the neighborhood San Francisco located 15 km from Nueva Guinea in the rural zone.

She has 3 children, her oldest son is 7 years old and studies the 5th grade level, her daughter is 6 years old and studies the 2nd grade level and her little son is 1 year old. Her husband works on his father's property in a region called El Cojo, which helps with the family expenses.

Lili is an example for all the women that fight for the well-being of their family. Since the distance from her job isn't an obstacle to her continuing to struggle to reach her dreams, her first desire is to buy plot of land and build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lili esta solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción, para remodelar un cuarto en la casa de su mamá ubicada en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea.

Doña Lili se desempeña como docente de educación primaria, labora desde hace 6 años como docente del nerpe salomón Ibarra Mayorga en colonia San Francisco a 15 Km. de Nueva Guinea en la zona rural.

Tiene 3 hijos, su hijo mayor tiene 7 años de edad estudia 5to grado, la niña tiene 6 años estudia 2do grado de educación primaria y el un bebe de 1 añito , su esposo trabaja en la finca de su papá en una comarca llamada El Cojo, él le ayuda en los gastos familiares.

Lili es un ejemplo para todas las mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de su familia ya que la distancia de su trabajo no es impedimento para seguir luchando por sus sueños primeramente su deseo es comprar un solar y construir su propia casa.

loans.use: Remodeling a room of a house

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., 44 years old, joined the Fund since 2006. She has 3 children, 2 of which are still going to school. At first, she borrowed 200 USD and invested in buying tractor for rental to assist local people in practising agriculture. After buying the tractor, her work on the rice field was much less tiring. Her family also earned some profit from renting the tractor. Mrs. M. uses her profit from selling fruits in the market to repay. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to directly invest in selling fruits. She hopes to earn more income since she has more products to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M., 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị còn đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Số vốn vay 200USD ban đầu được chị M. đầu tư mua máy cày phục vụ sản xuất nông nghiệp cho gia đình và cho người dân trong vùng thuê. Sau khi có máy công việc đồng áng của chị M. trở nên thuận lợi hơn rất nhiều. Gia đình cũng có thêm được một khoản thu nhập khi có người thuê máy. Số tiền hoàn trả tuần được chị M. lấy từ số tiền lãi buôn bán hoa quả ngoài chợ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 575USD đầu tư trực tiếp cho công việc buôn bán hoa quả. Với số lượng hàng bán tăng thêm chị hy vọng thu nhập sẽ được nâng lên.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob M. lives in the town of Yavan with his family. He works as a master at the hydro-power plant. He also breeds animals just like a large portion of the rural community. He buys calves and sheep, feeds them and grows them, and then resells them at the same markets. He's been doing this for the last five years. His neighbors offered to sell him a calf at a very low price, that's why he decided to take out a loan and buy the calf, so that the neighbors wouldn't sell it to someone else. This deal will be very profitable for his business and will bring in the necessary income. He will repay the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Мухторов Сухроб проживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей семьей. Работает мастером на ГЭС. Кроме того дополнительно занимается животноводством, как и большая часть населения сельской местности. Покупает молодых бычков и овечек ,откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Его соседи предложили бычка по очень низкой цене и по этой причине он решил получить кредит и купить бычка , чтобы соседи не продали его другим. Это сделка была бы очень выгодна для его бизнеса и дала бы неплохой доход. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi G. is 24 years old and lives in the village of Logodomé. She is married and has two children. Her farmworker husband has great difficulty in meeting the basic needs of the family. As a result, Mrs. G. gives over the income she makes from her small fish business to the daily expenses. This presents an impediment to the development of her business since she has no financial means. She is requesting a loan to stimulate her business in order to draw greater profit from it.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Adjovi est âgée de 24 ans et vit dans le village de Logodomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari cultivateur a beaucoup de difficulté en ce qui concerne la satisfaction des besoins élémentaires de la famille. Pour ce faire, Madame G. Adjovi sacrifice les revenus tirés de son petit commerce de poissons pour les dépenses quotidiennes. Ceci constitue un handicap pour l’évolution de son activité puisqu’elle manque de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite un crédit pour redynamiser son activité afin d’en tirer meilleur profit.

loans.use: Fish sales

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert D. is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for repairs. He is married, but his wife's income as a trader is not sufficient for Robert and their 6 children. Demand for his service is high, and he wants to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem P., age 46, is a true entrepreneur and has a business selling groceries out of her home. She makes $4 a day. Her sister, Horn Thon, is 29 years old, and is a construction worker who builds houses. She typically earns $3 a day in order to support her family. Khem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries for her stand. (Khem is pictured with her sister at her home)

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through Senior High level. Elizabeth sells fabric, lining and other sewing materials. She is a seamstress by profession at Aboom near Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1980. Elizabeth uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials to enable her to meet the increasing demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to purchase more sewing materials to enable her meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Kadiatou Fofana

texts.fr:
Agé de 40 ans Madame K. F. est veuve depuis 2001 qui vit dans une famille nucléaire avec ses deux (2) enfants dans la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana (région de Koulikoro République du Mali).
Avec le décès prématuré de son conjoint, elle devient l’unique soutien de la famille d’où l’intensification de ses activités économiques à savoir l’achat et la vente de chaussures (en plastique, en cuir etc), de sacs à main et de produits cosmétiques depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elle dispose d’une boutique au grand marché de Fana où défilent à longueur de journée les dames et quelques hommes.
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle rentre en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso (qu’elle connue à travers une amie) avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 paires de chaussures (de différentes sortes) pour hommes et femmes et 150 sacs à main pour les femmes auprès des grossistes du grand marché de la ville de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). 
Madame K. F. effectue ses ventes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit (payable mensuellement) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les activités de vente sont importantes en cette période de l’année en raison de la proximité de la fête de tabaski.
Avec ce prêt K. compte réaliser 35.000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour subvenir aux dépenses (frais de nourriture, de santé et d’éducation) de ses deux orphelins.
texts.en:
Madame K. F. is 40 years old and has been a widow since 2001. She lives in a nuclear family with her two children in the city of the sub-prefecture of Fana (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). With the premature death of her husband, she became the only breadwinner, thus the intensification of her work, namely buying and selling shoes (made of plastic, leather, etc.), handbags, and cosmetics over the last five years. She has a shop at the grand marketplace of Fana, where women and some men come and go all day long.

To satisfy better her demanding and burgeoning customer base, she is re-associating herself with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso (that she got to know through a friend) with which she is on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes (of different sorts) for men and women and 150 handbags for women, from wholesalers of the grand marketplace of the city of Bamako (capital of Mali).

Accepting cash or credit (payable monthly) for her goods, Ms. K. F. makes her sales at the retail level to customers composed of men and women. Sales activity is high during this time of year because the Feast of Tabaski is approaching.

With this loan, she intends to realize 35,000 francs CFA of profit per month that will be used essentially to provide for her two orphans (in terms of the costs of food, health, and education).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and handbags

loans.name: Roatha

texts.en: Mrs. Roatha S. lives in Ang Ta Kouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a beautician and her husband, Mr. Hong Vuthy, is a photographer. Their combined income is not enough to provide a better life for the family. Thus, Mrs. Roatha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy steel and timber to build a better house for her family to live in. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy steel and timers to build the house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en:
A. Sabor is the son of A. S.. He is single and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, near the Afghan Hotel. He has a business of selling assorted towels, and thus needs a loan to develop his business since he is quite a beginner at it. 

A. Sabor is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 AFN ($1,075) for a term of 18 months because he wants to expand his business and to buy more clothes to complete the stock for his shop and to start working hard.

He is very grateful for these small loans available in Afghanistan and especially wants to thank Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his business and to buy the necessary stock for it

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah O. bakes and sells loaves of bread at the wholesale and retail levels. The demand for his loaves of bread is high and he hopes to meet those demands by expanding his business. He is requesting a loan of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more raw ingredients for baking additional loaves of bread for resale. Elijah has owned this business for a long time and has established customers.

Elijah is 35-years-old and is married with one child. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw ingredients for baking bread to sell wholesale and retail

loans.name: Mornh

texts.en: Mr. O. is 58 years old and is married with five children, three of which are single and two of which are married. To help meet the family's needs, three of his children are employed, two as garment workers and one as a local carpenter, His wife is named VO. and is 50 years old. The couple currently grows potato, which they will sell once they have matured. They have been running the business for more than four years, a trade passed down from their grandparents. The family's living conditions are not very good because their house needs repairs. Therefore, O. is asking for a $1000 loan to add to his personal savings to repair their old house. (O.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora P. B. is a "sari-sari" or variety store owner. Ten years ago, she started her store using her small savings of PHP 3,000. Because of her strong entrepreneurial spirit, she was able to sustain her business and make it grow. Aside from her sari-sari store, she also owns a multicab. She earns a reasonable profit from her multicab which she uses to feed and clothe her family. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her store. She will also use some of the loan to buy parts and accessories for her multicab.

CEVI provides all their clients the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage. They help their clients start and grow their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya B., 37, is a married mother with two children. Her family used to live in Tuv province, in central Mongolia. In 2005, they moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to find a better life.

Together with her husband Byambasuren, she runs a retail business in their yard. She buys old and broken trailers that hitch to Soviet-style pickup trucks, and her husband repairs and resells them. These are used often to transport a variety of goods between provinces.

They pay 1.5-2.5 million tugrigs (1,500 tugrigs=$1 USD) per broken trailer, and then repair them with new tires and other modifications. The fixed-up trailers fetch 5-7 million tugrigs. Repairing one trailer takes around 2-3 months. With their profits, Enhtuya and her husband built their own summer house last year. In the future, she would like to insulate her house better against the harsh Mongolian winter. With her Kiva loan, Enhtuya plans to buy more tires and other spare parts for her business.

loans.use: Buy tires and spare parts to repair trailers to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita P., 58, is married to Bienvinido, a farmer.  The couple is blessed with seven children and lives in Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  Their source of income is from her husband.  Rosita decided to become a member of Paglaum Co-op to support the needs of her child who is in school.  She has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy a pig, feed and vitamins.  Rosita wishes to improve their lives with her business.

loans.use: Buy pig , feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es comerciante de productos cosméticos de la línea AVON que  comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto; ella es estudiante de la Universidad Salesiana de la Carrera de  Ciencia de la Educación; sus ingresos le permiten cubror su manutención. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa – Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más cosméticos para incrementar su capital de operaciones en la activad que ella tiene.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la calificación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Mariela sells AVON products in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Her income allows her to cover the tuition for a degree in education at the Universidad Salesiana. She lives in her parents' house in Villa Cooperativa – Río Seco, El Alto. She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and increase her working capital. This is her first loan with Impro, but she has been approved for receiving the requested sum.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto tiene 40 años, se caracteriza por su entrega incondicional a su familia para brindarles lo necesario, y como una de sus metas logró adquirir una casa, en la cual habita con sus seres queridos desde hace 20 años. Cuando inició su actividad como comerciante tuvo muchos problemas para adaptarse, ya que  era muy difícil satisfacer las perspectivas de las personas, sobre todo en la compra productos comestibles, rubro que al que él se dedicaba. Con el tiempo su negocio fue mejorando y  aprovechó los años productivos para ahorrar lo necesario para construir su casa e instalar un local donde iniciar un negocio. Ahora este local viene funcionando como avícola, el cual atiende Ernesto con mucha alegría, ya que es el fruto de tantos años de esfuerzo. Sin embargo, en estos últimos días está afrontando algunas dificultades, pero para mejorar su situación económica desea incrementar su mercadería para ampliar su local y convertirla en una distribuidora importante para las pequeñas tiendas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de cada una de las compañeras de su banco comunal, han logrado la confianza de la institución debido a la responsabilidad demostrada. Con los 600 soles que solicita incrementará su negocio con productos de garantía y muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 40, is characterized by his unconditional devotion to his family and to giving them what they need. He achieved one of his goals, getting a house. He has lived in the house with his loved ones for twenty years. When he started as a businessman, he had to adapt to lots of problems. It was very hard to satisfy other people’s point of view, especially in buying food products, which is what he did. With time the business was improving, and he took advantage of the productive years to save what was needed to build his house and set up his business location. This location is now a poultry stand. Ernesto happily tends his stand because it is the fruit of so many years of labor. Nevertheless, he is having problems. To improve his economic situation he wishes to increase his merchandise, expand his location, and become an important distributor to small stores. This is his second loan with MFP. Thanks to the effort, work, and demonstrated responsibility of every one of his colleagues in their community bank, they have gained the institution’s trust. With the 600 PEN that he is asking for he will expand his business with very high quality, guaranteed products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru:
Саиднисо – 39 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей хозтоваров и электроприборов. Она торгует на рынке "Афганбазар" находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Саиднисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 3-4 раза в месяц. Её муж нигде не работает. Он приехал из Росийской Федерации, потому что из за финансового кризиса работодатели ему не оплатили за работу.  Саиднисо уже 4 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Саиднисо расширилась. Саиднисо просит кредит для закупки новых видов экономичных лампочек. Тогда у Саиднисо увеличится ассортимент ее товара.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Saidiniso is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of household goods and electric appliances. She sells at the Afganbazar market located in the Panchshanbe district of the Khujand city. Saidiniso acquires her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She travels there 3-4 times per month. Her husband is not employed. He returned from the Russian Federation because his employers there could no longer pay him due to the financial crisis. Saidiniso has been a borrower with us for 4 years. When she started her business, she had a limited quantity of merchandise. Since then, Saidiniso expanded her business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase new types of energy-efficient light bulbs. This will allow Saidiniso to further increase her goods assortment. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of energy-efficient light bulbs

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Genoveva es viuda, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Genoveva vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores, además Genoveva vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio Abraham Valdelomar de manera ambulatoria.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener una tienda y que sus hijas culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The name of Genoveva’s Community Bank is Suni, which means abundant in Quechua. Genoveva is 40, a widow, and has two children. Genoveva sells wood in her house. She gets the wood from wood producers. Genoveva also sells sweets as a street vendor in the entrance to the Abraham Valdelomar School. Genoveva needs a loan for 1,250 PEN to buy wood. Genoveva’s dreams are to have a store and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
