Her businesses are performing well as she is the only person doing the welding and sale of water business in the area.

loans.use: With the money that Phyllis has requested, she plans to improve her welding business and the paraffin one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Afi Dede

texts.en: Afi K. lives in Nkurankan, Ghana. She works with agricultural produce such as yams, cassava, plantain and smoked fish. She has four children in her care. To raise enough income to enable her to take care of them, she is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva, through Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan B. of 42 years of age, wife of 48 years, is a member of Achal Mohila Somity. She has one daughter and three sons. She and her husband set up factory in her won residence. She prepares 7 different types of biscuits and bread. Her husband and 2 sons assist her in purchasing raw materials and supplying finished biscuits bread to different food shops in Gazipur district. 

She is doing fine and wants to increase more production. She will purchase more raw materials and equipments for the factory. She requires US $ 1,175.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and equipments.

loans.name: Nicolasa Ambrosio

texts.en:
Nicolasa Ambrosio C. Velasco is 55 and has lived through some pretty rough times. During the violent years of the 1980’s civil war in Guatemala her house was burned to the ground and her father-in-law was tortured and killed. It still near enough that it brings tears to her eyes when she discusses the subject. But right now she’s making do with her several businesses: she raises chickens and pigs, weaves the traditional Mayan top called a huipil, and even has a little tiny store that carries sugar, soap, and other such daily necessities. She’ll use this loan to increase her animal production, adding 15 chickens and 3 pigs. The chickens will be half for laying eggs and half for later sale for meat. Nicolasa can make about US$4.00/week of profit on her eggs, a significant boost.

Nicolasa and her husband have 9 children, most grown, but with two daughters (13 and 16) still at home. Their 16-year-old is deaf, a significant challenge in a culture with no deaf-specific education. Most of the kids have received at least an elementary education. Nicolasa never did get much education, despite her dad’s best efforts. He would take her to school, but she would hide and not go in. She did get just enough to be able to read and sign her name.

Nicolasa’s husband commutes every day to Guatemala City, where he works in a flower company. The two of them do have some health problems at this time of their life; she has gastritis and he has high blood pressure. But they’re doing pretty well, and she can walk all the way up a a pretty remote road to her home far above the highway. Her dream is to develop the store into a much larger concern, with all of the items needed for daily living.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Nicolasa attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase 15 chickens, 2 pigs, and yarn for weaving

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.en:
Evelyn Patricia L. D. has been selling good quality clothes and shoes for 5 years. Her best customers are clerks, who need to dress nicely for work. The Christmas season has started, and sales will be very good during this season.

Evelyn Patricia is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts, blouses, dressing-gowns, and shoes to increase her sales. She is a single mother with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, and she wants to increase her income to pay the school expenses.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli H. is 31 years old, married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy supplies she needs to run her fast food  business. She sells at the local school every week and makes a profit of 160 Tala ($64 USD) per day which is a great financial help to her family. Kalameli hopes to use her next loan to build a special place to sell. She is very happy to be in the loan program and hopes to remain in it for a long time.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her fast food stall

loans.name: Alejandra Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandra´s main business is threefold : a bakery, wholesale and retail bread distibutor. She has a stall in the local market and a small general store in her home selling food and refreshments. This entrepeneur started her businesses with her own savings.

Her permanent stall in Leon´s market sells bread wholesale and retail. She is a single mom with a child currently studying in high school that she wants to provide for.

Ceprodel has been at her side financially with 19 loans in the last three and a half years. All the loans have been duly returned. We are glad to have been an instrument to help Mrs.Alejandra and her family better their living conditions through her bread sales.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Cathérine A. was born on 5 May 1973 in Adidogomé. She did not have the chance to socialize much - at a young age, she helped her parents in working in the fields and at home. Having become an adult, she has never had the chance to learn a trade. She obtained her first loan to sell earrings, and so now she is no longer entirely dependent on her husband. Moreover, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Married and the mother of one (1) child, she has another child of her husband's in her care. Dynamic and honest, she was able to repay her first loan without problems, and is now asking for another one. This new request for $200 will allow her to go to the Cotonou market in Accra to sell jewelry, bracelets, and other goods. With this income, she hopes to do more for her family, especially the children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Cathérine est née le 05 mai 1973 à Adidogomé. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. A bas âge, elle aidait les parents dans les travaux champêtres et domestiques. Devenue majeure et n’ayant appris aucun métier. Elle sollicita un premier crédit pour la vente de boucles d’oreilles, et aujourd’hui elle ne dépend plus entièrement de son mari. D’ailleurs elle contribue plus aux charges de la famille. Mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant, elle a un autre enfant de son mari en charge. Dynamique et honnête, elle a pu rembourser normalement son crédit et sollicite un autre. Cette nouvelle demande de $200 va lui permettre à faire le marché de Cotonou et d’Accra pour la vente des bijoux, bracelets et autres. Avec les revenus, elle espère faire plus à la famille surtout aux enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on and sell earrings

loans.name: Kyebando Central B(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deborah K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and selling matooke. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Deborah is 38 years old and is married to her husband, who is a driver for work. She has 1 child of age 15, who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Deborah is joined in her small group by Alice Bulule, Betty N., Jalia N., and Sylvia N.. Alice Bulule has a business in poultry farming and wants to order more chicks and buy chicken feed. Betty N. is currently operating a beauty parlor business and wants a loan to add to the business. Jalia N. operates a business of selling clod drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Sylvia N. is currently in the business of carpentry and is requesting a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To add to her business and stock more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria, 46, studied to be an accountant. She has three children who still live with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She started her business selling "shambar" (a traditional dish of the city of Trujillo), an idea that was born because there were a lot of people in the area from Trujillo, and beer which she also sold. Later, she started selling beauty products. She's now added earrings, necklaces and other handmaD. items to the products she sells.

Maria belongs to the Rey D. Reyes ("King of Kings") community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought supplies to make shambar along with beauty products for resale. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 10 cases of beer along with perlitas, ribbons, buttons and lace to make the products she makes by hand. Her greatest wish is to aircondition her house and set up a space for selling fruit, yogurt and the beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Esther Martínez S. D. García tiene 46 años D. edad, estudio la carrera D. contabilidad. Tiene en total tres hijos que aun dependen D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Moche en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Su negocio se inicia con la venta D. shambar (plato típico D. la ciudad D. Trujillo), la idea nace porque en la zona llegaron personas que realizaban trabajos urbanos, además tenia algunas cajas D. cerveza, el cual también ofrecía. Posteriormente ingreso a la línea D. productos D. belleza. Actualmente la señora Maria Esther se dedica también a la elaboración D. aretes y collares y otros productos manuales.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey D. Reyes” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo tipo D. menestras para la elaboración del shambar además algunos productos D. belleza para tener en stock. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 10 cajas D. cerveza así también perlitas, cintas, botones y blondas para elaborar algunas manualidades. Su mayor sueño es acondicionar e implementar su casa para vender ensalada D. fruta, yogurt y los productos D. belleza.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. T. B. lives in the Santa Ana of Juigalpa neighborhood in Chontales, Nicaragua with his family composed of 4 children and his wife. Nowadays all his children go to school, because of his own efforts he has been able to start a bakery that allows him to support his family, his desire is to make progress in his business and with this loan he plans to buy raw material (flour, baking powder, butter, etc.) that will allow him to develop his business and answer the demands of his local customers in the urban area of Juigalpa; historically his relatives have worked in this field, this has enabled him to have an established clientele and continue developing his family environment.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. T. Bermúdez, habita en el Barrio Santa Ana de Juigalpa, Chontales junto a su familia compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposa; actualmente todos sus hijos van al colegio, por esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer un taller de panadería que le brinda el sostén familiar, su deseo es de progresar y a través de esta solicitud de financiamiento pretende comprar materia prima (harina, polvo de hornear, mantequilla, etc.) que le permita desarrollarse y dar respuesta a su demanda localizada en el casco urbano de Juigalpa; históricamente su descendencia familiar ha laborado en este trabajo, lo que le ha permitido tener la clientela establecida y seguir desarrollando su entorno familiar.

loans.use: To buy raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is looking for a loan to invest in improvements for his house, such as plastering walls and adding a floor. For the past sixteen years, he has worked as a security guard at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital. He also dedicates himself to farming on a small lot, an activity he conducts on the weekends and on his days off. Despite not having the opportunity to attend school, he has been a hardworking and responsible man who has worked in the country to obtain basic food necessities to augment the small income he earns. He has five daughters and one son, all of whom are in school. His wife works at a packing plant and helps with the household expenses. His dreams are to have a dignified dwelling and that his children finish their educations so they can become professionals and find stable employment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco está solictando el crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es repellar y poner piso a su casa de habitación. Trabaja para el hospital Jacinto Hernández como guarda de seguridad desde hace 16 años, tambien se dedica a cultivar diversos cultivos en una pequeña parcela los fines de semana y los dias libres que tiene. A pesar que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ha sido un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado en el campo para así obtener los alimentos básicos como apoyo a los ingresos que él obtiene, tiene 5 hijas mujeres y 1 hijo varón, actualmente todos están estudiando. Su esposa trabaja en una empresa empacadora de quequisque y aporta con los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna que la familia amerita, y que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales de bien y tengan estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Plaster the walls and install a floor in his house.

loans.name: Bibijamilya

texts.ru:
Jamilya R. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 30 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and is the sole breadwinner of her family. She works at the Bahor market in Vahdat. She has a vending lot where she sells fruit and vegetables. She buys goods wholesale and sells them retail. Se has already been in this business for ten years. To increase sales, she would like to get a loan. She plans to repay the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Рашидова Джамиля жительница города Вахдат. Джамиле 30 лет . Она не замужем и детей не имеет. Живет с родителями и сама полностью обеспечивает свою семью. Работает на рынке «Бахор» города Вахдат.Имеет торговую точку где продает овощи и фрукты. Скупает товар у оптовых торговцев и продает в розницу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. В данный момент хочет увеличить товарооборот , поэтому решила обратиться к нам за получением кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Gbassivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Gbassivi B. (née Ego), born in 1972 in Egocopé, is a storekeeper who currently lives in Logodomé in the Vo prefecture. She is married and has three children. In view of her increasing business, she is requesting financing in order to sell food products. She plans to use this funding to develop her business, and she will then be able to improve the living conditions of her family and most particularly ensure that her children can go to school, since their father’s meager income falls short of meeting all the household expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Gbassivi née EGO en 1972 à Egocopé, est une commerçante qui vit actuellement à Logodomé précisément dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Vu l’évolution de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour vendre des produits alimentaires. Par ce financement, elle compte progresser dans son commerce et sera capable d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants car leur papa par son maigre revenu n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la maison.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Mrs. Adita belongs to the “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Street Lino Velázquez Mzc. Lt.2, in the Yarina Cocha District, Department of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and has 4 children. She decided to invest in food sales with the first loan of 300 soles ($125) that she received from Manuela Ramos. Adita goes out to sell her food every night on the patio of her house and her customers are very happy to be able to savor the exquisite flavor that only she knows how to make. With this loan of 1,500 soles ($525), which she will repay over 5 months, she will buy two dozen chickens, condiments, and ingredients to prepare her food. Adita is a very enterprising woman who knows how to get ahead. She has succeeded in educating her children and feels very grateful because an organization like Manuela Ramos has trusted her and given her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adita, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Jr. Lino Velásquez Mzc Lt.3, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre de 4 hijos. Adita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida. Adita sale a vender su comida todas las noches en el patio de su casa, sus clientes se siente muy contentos con ellos de saborear ese exquisito sazón que solo ella sabe hacerlo. Con este préstamo de S/ 1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 doc. Pollos (aves), condimentos y víveres para que pueda preparar su comida. Adita es una mujer muy emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante, ha logrado la educación de sus hijos y se siente agradecida porque una institución como Manuela Ramos haya confiado en darle un crédito.

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Mr. Khen Y., 52, lives in Orchar Commune in the Battambang Province with his wife, Mrs. Kimchhean Chhun, 48. He has been working as a chief construction worker since 1998 and currently earns around US $7.00 per day. His wife stays home to care for children and cook food for the family. They have four children, one of whom is married. The others live in the family home and help support the family. One sells groceries and another one is a car repairer who earns around US $1.50 per day.

In order to increase the family's income, Khen wants his wife to be able to have a business selling porridge from their house. Khen would like to request a loan to purchase ingredients for making porridge and to decorate his house for selling porridge.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making porridge and to decorate his house for selling porridge

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo Group 4

texts.en:
"Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo" is a group of 20 women, of whom 5 are applying for their first loan. Crucita S. is the group representative. She is an older woman with two older children. When you look at her you can tell she has been through a lot in her life. She has lived in the same community for many years, and for her entire life she has been living day to day without a steady income. She is excited to do something different with her life and is ready to make a change and start to better her life. She hopes to help her children out of their poverty some day as well. 

Crucita plans on opening a small cafe and dreams of having a big coffee shop some day. She and the rest of the group are all ready for the first step towards bettering their lives! On behalf of Crucita, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Open a small cafe

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. F. is a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband have one child who is currently in school. She is a petty trader, and she has been in the trading business for the past 4 years. More specifically, she trades in spices such as peppers and onions at a table in the local market. Judith proudly states that her business has enabled her to support her child's school expenses.

Even so, she is seeking a loan to expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory. In particular, she would like to buy more bags of peppers and onions. Accordingly, she hopes to double her savings to continue to take care of her child in school and to cover other family expenses.

Judith is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her trading business by purchasing additional bags of peppers and onions.

loans.name: Mr. Boy Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people from Tuol Tbaeng village in Takeo Province have grouped themselves for a village bank loan and Mr. Boy U. is the village bank president. He is a bicycle repairman. His wife, Mrs. Heng Sothea, is a fish breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and Mr. Boy U. decided to ask for a loan for his wife to buy fish for her  breeding business. He hopes that her business will increase their income and provide a better life for their family. He is 25 years old and a father of a child who is still too young to work or study. Mr. Boy U. did not come to take the loan, so his wife appears in the group picture in his stead.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fish for his wife's fish breeding business.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Lucina A. tiene 42 años, vive con sus dos hijos, quienes le ayudan en el negocio familiar, que es la venta de ropas usadas, este negocio es vital para la familia, ya que es su sustento diario. 
Ellos comenzaron el negocio aproximadamente hace 10 años, ella es madre y padre para sus hijos.
Los dos estudian gracias a su trabajo. Ella necesita de este crédito para seguir creciendo en capital económico y social, ya que indirectamente también ayuda a otras familias, pues da trabajo a otras señoras de la zona. En el futuro desea construir su propio salón, y así ampliar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Lucina A. is 42 years old. She lives with her two children, who help her in the family business, which is the sale of used clothes. This business is vital for the family, since it provides their daily living. They began the business approximately 10 years ago. She is both mother and father for her children. The two children study thanks to her work. She needs this loan to continue growing in social and economic capital, since she also helps other families indirectly by giving work to other ladies of the area. In the future she wants to build her own salon, and thus expand her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, bermuda shorts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia S. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian woman. She is a poultry keeper at Makangarawe Ward in Dar es Salaam. She raises poultry for both cooking and for laying eggs. Her poultry produces ten trails of eggs per day. She sells eggs to retailers for domestic use and to cafes and restaurants. She requests a loan of Tshs 800,000. ($600) to construct more poultry cages.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is a mother of four. She is 35 years old and married. She lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria. Joke sells cooked foods and her restaurant is very popular within her community. She also sells drinks and bottled water. She has been in this business for the past five years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
D. Shuhrat is married and the father of 2 children. An electrician by training, he left this trade in favor of truck farming,  a very profitable business that requires significant financial means. Today he needs to expand his cultivatable land and increase his revenues. Shuhrat seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him to increase his production and better satisfy his clientele. 

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes,  is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and to a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela B. is a resident of Biasong, Misamis, Occidental and has been a member of Paglaum MPC under its microfinance program at Golden Pot Center since 2004. Mrs. B. is a member in good standing and has experienced more than ten loan cycles.

Mrs. B.’s business started with PHP 3,000 capital for a sari-sari store. She managed her business well. Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional sacks of rice for her store because as she is a licensed NFA rice retailer. She dreams of renovating her store into a concrete one.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Cris F. is 40 years old, married and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She has three children. In light of the global crisis, her husband sought work, and eventually he was employed but far from his family. At first she experienced difficulty and had to make a big adjustment. In order to help her husband, she began to buy and sell fashion jewelry (silver). It was a good decision because she earns additional income. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Most of her sales come from orders, so 98% is sold already. Aside from fashion jewelry, she is also a dealer of Natasha, MSE & Avon Products. Today, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of fashion jewelry such as silver. Someday, she aims to have a store for fashion jewelry.

loans.use: Buy fashion jewelry

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel vive con su esposa y dos hijos en un terreno construido en la ciudad de Nava Coahuila que su mama la señora Xochitl G. les regalo.
El trabaja en una empresa en el área de chofer de maquinaria con una antigüedad de 2 años.
Son una familia establecida en su casita, pero la familia esta creciendo y cada día requieren de mas espacio; por esta razón es que están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de un cuarto y así ir dándole a la familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel lives with his wife and two children on land his mother, Xochitl G., gave them in the city of Nava Coahuila. He has worked for a local company as a machine operator for two years. As a family, they are very vested in their home, but the family is growing and every day they need more space. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to build a new room and give his family more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room at the rear of home

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Don Bismarck  labora como guarda de seguridad en la escuela Francisco Aaron Joce desde hace 6 años  este cliente tiene dos hijos  el mayor de 11  años estudia su tercer grado y la niña menor de 7 añitos estudia 2 do grado de educación primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitación y asi tener mejor comodidad en su casa,  en los dias libre  trabaja como agricultor cultivando la tierra para asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, tiene munchos deseos de superación personal se caracteriza por se muy humilde, trabajador, honesto  bien responsable con sus deberes, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos son una familia  muy unida,  Su sueño es  tener una casa con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano aspira, tener salud,trabajo y que su hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer personas de bien.
texts.en:
Don Bismarck has been working as a security guard for the school Francisco Aaron Joce for 6 years. He has two children, the oldest, 11, is in third grade and the girl, 7 years-old, is in second grade. He is requesting refinancing of his 4th loan to be invested in building a room and thus improve the comfort of home. On his free time he works as a farmer to improve his family's living conditions. His wife is responsible for the chores. He wishes to achieve personal improvement, he is humble, hard-working, honest, and very responsible with his duties. In spite of being a family of restricted economic resources, it is a very united family. His dream to to have a house with better conditions, which every citizen wants, have health, work, and that his children study to become good individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
"B. Ngô Thị (20203050089) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 16 (16).

B. is married and has 5 school-aged children. To making a living, B. works in someone else's business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $84) a month from these activities.

B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 dong which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. The loan will be the 1st loan she has taken out from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Palapala

texts.en:
Palapala F., 64, is married with five children. She is in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Palapala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 32 years old and a married mother of three beautiful children. She lives with her husband and children in a single room apartment. She is a forceful achiever and is very committed to her work. She trades in assorted soaps and detergent, and she also sells sachet water in bulk. Eva takes delivery of soap from the nearby city of Kumasi. Mostly she sells her goods by hawking them at market centers and from house to house. Due to the nature of her business she has become very popular in her community. However, lack of adequate funds means that she is not able to buy more stock, making it difficult to make enough profit. Eva desires to save more for her children's education, and with her two years of selling experience she is sure that she can repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted soaps, detergents and sachet water

loans.name: Aufaatasi

texts.en:
Aufaatasi J. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Saleilua. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aufaatasi operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale. Aufaatasi has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aufaatasi  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aufaatasi  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Aufaatasi  is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Aufaatasi from SPBD. Aufaatasi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells clothes, sarongs and bags. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more clothes and sarongs. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lafia sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kamalen Sirakoro I’ un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire, tous les passés ont été bien remboursés.  Elles font la vente de tasses, de pomme de terre, de  condiments alimentaires, de pommes  et de tissus.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 colis de tasses, 15 sacs de pomme de terre, 20 cartons de pomme, des condiments alimentaires et 20 pièces de pagne wax.
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako et dans le grand marché de Sikasso ville et  vendent à domicile, dans  les différents marchés de Sikasso au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et de quelques  forains.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles ambitionnent d’aider leur mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et d’autres pour acheter une moto pour leur déplacement.
texts.en:
The women of the Lafia group are all married and have an average age of 33 and on average, 3 children. They live in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro I, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on the 11th solidarity loan, all past loans having been reimbursed correctly. They sell basins, potatoes, condiments, apples and fabrics.

With their new loan, they intend to buy 10 packs of basins, 15 sacks of potatoes, 20 cartons of apples, some condiments, and 20 lengths of African “wax cloth”.

They do their buying in Bamako and in the big market of Sikasso town and they sell out of their homes and in the various marketplaces of Sikasso, for cash, retail, and for credit to a clientele composed of women, men, and some itinerant merchants. They expect to make a monthly average profit of 35,000 F CFA, of which a part will be used for savings and family needs and the rest invested back into their businesses.

Some of them aspire to help their husbands in supporting the children; others hope to buy a motorbike to use as transport.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Humura Kisomoro Kajumba Gertrude Group

texts.en: K. Gertrude is a single woman of fifty years old. She is in a business of selling smoked meat to people and she has been in this business for over ten years. She has five children and of which two are school going and she has one dependent schooling too. She wants to add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell Smoked meat on large scale to expand her business. She is so encouraging and active business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell smoked meat on large scale to expand her business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mrs. Suy S. is a local chef. She is also hired by people who need her to cook food for their parties. She is 59 and a widowed mother who has given birth to two daughters. One of the daughters is married and one is single. Suy S. also depends on other income from her both daughters who are garment workers for industry at Phnom Penh. Because Suy S. doesn’t have her own motorcycle, she always needs to pay much money for a taxi. To help facilitate transportation, Suy S. requested a loan of US$300 to buy an old motorcycle, which she will use to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle

loans.name: Zesenjargal

texts.en: Zesenjargal E. and his wife operate a consumer goods trading business out of a shipping container at a local market. They sell a variety of common household goods to their customers. They purchase most of their goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, transporting them back to their market to sell. E. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son is in kindergarten and his wife, Munkhsaikhan, helps out with the family business. E. started his business in 2007 and has quickly established himself in the local business community. He hopes to soon expand his business and increase his earnings. He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Feisal

texts.en:
Feisal, 34, is married to Ann Mukumbu and they have a 2-year-old child.  He has run his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a client. This will be his first loan with the organization, and he plans to use the loan to add more goat and chicken meat to sell to customers.

In the future, Feisal plans to open a restaurant to run alongside his butcher shop. He hopes the extra profits he will earn as a result of this loan will contribute to this goal.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun M. is 23 years old and lives with her young child and her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make about $3 of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a motor-taxi driver. He typically makes $7 per day. Khun M. is asking for a $700 loan for her husband, who needs to purchase a new trailer.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Faith Njeri

texts.en:
Faith is a 29 year old single mother, with a daughter aged 4. She was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She has no loan history with other MFI's. Faith has been operating a retail shop for the past 5 years and also does dairy farming as her other source of income. Faith plans to utilize the loan to purchase more stock for her shop to satisfy her customers' demand.

Faith's hopes and dreams are to own a farm and dig a bore-hole to be used as a source of extra income by selling water to the local community. She describes herself as a business-minded lady, visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock (maize, rice, detergent) to her general retail shop

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a fishing community, in the central region of Ghana. Christiana works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She runs a chop bar in her community. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Christiana has been in business for two years and desires to improve upon her business. She desires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food items for the business.
